Reviews.Title: “highly recommend the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seaspirit
Reviews.Content: My partner & I spent the weekend at the Orchard and we cannot say enough about the hospitality and accommodations for the price. Everything was immaculate and everyone made us feel welcome. We will definitely be returning to the Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to Ranking at TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: WaimerTraveller
Reviews.Content: Checked in on my wife's birthday. Large, clean, comfortable, very convenient location. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Steep Hills”
Reviews.Author: akusah
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights (Feb. 3 & 4) at the Orchard Hotel. Hotel was nice, rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and quickly answered questions. The only drawbacks were that the hotel is up a couple of steep hills, which are a natural part of San Francisco. I would discourage anyone with any challenges walking uphill to stay here. Otherwise, it was a good experience. Second, I asked about half day rates as I had a red-eye flight that night. Half day rates here are only until 4:00 p.m., not 6:00 p.m. as in some other hotels. If you are flying west to east on a night flight this might be a deterrent. Enjoy otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Utahwoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in late January. Staff very friendly and accommodating to requests. Nice room with bay window view of the cable cars and the Mark Hopkins Hotel. Location perfect for using public transportation (cable cars) and for shopping in and around Union Square. Restaurant staff also very friendly; ate there twice: one night food was just so, so but the last night it was very tasty with excellent service. I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ntomlinson
Reviews.Content: My finance & I stayed 1 night at the Orchard Hotel. We didn't think it was the nicest hotel we've stayed in. The only few good things was the location, the room size & the staff were very friendly. The bed was as hard as a rock & the shower was dirty. It took us 2 calls to downstairs for them to give us the correct password to get the free internet access to work. Once we got the correct password, it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: strife
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Central in San Fran, clean rooms, friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great value for SF”
Reviews.Author: ribbie
Reviews.Content: We picked the Orchard after reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor, and it met our expectations for a centrally located hotel in a safe area of SF. As a boutique hotel, it doesn't have a lot of amenities, but if you're just looking for a comfortable room, this works great. The room and bathroom were large for the city, and we really appreciated the free internet and DVD rentals they offer. We did find the walls were a little thin, and had a problem with noisy neighbors up late talking, coming/going down the hall after midnight. But after a call to the front desk, the problem was resolved and we never had another issue the rest of our 4 night stay. The staff was very professional and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: Nicely located hotel just up the hill from union square. It's a boutique but seems to have a lot of services of a larger hotel (never a problem getting a cab, arranged my taxi back to the airport w/o a hitch). the rooms were a good deal i thought ($200 something for a king room w/separate sitting/desk area), free wireless and a good, included, breakfast buffet. the furnishings seemed a little out of place (traditional when i think of boutique as more hip) but the bathrooms were huge and overall i had a great stay. I've recommended it to others and they have stayed and enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Fiona_Andy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights from 26th -28th December $189 per night. Really pleased with the location as close to all the shops and Union Square. It is on Bush Street, just off Powell Street where there is a Cable Car stop. You can buy your Day travel card $11 from Walgreen across the street ($5 single journeys on Cable cars). We got the BART from the airport for $5 each, and decided to walk uphill up Powell Street (10 mins) which was fine until we reached the last block which was really steep pulling our bags! Extrememly welcoming at the Front desk and they also gave us a room on one of the top floors as we'd requested to have it quieter. We could still hear the morning noise from the street, but it is a city location! Fairly large room with large bathroom, not so soft toilet paper though. Shower over shallow bath was fine, always hot water. Very large comfortable bed. There's free internet on a laptop in the reception. Free USA Today newspaper in the morning outside your room. There are a couple of diners within one block. It was also only about 3 blocks from Avis car hire - we booked a car online from the UK for only Â£36 (GBP) for 24 hours one way. We booked our trip to Alcatraz online before we went which is worth doing. We went for the 5:15pm departure (took a tram to Pier 33) as the evening ones were recommended. However I think if you went earlier in the day you might be able to look round the grounds too. We also didn't have time to attend the talk on Escapes which was a shame. The Cable Car musuem is worth a visit - free entry.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, pricing was good value and room was bigger than postage stamp”
Reviews.Author: Frequent-flyer0811
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the Friday before New Years and stayed until the day after New Years...and had a very nice stay. The hotel is not fancy...it is not the Four Seasons but it also doesn't have the price tag of the Four Season's either. It seems to be a newer hotel...doesn't have that musty smell that some of the older hotels have...and is small without being too small. We had a huge bathroom...and the Aveda products were also a nice touch especially considering we forgot to bring some of our travel products. Also the front desk was very helpful....including keeping our bags for us and arranging a shuttle for the airport on short notice. The location was great! The Powell trolly runs right past and we could hear the cute little ding of the trolly car without it getting too annoying and being noisy. In fact- after reading some of the reviews I was some what nervous about noise level...but we heard nothing...not the garbage truck (that another reviwer had heard at 4am) or any of our other neighbors. It was fun being so close to everything in Union Square...espeically with New Years eve happening...it was very conviently located to everything we wanted to do. Also- there is a great little cafe located on the corner of Powell and Bush that was nice for breakfast. :)

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect SF Getaway”
Reviews.Author: spycygrl
Reviews.Content: Having lived in SF for 10 years, I tend to be pretty hard on the hotels there. On the whole, they are overpriced (tho often glamourous) and you always have to pay some exorbitant fee for parking when you arrive from out of town. The Orchard changes all my thinking. Just off Union Square, this boutique property has all of the amenities (and then some) of the larger properties just up the hill (i.e. Fairmont, Mark Hopkins) without the price tag and snooty staff. The lobby is tiny but nice and upon check-in, the staff was phenomenally kind. While the room was a tad small, it's not much smaller than a standard SF room elsewhere and as there were only 2 of us, it's not like we needed a suite! The bed and pillows were wonderful and the beds had DUVETS (which I'm an enormous fan of -- DOWN with those gross bacteria-filled coverlets!). There were spa robes in the closet for each of us (tho, one of them was starting to come apart a little at the belt loop) and the bathroom was extremely spacious and well-appointed with Aveda products and fluffy towels. The hotel provides DVDs for in-room use and has a pretty expansive library of new releases and classics. The staff is so helpful that when my boyfriend and I rolled in at around 1 a.m. in NEED of some late-night food, we were directed immediately to a diner up the street which satisfied our cravings. The location is fantastic and you can walk to everything (Chinatown, shopping, restaurants, bars). North Beach was a minimal $5 cab ride away. Despite having a view of another building (the standard view in a big city), the hotel was VERY VERY quiet. Our parking was taken care of by parking in the Sutter-Stockton garage merely 1 block away on Bush. The hotel only has valet and charges $34 overnite, but if you arrive on a Saturday after 6 and leave on Sunday any time after 7 a.m., the fee is only $15. I am thrilled to have discovered this fantastic little hotel (thank you, TripAdvisor!) and I know we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Hoped for more”
Reviews.Author: jdrussell
Reviews.Content: I went on Orbitz.com to book the hotel and was quite excited after reading the reviews and seeing pictures of the hotel. Arrival and check in was a breeze but the room was not what I expected. The bed was terribly uncomfortable, the room was small, and the view was terrible. It's very close to the action, but next time I will spend a couple extra bucks to stay somewhere I know I will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: HTS
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay there while in town on business 12/07. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Good location right off Union Square. Very close to China Town entrance. Nice big bathrooms. I would stay there again on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Loved everything”
Reviews.Author: mummerh
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for us. The rooms were very clean and the beds were amazingly comfortable. Breakfast was provided with everything from pastries to waffles to ham and eggs. Chinatown was only a couple of blocks away as was the streetcar stop and any kind of shopping you could want. The staff was very helpful and gave us advise about how to get around as well as what to see and how to get there. We will always stay at the Orchard when we visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MommaKay
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise! The hotel is right in the middle of town, 2 blocks from Union Square, and right next to the trolley cars. The staff was friendly and very helpful with directions. The room was lovely and they carried Aveda bath products! Great price for a nice getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: juno361
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Very reasonable rates, great spacious rooms, and very helpful staff, especially Joseph! The location couldn't be better. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staffs & Service!”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeLion
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 from Asia and stayed here for three nights in December 17 on our final leg of our USA vacation to see some sights and do some shopping. Due to unavailability of our preferred hotel, we decided to book into this hotel on arrival day via the hotel web site for a King Suite. The location couldn't be better just a few blocks uphill from Union Square... The nicest experience we had in this hotel was actually the front desk, door service and housekeeping staffs. They are very friendly, efficient and responsive to any request. Coming from Asia where we pride our service quality standards, I must say the service excellent & deliverable quality of the hotel met expectation!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: messacar
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean hotel in a good location. The bellman and front desk staff were very friendly and responsive (except a hint of trepidation when I asked for an extra hour at checkout). Need a taxi to go to a business appoitnment and the bellman had a limo (that I think was at the service of hotel guests) take me there...free of charge! I would definitely keep the Orchard on my short list of hotels to stay at in the Union Square vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “loved it...except...”
Reviews.Author: laurence3
Reviews.Content: i contacted the hotel directly after reading the great reviews here. i got a great rate. i arrived very early and my room was ready, all of my requests were granted (feather bed and high floor on a quiet street), the staff was great and the location amazing. it was all a 10++ and i was so excited that i found this gem. THEN...at 4:30 a.m. i was awakened to the invasive sound of loud trash trucks which continued for a half an hour. i called the front desk to complain and i was told the trucks come every morning on both sides of the hotel property at 4:30. i repeated this complaint to the front desk at check out and was told the same thing. how can people function after a night of that kind of sleep? i am so sad to say that i can never return because of the interruption of sleep that is sure to occur here.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the orchard hotel”
Reviews.Author: amyrossdds
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel was great. Close proximity to several attractions. Staff was friendly and gracious. Rooms were very nice, with good sized bathrooms. Would recommend. Only downside was no onsite parking, but only a block away, so not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: 3-sacrowd
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was not all that great. I paid a lot of money only to listen to a party in the lounge (on the first floor) in my room on the 5th floor. After a long day, I was exhausted and at midnight the party downstairs was still going strong. I felt sorry for the people who had rooms on floors 2, 3 & 4!! The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. Thank goodness the lounge manager was nice and quick with our drinks! The man at the front desk tried very hard for about 20 minutes to get us reservations for dinner somewhere close, but he could not. We ended up walking about 15 feet outside the hotel door and found a wonderful Italian resturant that was completely empty!! Yumm. The valet service that was included in my room price I thought would be great, except that the valet was nowhere to be found when I arrived. My car had to be double parked on the street for about 15 minutes while the front desk checked me in - very slow. I finally convinced someone to call the valet to come and park the car and was then told that the hotel was very busy for the evening and the next day and that for the unlimited "in and out" service that I paid for I would need to be sure to give them at least 1/2 hour each time. I could have gotten a decent hotel room for a lot less, but this hotel came recommended by a relative and the website looked fantastic. I guess I have learned my lesson.

Reviews.Title: “We live in SF and just came home from a great weekend at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: alippa
Reviews.Content: We decided to treat our family of 4 with a weekend get away downtown for shopping and dining and relaxation. We have small children, ages 5 and 7, and the whole family looked forward to this weekend with great anticipation. We dined at the Tonga Room and Mortons, we shopped, we saw the tree lit up in Union Square, and we had a fabulous time at the Orchard Hotel. We stayed in the king suite on the 5th floor, with its yellow stripedy walls, and huge bathroom, and TWO tvs for a family that doesn't always want to watch the Backyardigans or CNN together. Actually, yesterday afternoon we watched Hairspray on the hotel DVD player. We took the cable car (the stop is right outside the hotel) over the hill to Fishemen's Wharf yesterday morning and then came back for lunch at Le Central before taking a nap Saturday afternoon. The room was spacious and clean, and very quiet especially given its location right in the middle of downtown. It was so nice to be tourists in our own city. The price at the Orchard can't be beat, and since it is such a great hotel we won't be going to any other hotels for the next family weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Poetmotion
Reviews.Content: When I saw this hotel rated #2 on Trip Advisor in the entire city of San Francisco, I decided to give it a try. The quick verdict: having spent perhaps 50 nights in San Francisco in the past five years, there is no way this hotel even comes close to its rating. The pluses: very friendly, courteous staff; excellent service; clean rooms; nice location within walking distance of Union Square; very nice dining room with outstanding food. The minuses: the bed is way too hard and mattress quality (especially in this day and age of Heavenly Beds and their competitors) is poor; TV's have not been updated with the new plasma-type sets; the hotel does not offer any views of one of the most beautiful cities in America; the room was noisy--we heard the garbage trucks working at 4am; lobby is small and underwhelming. All in all, The Orchard isn't a complete bust, but you can do much better for the price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: monkey222
Reviews.Content: We just returned from San Francisco. We LOVED this hotel. It has a fantastic location, nice staff, is clean and has very nice rooms. We stayed for four nights and loved everything about the hotel. We have no complaints and highly recommend the Orchard! It is a great price! And, is a lovely, smaller option that has character. We decided to try it based on reviews on this site and were not disappointed at all. We would definitely stay there again and recommend the hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Surrey-travellers-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orchard for a three nights stopover on our way home to UK from Hawaii in November. The location was superb with easy access to Union Square - and the cable car stop on the corner took us to Fishermans Wharf and the departure pier to Alcatraz, The hotel has been refurbished to a high standard - our room was spacious, nicely furnished and well equipped including modern bathroom, bath robes, room safe, mini bar etc etc. We ate breakfast at the hotel each morning which was normal buffet style and dinner one night which was very good. The staff were very friendly and helpful and all in all this was a very pleaseant stay in a nice hotel. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a top quality short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: SanFranFannatic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel the night after Thanksgiving and enjoyed the hotel and location. I used to live in SF for 15 years, but moved to So Cal, so it was interesting and fun being a "tourist" in a city I know. I knew the location of the hotel would be walking distance to China Town, shops in Union Square, Embarcadero shopping, cable car riding, and taxi pick ups. The hotel is worth staying at if you want to be close to all these. The room was clean, roomy, quiet (faced back, not Bush Street) and stylish. Good shower, basic buffet breakfast and friendly customer service at front desk. Free laptop use at front desk (if you don't need to print anything). I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay”
Reviews.Author: New_Yorker_47
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and pleasure. This time instead of staying at the conference hotel I opted for a smaller property. My husband and I loved it. The staff was very helpful, the resturant was excellent, the room was great and the bed was extra lush and comfortable. They have a fellow property which has a pre-fixed early dining menu that offered full size portions of excellent cuisine. Outside the door was the cable car and within a few blocks was China town and down the hill (a few blocks) was the big shopping area...think NYC (where I am from) and Rodeo Drive in LA. Everything they advertised on their website was acurate and in reality it was even nicer. I always review trip advisor on properties before I book, and this was a good one. I would definitely stay there again and recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: tintina
Reviews.Content: Loved the Orchard. As so many have said, the location is superb - a couple of blocks to Union Square. The staff was always friendly and accomodating. The breakfasts were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in SF”
Reviews.Author: sklepper
Reviews.Content: Located right around the corner from popular Union Square, the Orchard Hotel offers excellent boutique accommodations at a very good price. We brought our family of 4 there and got a suite. The kids slept in the parlor on the sofabed and we had our own bedroom. The location is ideal. It is adjacent to the shops and restaurants of Union Square and the Powell cable car, and a modest walk to North Beach, the Metreon, and Financial District. Most other places are a quick cab ride away. We found the rooms to be very clean, surpisingly large for the city and modern. The service was often excellent and friendly (e.g. good advice on places to eat, free DVDs, free umbrellas, late check out, valet parking, etc.) Highlights of our trip included an incredibly tasty dinner at Town Hall in SOMA, visit to kid's interactive museum called Zeum, and a trip to Alcatraz. We watched a movie from the hotel's collection, Escape from Alcatraz with Clint Eastwood, the evening after visiting the Rock and recognized a lot of things from our tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit, great location.”
Reviews.Author: CentralMD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Orchard Hotel with our English relatives for seven days in November 2007. We were all very satisfied with our stay. From our arrival through our departure, all of the staff was helpful, friendly and polite. We were always greeted with kind smiles. The hotel itself is in a great location. It is very convenient to Union Square shopping, public transportation, and all kinds of restaurants. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. We will definitely stay at The Orchard Hotel when we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: phinicky
Reviews.Content: The Orchard is a charming small hotel in an excellent central location. Although I would not go so far as to qualify it as romantic (it's on a "most romantic hotels" list), there were many nice touches in the Art Deco design of both the Lobby and our room. We had a suite on the fifth floor which was nicely furnished. The huge bathroom included a separate tub and shower stall. The bed was comfortable and the robes and slippers were a nice touch. The minibar was well stocked, including a respectable bottle of wine. We were on the fifth floor but still had a lot of noise from the traffic. What we appreciated most was the location. From the hotel we were able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach as well as two high end restaurants.. It's about 6 blocks from buses and trolleys that get you to most parts of the city. The staff was very friendly and if the desk clerk didn't have information we needed, the doorman did. On the one occasion that we needed a taxi, the doorman arranged for a private car that charged taxi prices. In the hotel restaurant, the cold buffet breakfast (only option) was pricey at $14. but the small plates dinner menu is worth having if you don't want to go out. We travel a lot and prefer to stay in small, interesting hotels. The orchard was not our most memorable but was quite satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rockemsockemrobot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard Hotel during the weekend of November 10. The hotel is overall nice and I would stay there again, however, it is not quite deserving of the exceedingly high ranking that it receives on Tripadvisor. It is a solid 3+ star hotel that is clean and serves the purpose desired when in SF, meaning, it is convenient to public transportation and close to an attraction (Union Square). Free internet is nice as well. I would opt out of the hotel breakfast and eat at Sears Fine Foods which is 2 blocks away and is a SF landmark. Alternatively, you can eat at one of the many nearby cafes which have larger selections and lower prices. The person that checked us in was somewhat abrasive, however, after that the staff was courteous and we enjoyed all our other encounters with them. The housekeeping staff was a little odd, like not picking up the robes and knocking on doors at 9:00 a.m. But this was a minor issue. Doorman was very pleasant and served as a concierge as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice , low-key , clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mbusa
Reviews.Content: Like everything price is a huge consideration @ $169 + tax this was great during ORACLE Convention where crap hotels were trying to charge $400. This place includes breakfast, free internet and with overnight parking down the street at the sutter stockton garage @ $25 for over night rather than the $36 valet charges, this is a great place. Nothing fancy but for location and price these hotels are great

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: thepimlicoinformer
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 days here. great location - 1 block from union square shops, restaurants etc and the cable car stopped virtually outside the hotel. very clean superior room, well stocked minibar and plenty of storage space. free continental breakfast was very good, though the individual croissants could feed a family of 4. good selection fruits, cheese and ham. was about to book through hotel web site, but ebookers was Â£60 cheaper - well worth shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ericahair
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience at a hotel across the street from this one so we walked right over and asked to see one of the rooms at the Orchard. The hotel staff immediately took us up to see a room. We decided to switch over to the Orchard Hotel. The rooms were very nice, new and so clean. This is definitely where we will stay from now on when we are in San Fransisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: none_7
Reviews.Content: I rarely ever contribute to these reviews but wanted to pass along that I had a fabulous stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and comfortable with a spacious bathroom. Bed was firm which is great for me. Room was pretty quiet given the downtown location. You can use the mini bar as a mini fridge and breakfast was included with my rate which was a plus. Location is great for both Union Square and the Financial District. I loved that they have DVD's available at the front desk with DVD players in all the rooms. And, the Aveda bath products are great. I travel a lot for work and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BobnSueChicago
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and northern California. We only stayed one night in San Francisco and picked the Orchard Hotel from recommendations from Trip Advisor. We were very pleased. The location was excellent (close to the cable cars.) The front desk staff was wonderful. The room was nicely appointed, and actually very quiet. The stereo sound system with "sleep sound" cd was a nice touch. The room included a delicious complementary breakfast buffet in an elegant setting. With a AAA discount, rate of $180 was a bargain! Parking with valet was $35 for 24 hours, which was fair for the city. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaAlison
Reviews.Content: I found everything I was hoping for: quiet hotel in the SF location I was looking for, comfortable bed, quick and delicious room service, pleasant staff, and a good price for all this. Thanks to TripAdvisor reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “The Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: cocadile
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Its also in a fantastic location in San Francisco. We were however very disappointed in the quality of the mattress. We stayed here four nights-by the end of the trip my back was hurting!! I really would expect a better mattress than a rock (the mattresses in Alcatraz were more comfy than the hotel)!! The pillow was very nice! The continental breakfast at the hotel was awful! It was cereal, cold muffins, croissants, and some fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bob123456789
Reviews.Content: I find it very difficult to find anything to complain about from our stay here in late September. Found the rooms clean and comfortable, staff friendly and helpful and the location close to Union square very convenient - close by but without the noise you might expect. The only downside was that it is located on quite a steep hill, though I guess you cant blame the hotel for that - and cable cars pass by on a regular basis! They kept our bags free of charge after we checked out, also arranged transport to the airport. Will definately be our hotel of choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MNBadger
Reviews.Content: Our 3 day stay in mid October was terrific! Great Union Sq location, friendly + helpful staff. The rooms were spacious, clean, with comfortable king bed. Bathroom was well equipped with Aveda products. The breakfast was basic but very good. We arrived early 1200 but were able to check into our room, no problem. Recommend higher floor rooms on Bush St. We got a very good rate with AAA discount through the hotel website. I would strongly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when we return to SF. We took the BART from SFO for $5.15 one way, got off at Powell St station and walked (w/roller bags) to the hotel. We very easily used BART; buses; trolley; ferries to get around bay area during our stay. We traveled to Concord; Marin, Larkspur; Tiburon, Golden Gate park etc via public transportation. Parking is expensive and a car is not necessary. Also recommend renting a bike (Blazing Saddles - near Fishermans wharf) and ride through marina district, Presidio, over Golden Gate bridge, through Sausilito/Tiburon and take a ferry back from Sausilito or Tiburon, ride back to start. Restaurant/bar recommendations - The Nanking, Citizen Thai, Tommaso's, Tosca, Enrico's

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: merri79
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again next time we visit San Francisco. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful, the doorman was happy to offer his advice as to where we should go, where we should eat etc. and the front desk staff could not do enough for us. The room was very comfortable and very clean. The complimentary dvds were a great idea and the bathroom was great. We had 3 great night's sleep, the bed was huge and comfortable! The room was absolutely pitch black when the curtains were drawn, and the room was silent which meant we weren't disturbed by sunlight or noise when wanting to relax. The breakfasts were fine. We ate enough that we didn't feel like lunch, although the foods were cold, so there was certainly enough food there to nibble on.

Reviews.Title: “Great handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRingham
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the Trip Advisor reviews, and glad I did. Perfect location - few blocks up from main shopping area, three blocks from Chinatown, on main cable car route to Fishermans Wharf. Pleasant, large room with a huge comfy bed. The hotel website doesn't mention air con, but it does have climate control so had no issues (and I'm fussy about this!). Handy breakfast buffet to get you started - coffee, bagels, pastries, juices and fresh fruit. Door staff handy for getting taxis and booking shuttle back to the airport. LOVED San Francisco, can't wait to go back and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it's supposed to be and then some...”
Reviews.Author: vendorcloud
Reviews.Content: I just saw the new tripadvisor beta and it still doesnt give you a direct link to the rankings but anyway... i digress... stayed at this hotel because i only use tripadvisor and it was highly ranked. the omni is great too and you should use their kids room by pottery barn sometime... this hotel has a small staff but they do more than most big name brand hotels. the doorman was outstanding on both nights. the valet is $34 vs. $65 for the W or others, even the Omni. The car came in less than 10 minutes in most cases. they were very child friendly and got us a crib ($10) right away without even asking after they saw our 4 month old. we came in late after a very long day traveling with kids on a plane from LA and ordered room service. i could have eaten a shoe by that time, but it was EXCELLENT. my wife's spinach side was the best she ever had she said. the room is ample and not too frou frou but clean and good. not cool and sexy like a W like i like but that's so overplayed its nice to go the other direction. their hallways are small so you have nowhere to get lost. the elevator is quick. the visitors are mostly German for some reason. their bar later was great too. lots of small batch scotches and good stuff like that. the location cant be beat. you are literally 1.5 blocks from Macy's Union Square, Levi store, Cheesecake, Barney's and Neimans. Try the Neiman's bar - they rock too. Chinatown is just 2.5 blocks away and starbucks is right there at the entrance of Chinatown. what i dont like is their coffee setup in the room. too cumbersome and no way to not spill water on the counter. the shower has a plastic curtan too which is not great. it wasnt nasty, but they could do a nice tericloth and just wash it more and people would feel like its cleaner. also, it flooded our bath floor on both occasions. they have free dvd rental downstairs which is cool if you like that. all in all, another great find thanks to tripadvisor. btw, i am a big city guy doing reviews here. my buddy says all you tripadvisor reviewers are midwesterners -- not true. real travelers use this site exclusively and i am one of them. my only tip is to book at the HOTEL'S website only. You wont pre-pay and you get better terms and usually better pricing. i'd rather pay $10 or $25 more to get a free cancel opp the day before. Sorry tripadvisor but you should just put the hotel's link on your page even though i know its a way for you to make the buck$.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is the problem.”
Reviews.Author: eudemon
Reviews.Content: The staff is the real problem. They are all sullen, the doorman does not open doors, the front desk is decidedly not welcoming. The ice machine was inoperable on my floor and the solution presented by the front desk staff was to go to another floor to obtain ice. And the room cleaner knocked on my door at about 9AM and tried to get me to check out early so that she could clean the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff, good price”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard for 6 nights by the end of Sept. The good experience begun when I booked the hotel and Jim was the kindest person, quickly answering to my e-mails. Thank you very much for arranging my stay, Jim!! My flight to San Fran was delayed, so I arrived at the hotel around 2 AM and people at front desk/doorman were really nice (I am sorry I do not remember your names, but thank you for the speedy check-in - I was reeeally tired). In addition to the great staff, Orchard has an excellent location, just a few steps from cable car stop (if you are not driving, I suggest you to buy the MUNI pass valid during your stay in San Fran) and 2 blocks from Union Square shops and Chinatown Gate. The room is perfectly clean and spacious, so is the bathroom. I totally recommend this hotel!! And, for the lady in the front desk who suggests wonderful restaurants, please include â€œHouse of Nankingâ€� in your list (the place is not fancy, but the food is incredible â€“ just ask the waiter to choose your food).

Reviews.Title: “Double check your bill”
Reviews.Author: heysugar1
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and stayed at the Orchard Hotel. I really enjoyed my stay until I later saw on my credit card statement that the hotel had overcharged my stay. I contacted the hotel immediately, and an Orchard hotel staff member indicated that I had a mini-bar charge, which was not true. The hotel staff member assured me that they will take care of it and refund the overcharge within 5 business days. As I found out a week and a half after the call, the hotel had not process my refund. I contacted the hotel a second time, and they informed me that nothing has been processed and they will take care of it. I asked the hotel to call me when they processed the refund. The Orchard staff promised that one of their finance members will call me within 48 hours. Surprise, surprise, the hotel did not call me back. However, I gave them a couple of days to see if perhaps they processed my refund but somehow forgot to return my call. Not only did the hotel not return my call, but they did not refund the overcharge. I contacted the hotel for the third time, and the lady told me that she could NOT help me because she was NOT the people that I spoke to earlier. I informed her that I had spoken to two different people and that both gave me the same spiel about 'how they will take care of it' but neither followed through. I told her that ''Why in the world would I want to talk to those individuals again when they couldn't follow through their promises to their customers? Hence, the reason that I want to talk to someone else.' She then told me that she 'will take care of it'. I informed her that I will keep calling the hotel until I get this resolved. Within an hour, the hotel called me back and told me the refund has been processed. Honestly, the Orchard hotel should not have taken nearly four weeks to process my refund. Furthermore, why did the hotel immediately processed my refund ONLY after I stated that I will keep calling the hotel until this situation gets resolved? All the positive things that I had planned to write on Tripadvisor.com about this hotel were trumped by the hotel staff members' lack of credibility and professionalism. So, double check your credit card statement with your hotel bill for discrepancies.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: califtrav
Reviews.Content: would recommend and will stay again! Great location, clean and charming!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Hotel in fall”
Reviews.Author: UkBluebell
Reviews.Content: I can thoroughly recommend the Orchard as an excellent base in San Francisco. It's in a great position - not too far from shops and theatres, but far enough to escape the noise of the downtown area. Very handy for the cable car stop too, and if you're tempted to take a Grayline tour, their shuttle bus will pick you up at the Orchard. The breakfast menu is the best I've experienced in the US and the service and cleanliness are second to none. Overall, the hotel has STYLE - go for it!!! VB from the UK

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrystalVancouver
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the Ritz-Carlton where I had a conference, and due to glowing reviews on TripAdvisor. The reviews were right! This hotel is well-located, close to Union Square shopping but on a quieter street part way up to Nob Hill. We didn't notice traffic noise at night. We had several requests -- early check-in, lower floor, facing the street instead of the alley, not close to elevator, and mattress pad. (a previous reveiwer wrote about hard mattresses but with the pad the bed was fine) They were all accommodated easily, and we were able to check in a couple of hours early. We were on the 2nd floor which is where the very little exercise room is but few people use it so it wasn't disturbing. The standard rooms are a generous size. The complimentary breakfast is good, with cut up fruit (including strawberries!) as well as the usual toast, croissants etc. Servers bring juice and coffee so we tipped $5/day. Tomato slices were a nice touch. High-speed internet access is free and they will provide a cable if you forget one. There is also a free DVD library with an excellent selection. Aveda toiletries were really nice. This is a newer hotel, all non-smoking which is great. It's not "high-end" or luxurious but perfectly adequate and very good value for money. We booked the AAA rate off the internet and seemed to get a decent rate, as we were there for Fleet Week and many hotels were full. Staff were all helpful and friendly, and the doorman even walked to the corner to get us a cab once. There's also a house car to take people to the airport, $45 flat rate plus tip which is a nice alternative to a regular cab. Because the windows don't open the air can be dry. This was partly negated by the fact that there was no extractor fan in the bathroom so it got a bit steamy after a shower. As the bathroom was quite large, it wasn't too much of a problem. A bit strange for a new hotel, though. Overall we were impressed and will stay here for any future trips to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Reviewers are right!”
Reviews.Author: jurypro
Reviews.Content: We loved the Orchard. Staff were wonderful, room was large as was the bathroom. Very quiet and serene. The location, right off Union Square makes it easy to go almost anywhere in the City. The pizzeria cattycorner to the hotel (maybe it's called VItos?) has terrific pizza. You just can't go wrong at the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard Hotel....Loved it...Great”
Reviews.Author: Patty6
Reviews.Content: We recently visited San Francisco for a family wedding..many of the guests stayed at the Orchard Hotel. It was our first visit and it was absolutely wonderful !! The rooms were so tranquil, very quiet and spacious.The complementary breakfast was certainly appreciated and was very nice each morning. We had all ages in our group from under 2 yrs to some in their 80's. The staff was very accommodating and flexible dealing with all of our needs. Each day we needed transportation several times for as few as 2 to as many as 16 people and the staff at the Orchard effortlessly and willingly made all of our arrangements......they made it so easy for us! The Hotel and the rooms are very clean and decorated very nicely. The hotel is centrally located ..a short walk to Chinatown,Union Square,great restaurants,coffee shops,etc.and the cable car stops right outside the door...a real San Francisco experience. We plan to return soon, just for a little R & R this time and we will certainly stay at the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Orchard - nice change from the typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: epaairnow
Reviews.Content: Someone recommended The Orchard...and I took them up on trying to book a stay. As a federal employee I inquired about the per diem rate, and while it was lower than their internet rate they honored it. We typically stayed at Hyatt properties in San Fran...and I was nervous about the 'change.' The Orchard was a nice experience - the room was large and comfortable..and the breakfast was decent. The service and staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was excellent. I visit SF once a year on business - and I will likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT Choice”
Reviews.Author: xsnowman99
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to San Fran was a 3-night end of trip visit m(we had been in Hawaii). We were not disappointed with our choice of staying at The Orchard Hotel. The rooms were quite spacious and clean. The bed, linens and pillows were glorious! Everyone we met from the front desk staff to the concierge to the doorman were very willing to be as helpful as they could be. The continental breakfast was a plus and wasn't huge but certainly adequate with homemade croissants, sweet rolls, muffins, fruit, bagels, english muffins, hard boiled eggs, one variety of cheese and usually ham. It was a nice touch for the wait persons served your coffee and juice. The only thing bad I can even say about this hotel is it can be a little noisy (on the back side at least) from trash pickup during the night. I suspect that this is NOT relevant to this hotel only. If we go to San francisco again, we would not hesitate to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Orchard for the final leg of our honeymoon and was very impressed with the hotel. Room was very nice and loved the complimentary breakfast. Hotel is just 4 blocks (all downhill) to Union Square and the Powell Hyde and Mason cable car stops at the corner of Bush and Powell, directly beside the hotel and so you have easy access to Fishermans Warf (however that place is just a little tacky for my liking). Overall very good hotel, pleasant staff, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: weluvvacation
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to California we consulted Trip Advisor and selected the Orchard based on the reviews. We were not disappointed as the hotel was pretty much what we expected. Centrally located and on the cable car route, it provided a nice clean place to stay and a good location base to see the city. The front desk was quite helpful in answering any questions and the housekeeping in the rooms was impeccable. Breakfast was ample and varied. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: dopey101
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!!!! We just got back from a 12 day stay in Calf. This was a great experience especially for the price $180 night. We got a very low price for being a Holiday weekend. The hotel was absolutley great. It was very clean and situated in a great location. The rooms were huge (we had a king size bed with an huge bathroom)We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and we were able to catch the cable cars right outside of our hotel. As for the staff, they were very nice and knowledgable about everything in the area. And if you asked something, which one of the staff wouldnt know they found another staff member and got this info for you. At the hotel, our breakfas was included so this was very nice. When you walked out the hotel and to the left walk a few blocks and you will be in China town, and walk a few blocks to the right you are in Union square. I could go on and on. If you are looking for a full excerise room with a pool this hotel does not offer this but they do offer an opportunity to attend a gym. (we did not do this b/c we walked everywhere, up all the hills.lol) If you want more about the stay or about things to do in the city please contact me.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: H_ILChicago
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and will definitely make it our base in SF when we return. Based on other reviews I asked for a room on a higher floor and for a pillow top (I read that the matresses were quite hard). The hotel was very accommodating of our requests. We asked for a very early check in and this was no problem - our room was ready when we arrived from the airport. Our room was very spacious with a huge bathroom and everything very clean. With the pillow top the bed was really comfortable so if you like a softer bed ask them to put a pillow top on for you. It was very quiet in our room. Reception people, housekeeping and concierge were excellent. Breakfast was great. Lots of choice and very comfortable dining area. I highly recommend this hotel. It is very convenient for Union Square and Nob Hill. We really liked the free wireless and free DVD library.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent place to stay, everything works, nice big bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: foobarbaz
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel with a baby over the weekend. Corner rooms have nice big bathrooms with large bath tubs, the hot water is hot, you can put your food in the minibar which is behind lock and key, and you can ask for extra pillows at no extra charge, the clothes iron is high up on a wall rack in the closet, all great if you have a baby or young kid. Efficient use of space in the common areas, so it doesn't strike you as grand-looking when you enter the hotel. Great location, great location, great location. Near Union Square, very convenient and accessible for shopping, several good restaurants within 5-15 minutes by foot (e.g. Masa's, Farallon, etc). Walgreens (pick up some diapers!) just one block South along Powell Street. There's a Powell St Cable Car stop just 20 paces from the hotel entrance, which could take you to Hyde or to Fisherman's Wharf depending on which Car you take. A cab to the Ferry Building at Embarcadero costs under $10. Friendly counter staff (e.g. Grace), knowledgeable and helpful concierge/valet/doormen (e.g. Cornell, Art). Buffet breakfast was a bit simple for $20, but adequate to get your day going with a full stomach - cereal, milk, croissants, muffins, bread, cheese, ham, juices, etc. Lots of fruit (watermelon, cantaloupe, pineapple, peaches or plums, etc), which can be useful if your baby is just starting on solid food. Complementary Internet access, with in-room RJ-45 in probably all rooms, and additionally Wi-Fi connectivity but up to level 2 only. It worked fine (they're using a Nomadix; remember to collect your password from the front desk when you check in). The connectivity is managed by WiFi Guys, who sport a toll-free customer support number, with no extra charge if you call it from your in-room phone. The valet parking service makes use of a multi-level garage along Bush Street across Powell Street from the hotel. I think it costs $30-50 per 24 hours through the valet service. But parking is both crazy and expensive in San Francisco anyway, so you're better off making use of this if you have both a baby and a car. Let them know 10-15 minutes before you need your car. We think it was good value overall, and would stay there if we plan to be near Union Square with a baby again.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be rated the #2 hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: glimmertwins
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at The Orchard hotel because it is rated #2 on this website, and all the reviews are positive. I also found a great rate. To start with the postive the hotel room is a good size, clean, and has a comfortable feel. The negatives are the bed was very hard. That may be a positive to some, but a big negative in my case. The biggest downer was we only had cold water for our showers. We informed the hotel of this issue, but the next day again another cold shower. We took showers at different times too, at night, morning, late morning, so it isn't that they ran out of hot water. When we went to check out the staff member's comment was "Why didn't you tell us earlier about the problem" which was not the correct response. After taking cold showers for 3 days I want to hear "I am very sorry" or an explanation, because surely cold showers aren't the norm, right? Anyway, I have found this website extremely helpful in researching trips I have taken and I just wanted to give back!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TechYellowJacket
Reviews.Content: Very nice smaller property. Stayed in a two room suite (601) and found it to be clean and well appointed. Compared to other nearby hotels, the room was a good value. We had view on Bush St. which is preferred. Easy access to all areas via Cable Car(Often crowded) and cab. Several very good restaurants close by include Mozart and Anjou. Staff especially friendly and helpful. A very good value in an above average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kevincognito
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed hear for 3 nights. This hotel is a fabulous find. It is steps away from the cable car which takes you to the Fishermans Wharf area, it's 2 block away from Chinatown and It's 4 blocks away from the shopping district at Union Square. When you first arrive, someone is there to help you with your luggage and then takes you car for you ($34/day to park) but who needs a car when you are in this great location. Check in was a breeze and everyone is pleasant and helpful. The room was super clean and actually a good size for waht you expect in an older building in downtown. The morning buffet is a good way to start the day, not a full hot breakfast but with San Francisco to explore who needs more. A great find, a great location and great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: NealPage
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at The Orchard Hotel and loved it! I had never heard of it before, but after doing research on the web found it to be highly recommended. I can honestly say that we were surprised with most to all the hotel had to offer. First of all, It is a smaller hotel which was a great change to all the hustle and bustle of a large chain hotel that I would normally stay in. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel is centrally located in the city-just up the hill from Union Square, but out of the way enough to get away from all the people. Our room was spacious with ample room for the three of us, clean, and offered Aveda products in the bathroom which my wife didn't mind. The hotel served a continental breakfast every morning with fresh fruit, juice, pastries, and cereal. Overall, I would recommend The Orchard for anyone from the business traveler to the family on a weekend getaway and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our Orchard Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ammchughfl
Reviews.Content: August 29th, 2007 - My boyfriend and I just returned form our San Francisco vacation and were very pleased with our Orchard Hotel experience. All of our expectations were met and some were even exceeded. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, quiet, and well-appointed. We like the small boutique hotel atmosphere and this one was just what we wanted. The location was great, just up the street from the Chinatown gate and very close to Union Square. As mentioned by many reviewers, the parking rate was high, but average for the city. We would definitely stay at The Orchard again.

Reviews.Title: “First Pleasure Trip to SF”
Reviews.Author: GoodOlDays
Reviews.Content: Choosing a boutique hotel for your first pleasure trip to San Francisco was a little more adventurous than my wife and I ordinarily allow, but we took the advice of so many others on Trip Advisor and must say we were really pleased. The hotel is quiet, very convenient to the cable car lines (Powell, California and F Line), and the hotel staff from the desk, concierge and continental dining staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and I thought the rates very, very good. I did not mind that the hotel did not have a full dining room as there are excellent restaurants nearby. In fact, I found the Roxanne, right next door, to be perfect for breakfast when I got tired of the continental fare, but the continental breakfast (free) at the hotel was really pretty nice. We are not frequent travelers, so we did not fully understand the hotel's refusal to allow us to take the continental back to the room, but it was not a big deal. If you have not been to SF before and you are going to be there for anything near three days, get the city pass that allows you to travel on the muni systems including the cable cars. The stop for the Powell lines is all of 50 paces from the hotel door and is a must for sane travel around SF. The Powell line can take you down to Market where you can get the F Line from Market and Stockton to do all of the Fisherman Wharf stops. From Fishermans Wharf you can get either the Powell Hyde or the Powell Mason cable car back to the intersection of Bush and Powell and see most of what you want to see in downtown SF by riding them that way. Ask for a map when you check in and the staff will explain it to you.

Reviews.Title: “great alternative to big chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: FussyChinaGirl
Reviews.Content: great location for walking into san francisco, and a charming hotel with welcoming, helpful staff. upon check-in we were offered a choice of room with bath and shower, or just shower. we selected shower - and it was perfectly fine, in fact, a very spacious bathroom with walk-in shower area and aveda products refreshed daily. the robes and slippers were high-quality, and if you choose to spend an evening in the hotel they have a good selection of current and classic DVDs to borrow. we had been recommended to ask for a room overlooking Bush Street (which we got) as it would be quieter in the mornings - the windows don't open anyway, but it certainly was a peaceful room. and we were on the 10th floor with a great city view. (see pic) the restaurant (not owned by the hotel) had lost its licence recently so was not open for lunch/dinner or room serivce. it would have been better if we had been informed of this in advance rather than upon arrival when we walked into the restaurant area to find it deserted! this also meant that breakfast was a 'continental' style buffet - bread, bagels, fruit, muffins, yoghurt, boiled eggs, juice, coffee - but this was more than adequate unless you need a full all-american cooked breakfast. however, the absence of a restaurant was not a complete tragedy as there are so many places to eat nearby - and the doorman has a great list of suggestions if you tell him what kind of food you're looking for. overall, a lovely hotel with good service and i would certainly recommend it as a great alternative to the larger chain hotels which can be a little faceless.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: mctintin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days in July. A five minute walk, around the corner and down the hill and you are at Union Square, perfect for shopping and picking up tour buses. Very clean and well maintained. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: huff42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard on the first leg of a two week journey through Northern and Southern California. It was a great hotel. Spotless and quiet. The breatkfast was great for a continental - lots of fresh fruit, meats, and pastries. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Good location and reasonable price too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Spaceman58
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is a nice hotel just a couple of blocks from Union Square. As I write this review (8/3/07) it is rated the #1 hotel in all of San Francisco. That's probably a bit too generous...its probably not the best this great city has to offer, but it is definitely good and worthy of your consideration. And a pretty good value. We paid less than $200 a night. This is a small, clean, comfortable, and most importantly, a quiet hotel. It is very clean, and they also offer free WiFi, which some others in the city charge for. There is also a laptop in the lobby you can use for checking email, flight status, etc. The bathroom was great - larger than average with an elegant appearance. The room was probably larger than most hotel rooms in San Francisco, but not large by any definition. But it was comfortable. Our room had a lousy view of an alley, but then again, we didn't choose this place for its view. Our room location may have been a factor in the quietness. Also, the hotel is just steps from a Hyde St cable car stop, so you can get quickly to and from Fisherman's Wharf. Chinatown is 2 blocks down Bush St, Union Square is 2 blocks down Powell. Extremely convenient location. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the doorman. We've stayed in 4 different hotels in San Fran, and The Orchard is the best we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: simonfw
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for 3 nights and was impressed with the Orchard, especially at the price! Making the reservation by phone was easy too. We had 2 rooms, a king & 2 queen bed, overlooking the street. The rooms were light, airy & sizeable with good furnishings, good amenities and very well decorated. Big bathrooms too. However, I'm glad that our rooms weren't on the back of the propoerty overlooking the alley. Location is superb, only 2 blocks from Union Square & 20 yards from the Powell St cable car (although this was nearly always full whilst we were there). Noise for us wasn't an issue at all. Buffet breakfast was included and sufficient, and it was good to eat before heading off for the day. The restaurant & bar weren't open for dinner whilst we were there which was a pity, as it would have been nice to return for a drink after dinner. DVD loan facility was a nice touch; our teenagers enjoyed a couple of hours watching movies. Cornell the concierge was very helpful with directions, restaurant reservations etc. All in all, the Orchard deserves to be #1 in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “we were not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Louiseee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for five nights, July 13th to the 18th. We chose the hotel based on the positive reviews and lack of negative reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. It was everything everyone said it was. Our room was spacious and well appointed with tasteful furnishings. We made good use of the in room internet and safe. The king bed was extremely comfortable. The breakfast had everything we wanted; lots of fresh fruit, cereal, variety of breads, sweat breads and croissants, many juices, good coffee. It was not the same every day and did vary to some degree. The location is excellent, just a short walk to many popular San Fran sights. The staff was helpful & courteous, and always maintained their professionalism. When we return we wil stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good quality, but noise issues”
Reviews.Author: Lara67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard in May. Overall, I think it's a good value for the area. The location is really superb and the transportation options nearby are excellent! You don't need a car at all if you are staying within SF. There's a BART/Muni station just five blocks south and a cable car stop out in front. I had no problems taking BART from SFO. The only difficulty there was schlepping my luggage up the hill. The hotel is smack dab between the Union Square and Nob Hill areas, so there are a bewildering number of restaurants to choose from. There's no need for any of that in the morning as the complimentary breakfast is excellent, with ample choices. My only complaint there is that you don't have the option of bringing your breakfast back to the room. My room was fine. No view, but clean! This is one of the cleanest and best stocked hotel rooms I've ever been in. Now let's talk about the noise. I think one or two reviews have mentioned the garbage trucks. One came in the middle of the night during my stay and was incredibly audible! Also, I was able to hear my neighbors a bit, even though they were only talking and not being very noisy. So, just a few things to keep in mind if you're a light sleeper or sensitive to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craigh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I took advantage of the 'stay for 3 nights, pay for 2 nights' deal, and had a great stay at the Orchard Hotel in late June/early July. We arrived early after a 12 hour flight from New Zealand, and were grateful that our room was available immediately. Our king room was clean and spacious. The bed was very comfortable, the shower good pressure, and the amenities good. The hotel has an excellent location - only a couple of blocks uphill from Union Square, and close to Nob Hill and the likes of the Mark Hopkins Hotel (where you can have an early evening cocktail or beer and have a marvellous view over an Francisco). We had a nice filling complimentary breakfast (cereal, toast, fresh fruit, coffee) every day in the hotel restaurant. The hotel staff were attentive and friendly. All in all - an excellent bargain, and we will be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: M90_AMT
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel, not particularly memorable, comfortable rooms, reasonable location, nice breakfast. staff ok but not very helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: MDperuta
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Orchard Hotel is everything we'd hoped it would be. Beautiful wall paper and well chosen carpeting, along with custom draperies adorn this room in a manner sutiable for a room in 5 star or better hotel. Oak furniture and brass accent peices give the room a luxurious and yet warm feel. The bed is super comfortable with it's oversized white down comforter and four very large pillows. I'd like to touch on the pillows for a moment because I'm not used such a detail in a hotel. Two goose down, and two acryllic filled. Designed with the comfort and needs of the hotel guests in mind. As they mold to your head and neck, the day seems to just melt away and lull you into a glorious sleep. Just what you need after a long flight or a day of sightseeing. The bathrooom is very large and CLEAN. White ceramic tiles on the floor - and along the walls in the glass enclosed shower stall. There is a beautiful wood trimmed mirror along with the black granite countertop, and beautiful chrome spout style faucet make you want to bring this style idea into your very own home. But could there be more??? You bet! The staff here has been very friendly and knowledgable, as if they just got out of hotel training school - eager to please and willing to accomodate. The breakfast in the morning (complimentary I might add) was fab! A schmorghisbord (hmm, not sure if I spelled that right) of dilectable treats. Bagels, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, juices, and of course COFFEE. And by the way, when I came back to the room after breakfast - maybe 15 minutes - the room was cleaned already... In short, the colors, style, fixtures and people here, have earned an 'A' in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, very clean and updated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Billiken
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Orchard Hotel for one night, but it was a very nice experience. The room was really very nice and spacious, especially for the price. It appears that they must have recently done a renovation as the room appeared to have barely been used which was wonderful. The next time we are in San Francisco, we will likely stay here again. We typically stay at higher end hotels and resorts (e.g. Four Seasons, Ritz, JW Marriotts, etc.). We chose this hotel based upon reviews and we were very pleased. The staff was friendly and helpful. We did not use the fitness facility and only ate breakfast in the restaurant - they told us that it is in the process of changing over to another operator or concept or something like that so they were not serving dinner. Overall, very nice place to stay while in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “They looked after me very well”
Reviews.Author: trravlrrr
Reviews.Content: I chose this place pretty much at random based on its price and location. On my first evening here I fell through a manhole in the footpath a few blocks away, injuring myself to the point I could not walk or use my right arm. The hotel doorman, alerted by a passing member of the public, rushed down with a wheelchair for me and called me a doctor. On the doctor's advice they got me a can to the nearest hospital and on my return, all bandaged, with a walking stick and arm in a sling, they really looked after me. The next day another doorman went to the chemist for me to pick up my prescriptions, brought me an almost endless supply of ice for my injuries and all were fantastic help. The rooms are very comfy, the bed soft and the sheets wonderful. They have a great internet connection (cabled not wifi), the breakfast (inclusive) is delicious with all organic products, and the coffee excellent. The shower has great water pressure, the room is quiet (and I should know being pretty much trapped up here) and they have a good range of DVDs at reception guests can borrow should you wish to. All in all this is one of the best hotel stays I have had, injury not withstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great SF hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaxDC
Reviews.Content: We had such trouble picking just the right SF hotel and decided to go with the Orchard b/c it seemed to have the most consistently positive reviews. I am so glad we did! Everything was terrific - from the woman at the front desk who could not have been nicer to the comfy bed to the perfect SF location. We were excited for our trip and were willing to pay a reasonable price for a great hotel. We just didn't want to spend a fortune on something that turned out to be mediocre. The Orchard was the right choice. No question.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, hotel staff were disappointing”
Reviews.Author: happytravels79
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very nice at check in the staff was helpful and courteous. The room was very nice. The bed was soft and the room was clean. I have a complaint/ warning about the parking. We chose to park our rental car overnight on our first night there at $35 per night. Then we returned the rental car to the rental company and relied on public transportation the rest of our trip. (On a side note give yourself extra time to get around on the streetcar and and the F trolley- very crowded). Upon checkout I noticed charges for multiple days of parking. I mentioned to the desk clerk that we only stayed one night. She rolled her eyes and said "Let me see" and called over the Doorman. He stated he would have to call the garage. The Desk clerk then said very cocky "Did you TELL anyone that you weren't brining the car back" I said I wasn't aware I had to, she then rolled her eyes again laughed at me and said "well how are we supposed to know you aren't bringing the car back unless you tell the front desk." I assumed they checked cars in and out as they are brought in and out. The doorman said it was probably a mistake because it showed our car as currently checked in and it wasn't there. The desk clerk begrudgingly reversed the charge and told me next time to tell the correct people about the car. She said it was not the doormans job to charge us it was the front desk. It was sad to end a nice stay this way. Also, I was never told of any breakfast option that was offered, upon reading other reviews I noticed people mentioning it, so you may have to ask. The hotel restaurant was closed for renovation during our stay so I assumed breakfast was off. All and all a nice stay but staff had mixed attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dan_and_Gill
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Top location for all the tourist sites, top brekkie, rooms not massive (but apparently not many are in SF) but bed fabulous. We went on our honeymoon, staff were very friendly and helpful. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Skeptic who loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy01
Reviews.Content: OK, like many of you reading all the reviews, I was very skeptical of this hotel. How could it get so many great reviews, yet still be so cheap? Well, my husband and I loved it. No, it's not the Four Seasons, but it is a very clean, large room with a comfy bed, and a nice sized bathroom with Aveda products. And it's close to everything. And even though I wasn't expecting the service to be great because of the price, I was wrong. The staff was very helpful with every question we had. The only disappointment was the breakfast, but at these prices, who cares? We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,clean”
Reviews.Author: Paul Bris uk
Reviews.Content: Good all round Hotel , Union st around the corner, China Town 5mins walk close to tram stop.Friendly staff.Go on their website to get a deal we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerLondonON
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 (including 2 small children) stayed here July 3 - July 5, as part of our west coast vacation. We loved this hotel. It is new, very clean and pleasant. We liked the small lobby, breakfast area, and the rooms. We had one regular room with a kind bed, and a suite which had a king bed in the bedroom and a queen sofa bed in the living room for our children. The location is excellent for tourists in San Francisco. We went to see Golden Gate Bridge and Muir Woods before checking into the hotel so we could drive there. The hotel has valet parking as the only real option ($ 34 per day). Parking is very difficult in San Francisco, so valet is reasonable here. After leaving the car with the valet, we did the rest of the sites by walking or taking the cable cars. This hotel is located very close to Union Square (lots of shopping and restaurants), Westfield Centre (very large high end mall), and China town. These were easy to walk to. There are some hills, but that is part of what you expect to see in San Francisco as a tourist. The cable car stop is at the intersection of Bush and Powell, within a few yards of the hotel, where 2 cable car lines stop. You can get an all day pass for the cable cars (and buses) for $11 per day at Walgreens (located one block from hotel). I recommend this option because otherwise it is $5 per ride. You can take the Mason-Powell cable car north to the end of the line, and then walk a few blocks to pier 33 for Alcatraz tours. You can take the Hyde-Powell cable car north to see the crooked part of Lombard St. It is a lot more fun to take cable cars rather than cabs. We like the Union Square area much better for our hotel instead of Fisherman's wharf area (were we stayed in the past). The hotel gives out a great map of San Francisco (including the transit system) and a "San Francisco Visitors Guide", which has great maps of the Downtown/Union Square area (including names and locations of stores and restaurants). Overall we loved this hotel and the location. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “We will be Back”
Reviews.Author: Trailblazer44
Reviews.Content: My wife and i recently stayed at The Orchard and we were very pleased with our decision.This Boutique style Hotel is a gem.We were staying on the 6th floor overlooking Bush St and had a good veiw of the surrounding area.It was very quiet at night and had no problems sleeping since they have the most resplendent mattress's to sleep on!As a matter of fact we missed the free breakfast one morning because of sleeping in!! The Cable Car Stop is right out the front door on Powell and Union Square with all the great shopping and Restaurants is just a few blocks over.We choose to take a ferry to Sausilito one day and walk across the Golden Gate Bridge back to Fishermans Wharf.It took about 6 hrs and the way is over mostly designated walkways and paths etc ..Well after a long day of sightseeing these 2 very tired Canucks couldn't have been more pleased to come back to The Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: LongTallSallyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is perfect if you are looking for a great value, very nice accomodations and a fantastic location without the crowds, hassles and prices of a large chain hotel. The best thing about The Orchard is it's location. It basically sits in the Nob Hill/Union Square area on the corner of Powell and Bush Streets which is 3-4 blocks from Union Square and 2-3 blocks from the main gate to China Town. The Powell-Mason and Powell-Hyde cable cars lines are literally 20 steps from the hotel front door. Both will take you to Union Square and the Powell Street BART station and either to Fishermans Wharf or North Beach depending on which cable car you hop on. But if you aren't into the cable cars or feel like getting some exercise then Union Square is a quick 5 minute walk straight down Powell Street and China Town is also a 5 minute walk straight down Bush Street. If you are renting a car the closest and best place is on O'Farrell Street in the heart of Union Square about 4 blocks from the hotel. There are 4-5 major rental car companies and the mid week rates are relatively cheap. We rented a four door Economy for $28 per day. And here's a little secret........if you have to keep your car overnight but don't want to pay the $30+ for overnight parking at the hotel then you can park for $15 (late night special) in the same garage as where you first picked it up for as long as you arrive after 7pm and leave the garage before 9am. The Orchard is a great value because your room rate includes free continental breakfast every morning, free internet and a free shuttle to the financial district. We stayed there a few weeks ago and averaged approximately $175 per night. Other larger chain hotels in the immediate area were $250+ per night and didn't include breakfast or internet access. The rooms are very nice and in great condition with updated features including comfortable beds, nice furniture and a stocked "honor" bar including cold drinks, snacks etc. Our bathroom was larger than average and very nice with a marble floor, high quality toiletries and a very nice sink / vanity. Overall a fantastic hotel that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What's Not To Like?”
Reviews.Author: jakester20
Reviews.Content: We just left San Francisco and checked out of the Orchard Hotel. Itâ€™s hard to think of how the experience could have been better in a boutique hotel thatâ€™s not working at being â€œin your faceâ€�, but offers service, attention, and some details not found in a large scale convention hotel. If you can get in, stay there. My thoughts follow: Room: We were traveling with our daughter, so we opted for a suite. It was lovely. DÃ©cor, furniture and detailing were wonderful and the rooms were very spacious. Like the rest of the hotel, everything was in an Oriental theme. The bathroom was gigantic. The remodeling features granite sinks and window sills through the hotel, and we loved it. Rating 10. Location: The location at Bush and Powell was excellent. If youâ€™re a walker, you can walk to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, and many other locations. If not, take cabs or the cable car. Everything you need is within a short distance. Rating 10. Staff and Service: Super. Extremely helpful, without any attitude of artificial cool factor. Everything worked out perfectly. Rating 10 Breakfast Offered continental breakfast every morning at the restaurant/bar in the hotel. Donâ€™t recall the name. Extremely spacious with plenty of room to eat and spread out without being in other guests faces. Food was good, not great. Rating 7.5 Summary: If you are looking for a terrific place, totally up to date with many features and amenities in a boutique hotel Orchard Hotel is for you. Overall Rating 9.25

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; a few quibbles”
Reviews.Author: ej54
Reviews.Content: Travelling with a teenage daughter taking college tours, this was our splurge hotel. She had never been to SF and I was returning after 20 years. The location is absolutely the best and must be figured in with every other deciding factor.
