We had a wonderful time, easily walking from the hotel through Chinatown, North End (Italian) and then finishing up at and immediately turning back from the touristy Wharf. It was interesting, almost disheartening, for her to see that there are "repeat performances" at all tourists areas throughout the world (d.j.s, fast painting, same restauraunt chains, same hustle) and that it is important to find the unique aspects (sourdough bread) in each city. SO, back to the hotel. We arrived with a rental car which we eventually returned early . Parking was a total drag. The hotel admonished us to watch out for towing, asking us to remember to fill the meters up until after ticket time, etc. and always segued by encouraging us to use their extremeley expensive valet service. Well, this can be taken both ways I expect and they were just trying to (in my most optimistic mood) keep us from getting towed, but I do live in a major city, know how to read meters and so on. Bottom line is a happy one: you don't really need a car if you are staying in SF! We actually drove to and from Santa Clara, returned the car to the airport, took the BART train back in to town and used BART again to get back to the airport. Further to the hotel, as promised..The bed was remarkably comfortable. We had no view but it did not matter. Daughter liked the Aveda products. Our tub did not drain well (7th floor) and water was nigh calf high after the two of us took back to back and not excessively long showers. Admittedly, I neglected to mention this until our last day, however this issue is rarely encountered at even the most budget oriented hotels. I was not able get online (directed to an 800 number for which I had not the energy to deal) so instead used the very accessibly computer right at the reception desk. Was able to print out boarding passes, quickly check email, etc. We were too tired to use the movies, but it was a nice idea. As to breakfast, and having read the earlier reviews, I really cannot imagine what else on earth one could want unless it is total table service with warm food being served by request. No, there is no Devonshire cream, made to order pancakes, soft boiled eggs on toast crusts. Isn't that the "not included" breakfast concept where we get to order a specific breakfast? We were thrilled with the choices: fresh (not sugared!) yogurt, fresh fruit (lots of it ) toast, and so on. There were numerous choices, in our opinion. We even took some bananas and apples for the road when on our way back. I am not a business traveller for this review, however, if the getting online in room problem could be fixed, I would highly recommend this hotel for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Occasionaltraveler4
Reviews.Content: spent 7 nights with 2 rooms for our family of 4 including a 16 and 19 year old. Complimentary breakfast was convienent although same spread every morning ( breads, coffee cake, bananas, hard boiled eggs, ham, cheese, cereals) but filled us up each morning. Rooms were nice- I asked for the Bush street side based on other reviews- and the nights were quiet. Complimentary DVD rentals with a large list was a nice perk. Very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel! beds were amazingly comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: 4greatkds
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just left this hotel after a 2 day stay, and were so happy! tripadvisor's reviews were accurate. bed was so comfortable, room very lovely, extremely clean!!! bathroom very clean. location great. corner of popular cable car stop and 2 blocks from chinatown. staff very helpful and friendly, free dvds and cds at front desk. continental breakfast alright, a bit spartan. coffe at breakfast good and strong. safe in room, and fridge, and internet connection in room and wireless and printer in lobby. all in all, loved it and paid 180 for a lovely room, which unless you do priceline, you cannot get cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: mrbrell
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days in this hotel. Overall it is a good hotel, clean, nice, well located, maybe bit expensive (but this can be said about all SF hotels I suppose). There were however 3 issues that are bit worrying: - although the breakfasts were great, they were exactly the same everyday... - little amount of money was stolen from the room (interestingly, from the mix of US and Australian coins, somebody picked only the US coins), and there was no reaction from the management although we complained twice (on the day it happened and 3 days later). - sb took some cosmetics from my cosmetics-bag left in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mdannap
Reviews.Content: Just finished a five day at the Orchard in SF. Great location just two blocks up the hill from Union Square. I stayed at the Hotel because the location where my conference(SoMa) was at was booked. I walked daily to the conference and it was just fine. The spouse was with me and toured while I worked. So much to do and see in a wonderful city. We were told by other guests that the companion restaurant down the street (the name escapes me) was wonderful. As to the hotel the front desk and concierge; they were on their game every minute. Any requests we had were responed to immediately and always with a smile. Front doors were opened. Room was immaculate with turndown ("bed linen") service if you wanted it. Someone complained here about the beds being hard-I would have described them as firm but I slept like a baby and I am a light sleeper. This place is really a hidden gem-if you want a mattress that you can sink into find another place-its that simple in this town. Everything here was to our liking and we would go back in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: SantoTomas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in September for a Fall weekend getaway, first time away without the kids in years.. Excellent service; clean, comfortable room; nice location for walking around S.F; decent breakfast buffet (nothing spectacular). No disappointments. Hired a limo for a day in Napa, took the ferry to Sausalito and Muir Woods another day. This is an excellent hotel for a couple on a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Orchard!”
Reviews.Author: missgirl
Reviews.Content: Super hotel! We had a wonderful stay at the Orchard! The room was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful. We loved watching the free movies from the CD selection at the front desk. The breakfast was delicious every morning ( many food items to choose from). Many people had issues with the bed (earlier trip advisor posts) but on being a comfortable bed- it was! The down comforter and down pillows made us a little stuffy in the mornings so we switched to foam pillows. The staff was so friendly and helpful in this matter. Overall, we had a great time and wish to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard the Best!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBCC
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation at the Orchard based mainly on the reviews from TripAdvisor - and I wasn't disappointed! I like the fact that the hotel is small. It was cozy feeling, but definitely upscale. The room we stayed in advertised 2 European twin beds, but they were almost the size of doubles. The rooms were spacious enough for 2 adults and 4 large pieces of luggage. The bathroom was gorgeous and everything was clean. The concierge/doormen (no matter which ones were on duty), were especially helpful. When our tour bus didn't pick us up at the hotel at the scheduled time, our doorman called the sightseeing company to make sure they hadn't forgotten us. We booked 2 nights and got the third at 50% off. I thought the price without the discount was reasonable for a new hotel in the Union Square area, but with the discount we ended up paying $165 a night. Definitely a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dskeeles
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in early May, for a weekend break between business trips. The experience from start to finish was excellent. While being priced similarly to other boutique hotels, the Orchard featured so many little touches that just made your stay so much more pleasant. For example: - Large room, with king-size bed, and more pillows than anyone could ever use - Free (wired) internet access (wireless only on first 2 floors, due to range of the signal) - Large TV, with combined DVD/CD/Surround-sound system - with even (surprisingly) a bass speaker, that made watching any of the extensive range of complementary, up-to-date DVDs from the hotel reception a real cinematic experience - A 'calm' book and music CD on the table for those who have trouble sleeping - Amazing 'natural flow' taps in the bathroom, that, cheesy as it may sound, reminded me of a mountain stream! - Walk-in shower - A (quite stylish) laptop for guest use just by reception, with printer, on which I printed my Alcatraz tour tickets, and boarding passes for my onward flight The staff were also very well turned out, professional, and always friendly. The overall experience was such as to make it impossible to leave the hotel feeling anything but positive. The location is also great - two blocks uphill from Union Square, and 20 paces from a Cable Car stop, which goes to Market Street in one direction (major 'real' shopping street / thoroughfare), and Fisherman's Wharf in the other (extremely touristy area). The only two hiccups: the breakfast in the downstairs restaurant, while complementary, is pretty limited in size, range and quality; I'd simply ignore it unless you really don't want to go out. The other was the Valet parking charges; the rate was advertised at $34 per 24hrs, which seemed just about reasonable - however, the valet's services are added on-top, as is tax - leading to just under $100 for two nights' parking, and taking the car out once in-between! This was as much as a week's car rental - and there is no other option. Parking in SF *is* expensive, but the price is $10 higher than at the local car parks, so the additional valet charges (I tipped as well) were unexpected. Overall, however, it's a wonderful hotel. Stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Expansive....”
Reviews.Author: Sandra76
Reviews.Content: Wow. Nice room we could stretch out in, and a lovely bathroom. The staff were perfectly cordial and helpful beyond the call of duty. We will always stay at the Orchard when we are in S.F. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: amiria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wee gem. We stayed there for 4 nights in mid April, and found staff and room very pleasant. Indeed, the bathrooms are as big as some hotel bedrooms! Lovely firm bed, great location, definately non-smoking (and smells it), nice breakfast included. We booked through the hotel website and got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Recent_TravelerCinci
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with this hotel after my husband found it on Trip Advisor. The hotel was in a really central location and we spent our mornings walking to the wharf (a long, hilly, but really great walk) which is definately something that can be done (I was pregnant). We would take a cable car or street car back to Union Square later and do some late afternoon shopping. Very nice staff, very clean rooms and bathrooms. The hotel is a block away from Chinatown and a few blocks from a great little street (Belden) with some fantastic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “3 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Earshplitten
Reviews.Content: I also booked this hotel based on the reviews here. Originally had a place booked on the Wharf, but after further reviews, decided to stay here and glad I did. Spent a lot of time reviewing all options and decided this was the place. Stayed 4/14 to 4/17. Fishermans Wharf is fun to visit, but it was nice to get away from all the activity. Booked via The Orchards website, AAA rates. Junior suite (#501) with view of Bush St. was roomy and, although right next to the elevator, was very quiet. Bathroom, big and spotless. King bed and ,surprisingly, pull-out queen sleeper were comfortable. Room was clean and modern. (I like new and big vs. old and small). Front staff couldn't have been better. Shout out to Brent-doorman (saved me a parking ticket), Art- doormen (knowledgable), Beth and the birthday girl (front staff) and the rest of the staff. Check in and check out were uneventful which is good. Continental breakfast was perfect for our needs as we're not big breakfast eaters, but did have breakfast one morning at Sears Restaurant, a couple blocks down. Don't miss it! Get the 3 or 7 day transportation pass for unlimited use of cable cars and buses (got ours at Walgreens, which is close). Arrived Sat., found a parking place on the street and found the meter is 25 cents for 5 minutes of parking. But after 6 pm, is free until Mon. am. Monday we parked a couple of blocks down Bush at the Sutter/Stockton garage. All in all, an excellent stay except for a minor hassle. Sun. a.m. went to the front desk for additional coffee packets for in room coffee maker and the person at front desk indicated ther was also coffe in the restaurant (run by another entity and not by the hotel). Went in, got two small cups to go, no charge (or I could pay $1.00 each for a large cup). Came back down and had continental breakfast. Mon. again went to the restaurant for coffee (half asleep) and was told by Jose that if I take coffee to go, this will be considered my continental breakfast or I can pay $1.50 per cup if I wanted coffee to go. Explained to him about Sun. He would not budge. Talked to Beth at front desk about this. We went back to talk to Jose and I could see Beth was surprised at his response and she asked when this change took place. He gave some lame excuse and refused her plea . She promptly took care of the problem, but all this over a couple of cups of coffee. As you know, it's never about the money. Other than that, a fantastic stay and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value conveniently located with luxurious beds”
Reviews.Author: VirgoQualitySeeker47
Reviews.Content: Having searched through lots of hotels on the web and tripadvisor reviews we were pleased we chose the Orchard. It had everything we needed without being a large noisy convention hotel. The beds and bedding were wonderful. At first I thought it was just my jet lag that made me sleep well but we were there a few days and slept soundly. Breakfast is adequate in a nice dining room. We had dinner there the first night as we were very tired and it was excellent. There is a small bar area which looks nice but we didn't use as we were out most of the time. It is a very short walk to Union square and we found San Francisco an easy city to walk around just take a jacket and sweater it can be very cold one day and sunny the next. The city attracts a lot of cloud. We went to Alcatraz and when we had tried to book on the web or by phone they said the boat was full for the whole of our stay but on contacting one of the tour companies we managed to go the very next day, they collected us from our hotel and took us to their central office (near Fishermans Wharf) and then we were taken to the boat and we then did a bus tour of the outer areas of San Francisco. If you are hiring a car after your trip to San Francisco as we did there is a Hertz office in short walking distance of the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Lulusmum
Reviews.Content: This was an absolute gem of a hotel. From walking through the door we were treated like friends and staff were exceptionally helpful and informative. The bar was ideal for pre and post dinner drinks and the breakfast was ideal. The rooms are a good size, so is the bathroom and all the comforts of a big hotel are there. The location is fantastic - it was 100 yards from the car hire company and about 10 minutes walk to downtown. We walked from here to the Golden Gate bridge - the best way to see a fabulous city. Can't wait to go back and stay at the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in mid April for 1st Anniversary. Great location, short walk to Union Square and China Town. We also walked to Fisherman's Wharf, which isn't far, but is up and down some steep hills. Room was a good size, breakfast was adequate, was on a safe street, bellman and front desk were very friendly and helpful. Internet cable included for our laptop and in-room movies provided free. In sum, great value for great location and I will be staying here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy, great hotel in Union Sq. San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Happycoco
Reviews.Content: I've been to San Francisco several times, but this hotel definitely made our trip wonderful. The location was great, easy to walk everywhere, take a cable car right there! Room was comfortably specious, hotel staffs were really friendly. (Especially, the door man, Cornell! thank you for helping us a lot!) I used the AAA price. They gave us a good deal. This hotel will be our San Francisco Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at boutique spot.”
Reviews.Author: samsonite
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at this boutique hotel and found it extremely comfortable, warmly and well-serviced, and a very good deal for the price. The location is great â€“ a few blocks from Chinatown, and a quick downhill walk to Market Street, and right next to the Powell-Mason cable car line. However, you are far enough away from the Union area crowds and traffic to feel as if you have some breathing room. The room was extremely comfortable with a great firm bed, very nice linens and pillows, and a surprisingly large space for a San Francisco hotel. Likewise, the bathroom was large, robes and slippers comfy, and Aveda products a nice touch. A minor complaint: although the shower water pressure was strong, I could not get the water temperature hot enough (even though the sink water could scorch you). The complimentary continental breakfast is served in a sunny and quiet area with most guests reading the hotel-provided newspapers. The food variety was decent (two cold cereal choices, instant oatmeal packets, breads, cheeses, fresh fruit, coffee and tea, etc.) but no options for hot food. We found the cafÃ© around the corner (CafÃ© Roxanne) very very good. Didnâ€™t try the cafÃ© recommended by the front desk, which was the other block. The front desk staff was friendly but seemed to be a bit young and green; however, they were helpful despite their inexperience which worked out fine. They didnâ€™t provide great suggestions or restaurants or other concierge-worthy advice. The mini-bar, DVD player and free movies sat untouched in my room but were nice amenities. Some warnings: like all San Francisco hotels, parking is EXPENSIVE ($34 + tip). Also, rooms facing the alley are subject to frequent and VERY LOUD garbage pick-ups in the middle of the morning! If youâ€™re a light sleeper, you may prefer a room facing Bush Street. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone looking for somewhat luxurious accommodations without the pampering service.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with the praise”
Reviews.Author: LSBurdett
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend getaway in San Francisco, having stayed at the Orchard Hotel based solely on its high ranking on TripAdvisor. We weren't disappointed. Like others I found the bed a little firm but yet slept very well on it. The people working at the hotel seemed genuinely happy to be working there and I have nothing but praise for whoever runs this place. The breakfasts worked out perfectly for us (fresh fruit, plain yogurt, hard-bioled eggs, ham, cheese, cold cereal, coffee cake, breads, bagels with cream cheese, juices, and coffee). This place is a great example of a hotel that works and that includes a rate that works. How many times have you stayed at a $300+/night hotel and had a miserable stay? Too many for me to count. If more places provided the value that this place does the world would be a better place for the traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, European-like hotel”
Reviews.Author: SilverlakeGal
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading TripAdvisor reviews and checking out the hotel site (liked the photo of a typical room), and then later realized that a friend had also recommended this hotel. AAA room rate I got through hotel website was slightly better than what was available from other popular hotel booking websites (hotels.com, orbitz). What a lovely, quiet place to stay. Room was as advertised, bathroom was spacious, all was very clean. Robes and slippers await guests. Enjoyed the Aveda bath products. Had dinner at the moderate-high priced restaurant downstairs, Vignette, which was surprisingly good (not crowded at all for a Saturday night, wonder how they survive). Because we were only staying for a one weekend (3/17/07) night, we lucked out and found street parking - left our car there and walked, taxied or took the BART to wherever we needed to go. Am told that the nearby Stockton/Sutter street parking structure was the best place for paid parking. Only complaint was the intermittent tapping noise we heard at night and in morning directly overhead in the bathroom (pipes?) We were in room 506, not sure if that was a problem anywhere else. Still, I'd stay there again (only in a different room) or try the nearby, newer, green Ochard Garden Hotel down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: UKvisitorEngland
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Francisco, to the USA in fact and there was such a bewildering array of accommodation choices that I turned to Tripadvisor. I wholly endorse all the good comments about the Orchard Hotel, indeed it was on the strength of those that I chose to book. The Orchard has the efficiency of a large hotel but with the friendliness of a much smaller one. I believe they have the balance just right. Our room was spacious (very welome as we had large suitcases) and although facing onto Bush Street it was very quiet. All the staff were very helpful, with advice, directions, "must sees" and booking our city bus tour. We would certainly stay at the Orchard again or maybe try the Orchard Garden. We will also strongly recommend it to our friends

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: shamulou
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Orchard. Based on tripadvisor reviews, we booked a 6-night stay at the Orchard at the end of March. We got a very reasonable rate ($135/night) from the hotel website using our good old-fashioned AAA discount. We could not have been more pleased with the hotel. The location is fantastic. It's set a couple of blocks north of Union Square, giving you easy and quick access to Union Square, the Financial District, Chinatown, and the Embarcadero. Even though the hotel is in the middle of everything, it's located on a relatively calm, quiet street. It definitely feels like going "home" to walk up the short hill away from Union Square to the hotel. There's also a small grocery store on the same block where you can pick up snacks and anything you forgot from home. Inside, the hotel is very nicely appointed. Check-in at the marble-tiled lobby was smooth and quick. The rooms are clean, bright, and fresh. The beds are very big and comfortable, with soft white sheets and fluffy comforters. The bathroom in our room was bright with clean, white tiles, and lots of Aveda bath products. High speed Internet is included, but unfortunately our room (on the 7th floor) did not have wireless. The complimentary breakfast buffet was a fantastic way to start the day. We took the newspaper that was delivered to our door down to the restaurant and enjoyed their freshly brewed coffee, toast, jams, cereal, fresh fruit, bagels, and juices every morning. The Orchard caters to a range of different groups of people. It is a great option for couples looking for a romantic weekend, business people wanting close access to downtown, and families with older children wanting a nice place to stay on vacation. We will definitely stay at The Orchard again next time we are in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bwm57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I heard about the hotel from friends and booked our stay with our two children. We had a wonderful time. The rooms are fantastic the location right next to the cable car stop made getting around easy. the hotel is fairly new, only about five years old I think, so everything looks new and is very clean. We would stay there again next time in San Francisco for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful --”
Reviews.Author: Nicky14
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard for four nights. Asked for a higher level room and front desk staff were too happy to put us on the 9th floor facing Bush Street. Awesome. We were almost at the end of the hall with a fabulous view of Bush and Powell. What I found so nice was how quiet the hotel was. We never heard anyone next to us or above us. The beds were sumptuous with down filled pillows and comforters. I slept very well on the beds, but my husband had trouble with them being a little too firm for him. The location is priceless. It is close to everything. We were able to walk to all of the really fun stores like Saks, but we were still able to walk or run to Fisherman's Wharf. If you like to jog, you will get a huge workout on those hills!! I would highly recomment the Orchard. And I am usually pretty picky about hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: SWHighlander
Reviews.Content: I was suspicious of all the 5* reviews here like some reviewers have mentioned, but I am happy to report on a very nice stay at The Orchard. The staff were out-of-the-way helpful, whether offering advice on getting around the city, restaurants or a town car to the aiport. The small lobby is attractively finished, but there is no room to hang out and people watch. The hotel is located on the southslope of Nob Hill, 2 blocks from Union Square. Easy walking to many restaurants and dozens of shops, and if you don't mind a steep or longer (15 minute walk), in range of Nob Hill, Japantown, SOMA, the Ferry Building and even North Beach. Mass transit is easy: a north-south (Powell-Hyde) and an east-west (California St.) streetcar line are within 2 blocks, as is a bus route. Taxis are hailable within minutes in this part of the city. My wife and I walked or used mass transit most of the time, including after midnight and never felt unsafe, although the Union Square area is thick with pandhandlers, especially during the day. (On nice weekend days, the streetcars can be insanely crowded with tourists and may necessitate finding other transportation.) Our room was on the 8th floor with a view of a couple of blocks of the city. The room was medium-size, which for San Francisco is supposedly larger-than-average. While there were a couple of small stains on the carpet, in general the room was in good condition and decorated better than a Holiday Inn but not as nice as a Hilton perhaps. We had a reading chair in one corner and a desk in another, with complimentary ethernet broadband which was fairly fast. (There is wifi in the hotel, but it only works on the 2nd floor.) An armoire held a 27" TV with DVD and CD player. The hotel has a large DVD library that you can use for free. The bed was a king, which seemed to be like a futon on top of a platform. It was overly firm: my wife didn't mind it as much as I did, but both of us slept well anyway. The minibar fridge had room to put a few of our own perishables in it, and the closet was stocked with robes, slippers and a safe. Fairly large bathroom nicely finished in polished tile with fantastic water pressure. Housecleaning was thorough and prompt everyday. The hotel works with a babysitting company (licensed and bonded) if you need to escape for an evening while they watch the kids in the room. Expensive-but-standard rate around town for hotel sitters: $100 for 4-hour minimum. Complimentary "European" breakfast consisted of a light continental breakfast with slices of ham and swiss as well. Barely sustainable for us and very average quality. They seemed to be temporarily out of 1-2 items almost at all times, although it was eventually restocked. By the way, the hotel may have used to do a little happy hour with free wine like many boutiques in the area, but they don't anymore. There is a laptop at the front desk with broadband internet access for guest use - a nice feature when you want to quickly check the weather or directions to a meeting at the last minute. Overall, we had a very nice stay and I would recommend it to friends if you don't need a grand lobby typical of the chain hotels. Service was above average, room was nice size, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Glon Drack
Reviews.Content: We found the Orchard hotel on Orbitz and decided to go with it since most other things were booked due to a conference in town. We could not have been happier with our luck. The hotel is wonderfully located, about 30 feet from the cable car lines and a 10 minute walk from the Moscone Center, Chinatown and a BART station. Our greeting by the front desk staff was terffic. They did not have a room ready yet (we arrived at 10:30AM) but took our bags, made some suggestions for Dim Sum lunch, and did a good job orienting us. Upon our return, our room was ready and the staff quickly brought our bags up. The rooms are very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The linens are great and the bathroom was huge. Great comfy robes with linings and slippers were very much appreciated. It was also well lit, which is a complaint of mine. More and more hotels seem to leave you in the dark with 25 watt bulbs. Breakfast was a very nice continental buffet with fresh fruit, baked breads, hard boiled eggs, sliced meats and cheeses, juices and great coffee. It was at our first breakfast that we had the honor to meet the owner Mrs. S.C. Huang. She is extremely unassuming, warm, brilliant person who is often in the dining room having breakfast with the guests. She shared many stories about the hotel and it's sister hotel, The Orchard Garden. The hotels are built in the loving memory of her husband and her daughter, both of whom she recently lost to cancer. The staff is extremely helpful with ideas for dinner spots, things to see, directions, and can arrange car services, taxis, and other transportation for you. Everyone seemed to be sincerely happy, so it appears it's a good place to work. I will definately be staying here the next time I come to town.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: CJGPadadena73
Reviews.Content: Took the recommendation from Trip Advisor about the Orchard Hotel in San Francisco. Liked the location, accommodations, and breakfast and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: AndyinEngland
Reviews.Content: Orchard is in a great location between Union Sq and Chinatown. Also near the cable car. Rooms are good quality, staff friendly and a good complimentary breakfast of cereal, toasts, juice, cheese, ham, eggs and drinks. I stayed and then booked for the following weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: steve_randomno
Reviews.Content: Good value for money in San Francisco at Powell and Bush. We stayed for 3 nights whilst touring the west coast and found the Hotel to be clean, modern and very well located. We didn't get around to trying the included breakfast as there were lots of other nearby places that we wanted to try, so can't comment on that. Room is very clean, very spacious (apparently remarkably so for San Francisco) with a very nice ensuite walk in bathroom with a massive walk in shower. The staff are friendly but also very professional, competent and helpful. The hotel owners obviously skilfully hand pick their staff. When we researched San Francisco hotels, it looked from the maps that location may have been a minus point. However, in reality, it is very well located for all the places that you want to explore, it is just that you wouldn't realize this until you actually stay here. Very good for Union square (shopping/cinemas), Chinatown, the financial area and Columbus/Broadway (Coffee shops) Nice touches, include complimentary robes and slippers in the rooms, along with an extensive free DVD rental library in the lobby. In short, an impressive independent hotel. Note: The owners have just opened another 'Orchard' hotel just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: Bugsy1213
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and the staff was outstanding. Every part of our stay here was pleasant. We arrived earlier than expected (nearly 2 hours before we were scheduled to check in) and they had our room ready for us anyway. They took our bags to our room and made sure we had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. After unpacking we realized the comforter and pillows were down and we're both allergic to down. I called the front desk and asked for non-down blankets and pillows. Not five minutes later they were at our door. The room was very nice - very clean and had all the ammenitites we could ask for. We thouroughly enjoyed our stay at the Orchard Hotel and will be staying there later this year when we return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tree1London
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 4 nights before Christmas. We had a long flight from London and were both very jet-lagged so we were delighted with the friendly and efficient check in and the huge room with king size bed and every amenity to make our stay comfortable (luxurious bathrobes, French soap and body lotion, tea and coffee maker and CD/DVD player). Our room faced the back so it couldn't have been quieter. Breakfast each morning was a fabulous buffet and I was particularly happy with the fresh pineapple, watermelon and honeydew melon on offer. The staff were kind and helpful and the trolley to Fisherman's Wharf was right outside our door. We were also a 5 minute walk to Union Square. I would stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone planning a trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: tly1
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is a great choice if you're looking for value, location, service and cleanliness. We stayed for three nights in early December and were pleased with accomodations. Access to everything is reasonable - two blocks off Union Square and right on the trolley line. I've stayed in everything from luxury to economy hotels, and thought this was a good bang for the buck and definitely worth revisiting.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tryakaya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centally located in the Union Square area The cable car runs at the beginning of the block. It is beautifully appointed, with large rooms and bathrooms. We especially found the beds (platform) very comfortable and not too soft. Luxurious robes and slipper were provided. A expanded continental breakfast was included in the room rate. Cerals, breads fruit, yogurt, hard boild eggs sliced ham Nothing fancy but enough to fill up to last to a late afternoon meal. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They had full size umbrellas to loan for a rainy day. What I missed was an ample sized lobby for relaxing out of the room and for people watching. I would definately reccomend this hotel and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What???”
Reviews.Author: tzn
Reviews.Content: I just do not understand all the 5 star reviews. Even the Four seasons did not get so many perfect reviews. Trip advisor should investigate... This place is just a tiny standard Best Westernish type hotel. Something is so suspicious. There is absolutely 0 customer service and it is in a noisy old building. The double beds are twin platform beds!!! Look carefully at the reviews with less than 4-5 stars, these are truly the accurate ones. Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: tineyfiney
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights in November. It is true that this hotel is exceptionally clean and the rooms are spacious. However, the accoutrements are quite common and it does (as a previous reviewer stated) very much resemble a Holiday Inn. I was dissappointed because I was looking for a unique hotel with a special flair, and there was none. I also found the location to be somewhat dissapointing. The restaurants in the downtown area are terrible, and there is nothing to do except shop at the same stores found anywhere else in the US. You have to travel at least 3 miles to get to any SF point of interest. All in all, I would reccommend The Orchard to business travelers, but not to those looking for a weekend getaway or a SF vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JCalabrese
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at The Orchard. I cannot say enough about the fine staff and accomodations. This is a top rate hotel and the only one we will stay at for future visits to SF.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is remarkable. The rooms are extremely large, especially the bath room. The decor is tasteful and serene. Having a DVD/Cd player in each room is a wonderful idea. It is perhaps the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff are unfailingly polite and helpful. When I needed help in printing a document, they were able to direct me to the right place in a twinkle of an eye. The complimentary breakfasts were bountiful and of a surprisingly high quality. The rooms must have been sound-proofed. Once inside, you don't hear a sound from outside. This is a terrific place to either work or unwind (I did both). It also is a bargain, especially given the ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: BDRCO
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful nights at the Orchard Hotel and couldn't have asked for a better location or more excellent service. The hotel was built in 2000. The rooms are very clean and nicely appointed. Service is very friendly, warm and responsive. The breakfast was wonderful (the coffee cake is delicious); we didn't even think of going anywhere else for breakfast. The hotel is located near Union Square so the best in San Francisco shopping is just a block away. The Bart (subway) station is just a few blocks away, and the cable car can be picked up right outside the hotel. This hotel is a real find. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay; a great example for all hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Valensander
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Orchard hotel for 5 days, last October. What a great find it was! It deserves the #1 in Tripadvisor. The location is wonderful; very close to Union square. We were happy we didn't stay near Fishermans Wharf; Union Square is much better! The cable car runs ten steps from the hotel door and all the shops, department stores, restaurants are close-by. Customer Service is wonderful. The staff at the desk is so genuinly friendly, efficient and helpful, same for the doormen/concierges. Upon arrival we had a broken showerhead-hook and it was fixed within 10 minutes! The room was immaculate and so was the bathroom (very large too!). Plenty of nice Aveda stuff. No bath, but we prefer showers anyway. Free DVD's you can pick out at the front desk to watch in your room. Good selection. Free internet-computer use at the front desk. Free continental breakfast too! Not just a dry muffin, but a very good choice of breads, fruit, cereal, yoghurt, juices etc... What can I say, we can't wait to go back. Also good news is that this hotel is about to open the sister-hotel "The Orchard Garden" just down the road! Two of these, wow! Truly a little gem, this hotel. No, I'm not a stockholder...

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SND76
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who stays in San Francisco. The location cannot be beat - and I heard this from San Francisco locals! :) Just as you step out of the hotel, there is a cable car stop to take you to Chinatown & Fisherman's Wharf. Or, if you want to walk, Chinatown is a short walk from the hotel. Union Square is also a short walk from the hotel...there is a great mall there! The staff was great - the front desk staff & doormen are great and you feel like they genuinely want to help you. The free breakfast was more than expected for a 'continental' breakfast. There are even waiters there to make sure the tables are clean and that there is never a shortage of food. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The TV in the room has more channels than most hotels. The hotel was quiet and I never heard any noise either from the outside or the halls. I did a LOT of research before booking my trip to San Fran & think I made the right choice by booking the Orchard. The price was comparable to all of the other hotels, and it was well worth the money. I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous small hotel, friendly home feel”
Reviews.Author: hurry-wait
Reviews.Content: 5 ladies (stayed 3 nights), came to San Francisco to participate in the Nike Women's Marathon. The location was perfect for cable car rides (1/2 block away) to North Beach or Fisherman Wharf. Union Square the start and main activity location for the Nike Marathon was 3 blocks away, we walked to the start line 10 minutes before the gun! Great shopping is 3 - 5 blocks away. With a smaller hotel one get's to know the staff and they were friendly and professional; from giving directions, on time wake up calls, to sorting out and dividing our bill. Always helpful the bell men really tried to get us van or limo type cabs who could take 5. Note: the hotel seems to have very few twin bedded rooms. Restaurant tip - Cable car or cab it to the North Beach - Washington Square area for a great selection of Italian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: MauraShep
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay in this beautiful, spotless, convenient hotel. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and movies, and the staff was extremely friendly. Absolutely Zero complaints! I'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “a real find!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JCPGJP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orchard for 3 nights as the first destination after our wedding in Chicago. I did extensive research after a previous trip a few years ago staying at Fishermans Wharf was a little dissapointing. We eventually picked this hotel due to other reviewers comments and what an absolute find!!!! Where do you start? Location...fab! Breakfast...more than adequate. With only 9 rooms per floor the rooms were spacious with large bathrooms. Very clean and extremely quiet. Internet access a bonus in reception(especially if you are from England and need the Football scores!!) Got a great rate direct on the hotel's website, doorman very helpful and also booked a trip through him. We will certainly be returning to this hotel unless, like a previous reviewer stated, The Orchard Garden is even better.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: rocketb
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room at this hotel several months in advance and prepaid through Orbitz. Upon our arrival after a cross country flight, we were told by the front desk that our reservation had been cancelled...they of course blamed Orbitz. Orbitz had no record of a cancellation. When asked for an explanation, there was none, other than they apparently overbooked. They put us in an inferior hotel in another section of the city, and as everything else was booked, we had no choice. We left our number for the supervisor, who of course never called us. Very unprofessional behavior.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for one problem”
Reviews.Author: klsrd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and well located. The rooms were immaculate and the breakfast was great. The only problem was that there was no internet access in the rooms; in fact, the only place where you could use the web was on the hotel's laptop, which was set up at the reception desk. This was an inconvenience for us, and so we would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: HJPofi
Reviews.Content: Location Location Loaction. And James too. Great hotel in a perfect SF location. Two blocks from Union Square shopping. A great staff all helpful and friendly. Very clean and updated and spacious rooms. Hard to find in a big city. And Oh Yeah, Say Hi to James at the front door. He is worth the price of the room in his knowledge alone!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard - great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard hotel for four nights in late September; we did this on the basis of previous reviews on this site (common with other reviewers). We were not disappointed. Reasonable rates for downtown SF, good size rooms, filling breakfast, friendly staff, great location, free DVDs for lazy evenings after a day of hill climbing. Would definitely stay at the Orchard again, unless its sister hotel (opening just up the road on Bush - the Orchard Garden I think) gets even better reviews!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does everything right.”
Reviews.Author: Snarky
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because all of the ones available through my convention were booked. I was a little uneasy because it's an independent property, and when I think "boutique hotel" I think cramped and overly frilly. I shouldn't have worried. This hotel is excellent. They set the tone at check-in. I arrived late at night, but found the night staff every bit as sharp as the day crew. Check-in was efficient and friendly. Even though the room was two doubles (I prefer a king or queen), it was large and comfortable. The linens are soft, the furniture in good condition, the bathroom was large and spotlessly clean, and the DVD system was a nice plus. (they lend DVD's at the front desk for free) You'll also find a CD in the room called "Deep Sleep 101" that helped me unwind and put me to sleep within minutes. I usually don't sleep well the first night in a hotel because I'm not comfortable. I slept soundly the first night at the Orchard - it's that comfortable. Of all the hotels I've been in this year on business (and at last count, I'm over 100 nights on the road this year) this is the first one I want to come back with my wife and vacation at. Downers: The complmentary breakfast in the morning is European style - some meats, cheeses, and breads - not to be confused with the American "continental" breakfast that's fruit, donuts, and bagels. If you prefer an American breakfast (whether hot or continental) you won't find it here. Turn left out the front of the hotel and walk two steps to the corner of Powell and Bush. There's a cafe there. Also, if you turn left on Powell, you'll find some other restaurants within a block or so. If you turn right out of the front door of the hotel, you won't find much of anything food-wise. If you're attending something at the Moscone Center, this hotel is within walking distance. It's downhill heading to the convention center, but you'll get a real workout coming back

Reviews.Title: “Everything others siad it was”
Reviews.Author: Wolfe
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to its reputation. We were very contented with service and room. The restaurant attached to the hotel was excellent,although a little expensive. Breakfast was good, but rather crowded. One word of warning, to get to the hotel from Union square requires walking up some very steep hills, not for the old or infirm. However if you want to be in the heart of things this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: rg1ga
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a five-day stay at the Orchard. We did so based primarily on the TripAdvisor reviews. They are entirely accurate, IMO. This is a wonderful hotel with excellent service and location. While we have stayed in more luxurious properties, we did not agree at all with a previous reviewer stated it was a "glorified Holiday Inn". The rooms were spacious, although not huge, and very clean. The decor was tasteful with high quality everywhere. The beds are platform and firm but not hard. They were very comfortable. Bathroom was large. The shower could have been more forceful and it would have been nice if there was a second sink. The breakfast buffet was very good but does get repetative after a couple of days. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: dingbees
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Francisco after a 3 night stay at the Orchard Hotel. We picked the Orchard because of the price, the location and the positive reviews. We arrived at SFO and walked over to the BART station, A 30 minute ride into the City for $5.50 one way is a great way to transfer. Arrived at the BART Powell Station and walked up the stairs and caught the Powell/Mason Cable car which dropped us about 100 feet from our hotel. Our check in was painless and the staff was very accommodating. They gave us a choice of a couple of rooms, we opted to take a room on the 6th floor facing Bush street (front of hotel), the front desk staff said that if was quieter because the back side of the hotel has trash pick up noise in the early hours of the morning. We found our room to be very clean, with adequate amenities. The king size bed was very comfortable and shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, hair dryer were provided. The room was exceptionally quiet, with no adjacent room sounds and very little street noise. Each morning a buffet continental breakfast was provided with several choices of ham, cheese, hard boiled eggs, toast, jam/jellies, spice cake, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, juices, etc. The rooms also include DVD players and the front desk has a variety of DVD movies to choose from at no cost. We ate at several places during our stay, but absolutely loved Harris Steak House for the best filet I ever tasted, also ate at Tadisch Grill, the seafood was excellent, and for a quick inexpensive great Chinese lunch, try the House of Nanking. I would definately stay at the Orchard Hotel on our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: jl#1
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for a week at the Orchard at the end of August in 2 connecting rooms. The rooms were large (our rooms were at the end of the hall; the room sizes do vary, but all seem to be adaquate), and the bathrooms were very large. The rooms were immaculate; the bedding is a little firm. We used the HVAC a couple of times, and it was whisper quiet. In general the rooms and the hotel are very quiet (our room faced Bush St. Other reviews said rooms facing the alley can be noisy). The views from the street side are OK - - nothing outstanding. Very attractive, relatively new, furniture. We had a king bed, while our children each had twin beds - but these twins were very wide, not the standard twin beds you might be familiar with. The linens and bath towels were excellent; the bath robes were great. The turn-down service was a nice, unexpected touch. The TV/DVD/Surround sound system, with free current DVD movies at the desk, provide a nice way to relax after a long day of sight-seeing. The staff, from the front desk to the doormen, were accommodating, professional and pleasant. The free breakfast was adaquate - - not great, but very convenient. It was buffet style fresh fruit, breads (surprisingly, no bagels), cereals, yogurt, juices, ham, cheese, coffee and tea. The free internet access is a big plus when you need to stay in touch with the office frequently. The hotel is located in a wonderfully convenient area, a few blocks north of Union Square, and a few blocks away from China Town. A cable car stops at the corner that can take you to Fishermen's Wharf and Pier 39 (an unexpectedly tacky area - glad we didn't stay there). Some reviews wrote about poor experiences with the restaurant. We learned that the restaurant space is leased to a private restaurant operator that is unaffiliated with the hotel. Unfortunately, the hotel has no control over the restaurant. It's too bad that the restaurant operator doesn't seem too concerned with his primary customer base - - the hotel guests. With so many fabulous restaurants in the immediate area, this should not be a major concern. We had a good discussion with the hotel's owner/main partner. She is a lovely senior citizen who spends most of her time in Australia. She shows great concern for the feelings of the guests, including what type of breakfast food is set out in the morning (although she has no direct control over it, she does speak to the operator about it). She goes to great lengths to keep the hotel clean and environmentally friendly. In general, this hotel was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Met All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: accidental_squirrel
Reviews.Content: We spent twelve nights at the Orchard on an extended business trip. The hotel was attractive, the staff attentive, and the room comfortable. I needed the free internet access and the national newspapers. The only problem we had was on one night we had several other rooms on our floor that were rented to a group which came in late and were very intoxicated. Between the door slamming and their yelling back and forth at each other, we didn't get much sleep. However, boorish guests are not the fault of the hotel. It just happens. The breakfast was good if you consider that it is a cold buffet and we had the same thing for twelve days. They apparently use a premium coffee blend which tasted better than most places. We would definitely stay at the Orchard in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cabound1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent amenities, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to shop, this is the place for you...”
Reviews.Author: AMY17
Reviews.Content: This is only my second trip to SF, so I thought I'd try a new area and I heard Union Square is great for shopping - and it is - if you don't live anywhere near a major city or shopping mall. The only thing you're going to get is every chain store known to man. Everything from H&M to Hermes. I'd recommend staying in a different location. The Warf, Marina, or Knob Hill. However, the hotel was fine, room was clean, bathroom was pretty big. Best things - free breakfast in the morning and free internet access in your room. Worst things - elevator took forever, staff was a little rude, and they kill you with a $34 parking charge the second you pull up - you basically don't have a choice. There is a $7 lot down the street, but you have to move your car by 6 a.m. They should tell you about that up front.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for touring SF”
Reviews.Author: Bills2pay
Reviews.Content: The Orchid proved an excellent base for our family's stay in SF. Centrally located between Chinatown, Union Square and on cable car line. Locally owned, very friendly staff, clean and well decorated. Free internet in rooms, free DVD library and upgraded sound/video systems in rooms were all nice pluses.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tokalosh
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 children aged 11 and 14 y.o. stayed here for 4 nights. We chose the hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. It's in a good location: close to Union Square but slightly removed from the hustle snd bustle of the square. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The accomodations are extremely comfortable and above average. This hotel is more of a boutique-style hotel and we regard this as a big advantage. We prefer smaller upmarket hotels to the larger and grander chains. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. We noted that the owners are due to open a second property in SFO soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel, but pretty good”
Reviews.Author: AreAnyNamesNotTaken
Reviews.Content: The Orchard isn't exactly the trendy boutique hotel that the website would have you believe (instead, think upmarket Holiday Inn), and it's not the best value for money in the world, but overall there's not much to complain about. Rooms are a decent size and impeccably clean, and the location is almost perfect, being close to shops, restaurants, tourist attractions and the financial district. Staff are charming and bend over backwards to be helpful. Breakfast is at best pretty average, and based on that, plus the very dated look of the dining room, I elected not to even try out the restaurant. Besides, there are endless fantastic places to eat within a 5 minute stroll of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: MJCB
Reviews.Content: Expecting a mediocre city hotel at this rate, we were very pleasantly surprised! The hotel room was very spacious, tasteful and immaculate. The bathroom was big, swanky and sparkling clean. The room has a coffeemaker and bar fridge. It also has a flat screen television and dvd player and a good up to date selection of dvdâ€™s to borrow from reception at no charge if you wanted to stay in for the evening. There is also a laptop at the reception desk for free internet use. Another surprise was that breakfast is included in the rate. The breakfast room is bright and airy and the spread is continental including fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, bread, hams, cheese, juice and good coffee. The concierge (Nate) was exceptionally helpful and had good restaurant recommendations â€“ some within walking distance. The hotel also has its own restaurant if you wanted to stay in for the night â€“ we did not try this, so can not comment on the food. Transport is not a problem. There is a tram stop to Fishermanâ€™s wharf within a minuteâ€™s walk from the hotel â€“ trams passing by can be full in the mornings, but it is a relatively short downhill walk past Union Square (and Macyâ€™s) where the tram ride starts. The doormen were also extremely helpful and could hail a taxi if needed within a minute. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dunedin899
Reviews.Content: Very good value at Â£50-Â£60 per person per night for twin room. Staff very helful. Very efficiently run, with great attention to detail. Centrally located close to Union Square. Would definitely go back. Probably the best hotel /best-value hotel we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up as high as they can go”
Reviews.Author: TravelingL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard for a full week and did not have a single complaint. Staff members were friendly and helpful and the rooms were spotless. The location is excellent as the hotel is within walking distance of upscale stores like Macys and Tiffanyâ€™s in Union Square, as well as more reasonable ones like H&M, Ross and Forever 21. Additionally, it's conveniently close to all public transit. There's a Walgreenâ€™s one block away, a steep hill block, but still a block. Another plus is the free dvds the hotels offers. The ravioli friti at the Italian restaurant on the corner across from the hotel are a must! I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buck02131
Reviews.Content: We stay in all kinds of places from the Elements in the Mission, a hostel, to the Laurel Inn, a boutique inn on Pacific Heights. We stayed here two nights in August while visiting family. We liked this hotel for the friendliness of the staff and big room. We rated it excellant because they were everything they said they would be at a competitive price. We agree with most of the positive reviews on this site. A word on the garbage trucks. If the noise is a worry, request a room high up in the front, because the dumpsters are loaded in the back alley. We were on the seventh floor in the back so we heard the trucks but not very loudly. We reserved through the hotel website, taking the pay up front internet option. This was the cheapest price we could find.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and convenient! Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MeiFan01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Orchard for 3 days. It was our first visit to San Francisco and we absolutely fell in love with the place. It was so pretty, clean and the weather was perfect. The Orchard was very conveniently placed for exploring the city - it's just 5 minutes walk from Union Square, and a short cable car ride down to Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz. The hotel itself was amazing. The rooms were very spacious and very clean. The bed was simply amazing - it was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. We definitely didn't want to leave that behind! The staff were friendly and very helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NPJ50
Reviews.Content: I've been burned by glowing reviews of hotels that turned out to be mediocre, so I was concerned that all the great reviews of The Orchard Hotel might turn out to be hype. I'm happy to say that they were all correct. I had a wonderful experience at the hotel. My room was fairly small but extremely comfortable and very quiet (on the top floor, which probably helped). The bed was great, the bathroom was spotless, and having the free DVD rental was a nice touch. Having the continental breakfast included was a big plus--there was plenty to eat and it was all tasty, and the restaurant space was a relaxing place to start the day. The hotel location was central to everything, and the staff was quite helpful when I needed advice on getting places. Thanks to everyone at The Orchard, my stay in S.F. was completely hassle-free!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: JohnT.D.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent 3-night stay at the Orchard Hotel. The staff were outstanding, offering excellent restaurant suggestions and going the extra mile to make reservations. The location is ideal and the rooms were extremely clean, quiet and more than adequately equipped. The continential breakfast each morning was somewhat repetitive, but certainly adequate. I doubt I'd think about staying anywhere else on my next visit. John Kitchener, ON

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AColoradoTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Orchard for the San Francisco Marathon and could not have asked for a better experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful, making sure that our special request for a higher level floor was granted. The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds. The continental breakfast was better than expected. My wife injured her foot just before our trip making our nightlife limited so we especially enjoyed the in-room DVD player and free movies. We will definitely stay at the Orchard again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: Graymix
Reviews.Content: San Francisco appears to have hotels on every block and the Orchard stands out as one of the best and excellent value for money. The positive reviews by others are spot on. The location is very close to Union Square and the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel room is clean, modern and spacious and comes with extras such as free wireless internet access, breakfast, dvds etc. The added extras and the effort of the staff to help makes the Orchard well worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: raskinco
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in July. The hotel was beauitful and and very well kept. The location in Nob Hill is great location in walking distance to Union Square. Although the hotel is in a busy area the room was very quiet, even with the trolley cars running on the street right beside it. The room was a nice size. The bed was comfortable, and the shower had better than average water pressure. The room was very clean and like the rest of the hotel was very well kept. The complimentary breakfast was simple, but a nice way to start the day. Had a great stay and will most certainly stay there again the next time we are in the Bay area. Recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: pixelriter
Reviews.Content: Although this is a good business-class hotel -- not many frills, but very clean and otherwise well run -- they have lost our business entirely. On check-out, the bellman forgot one of our bags in the hotel room -- it was not in the pile on the floor with the others. Unfortunately, we did not notice this missing bag until the next morning. We called the hotel immediately. Housekeeping had already found our bag. The hotel took no responsibility, and the bellman even lied and said the bag was not with the others "in the hallway" -- all of the bags were in the room, none were in the hallway. The kicker is that we checked out on Monday July 31. It is now Sunday August 6 and they STILL have not shipped the bag -- even though we provided a credit card to pay for the shipping!!! This has been an infuriating experience and we intend to take our business elsewhere -- we travel to San Francisco often on business and pleasure. The Hotel Monaco is a MUCH friendlier environment and much more professional. The treatment we received at Orchard is totally unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: a12barblues
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the bay area , stayed at the Orchard two nights. Great location for shopping in or around the Union Square area if your what to go to mainstream stores like Macy's, Nordstoms ect. Service is very good , doorman will help with what ever transportation needs you have. We drove from So Cal and used the valet parking. Whenever we needed our car we just called the doorman and he had it brought from the garage which is a couple of blocks away. We also used a taxi to go to the Giants game about $10 one way which was still cheaper ( and easier) than $25 to park at AT&T. Found excelent shopping in the Cow Hollow area, again the doorman gives great directions and after a few days there the streets start to make sense, If you get back late there is a little pizza place right across the street called Uncle Vito's which puts out some good pizza for small price. The Euro breakfest is good the first day , but they didn't change the menu so after the second day it gets kind of old. Rooms very comfortable and bath very large with top soaps ect. However at least in our case from the 5th floor the only view you'll get is of the building next door. Will return to this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Treetops2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for just one night at the end of our vacation. What a great choice....I chose it from all the great reviews on Tripadvisor. ALL the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious with a very large bath. Everything was beautifully appointed. Our room was on an upper floor with a nice view of the street below. I had mentioned it was my birthday and the concierge brought a box of chocolates to the room. The location was great..after we valet parked the car..we walked around downtown in the evening. Chinatown is just a block away , Union Square is around the corner, the cablecar is just outside the door. We did a bit of bar-hopping and then found a lovely, small Italian place just around the corner for dinner. The breakfast in the morning was a nice touch. I've stayed at other places in San Francisco but The Orchard Hotel was the best experience...lots of bang for the buck....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: MaryStarbucks
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend and the Orchard and would recommend it to anyone. Staff was very friendly and helpful, room was lovely and good-sized, and location can't be beat. Close to the Union Square shopping, Chinatown, cable cars, but on a pretty quiet street. We loved it there and will stay again next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: showes
Reviews.Content: I arranged a surprise 25th anniversary trip to San Francisco (first time there) and was really nervous about where to stay. Obviously, I would only get one chance to do this right. I read tons of hotel reviews (probably spent 6 hours total) and finally decided on the Orchard Hotel. Most reviews were positive and the price was right ($169-299 depending on the night vs. $400+ for others). EVERYTHING from the location to the room to the staff was perfect. I don't mean really good... I mean perfect. The location is prime! You have access to the Powell street cable car no more than 20 feet from the front door. The room was large and spotless. It's only a few years old and the maid service was fantastic. Finally, the staff was the friendliest and most professional I've ever experienced. I had flowers delivered 3 days in a row and they were always in our room in water/vase when we arrived. James and Bob (doormen) can do and will do anything you need. They are professionals at taking care of the details. A great treat was meeting the hotel owner Mrs. Huang. She told me "I tell my staff that I only have the money our guests spend here to pay you. So, treat them with respect and treat them well so they'll come back and so they'll refer their friends to us. Otherwise, we won't be able to stay in business". Trust me, the staff hears and responds. If you're looking for a great place to stay in San Francisco, make one phone call - to the Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was everything and more! All the little extras, very nice breakfast. Free internet and movies.Will defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 2 blocks from Union Square and all the shopping you can handle. It is beautifully decorated. The rooms are large, spotless, and fully equipped with anything you need. The fitness center is easy to use and is open most of the time (4 machines.) Your car is parked in a nearby garage and takes about 30 minutes for it to be pulled up in front of the hotel for you. Most of the staff is friendly, helpful, and professional. The dining menu was limited and we did not eat in the hotel (many places nearby.) The only problem we had was in the lounge. We waited for drinks and left after 20 minutes. Our stay was very enjoyable and I would re-book in this well managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard Hotel was excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orchard Hotel in San Francisco for three days in June '06 and it was one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. For starters, the location simply cannot be any better. It's at the corner of Powell and Bush, just a step off the curb to cable cars, buses , street cars and taxi's in one of the most active parts of the city. The Hotel itself is beautiful and clean. The room was large with a very large bathroom and a great shower head! Big TV, DVD player and free DVD rentals made for relaxing late nights. Internet access allowed us to check our e-mail and print our flight boarding passes at the hotel. The continental breakfast was much more than we expected and everthing was plentiful and fresh. We booked a value package which was very reasonable for SF at about $158.00/night before taxes. James the doorman is somewhat of a legend there, he's friendly, very verbal and does his job with a great deal of enthusiasm. He actually stood in the middle of Powell St. one morning for about five minutes blowing his whistle trying to wave down a taxi for us. He did succeed. Overall a great experience and we will stay there on our next SF trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Fantastic Location, shame about the resturant/bar”
Reviews.Author: MarkCornwall_UK
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Francisico and loved it. We had a suite on an upper floor with a view of the front street and cable car. The reception staff were lovely and helpful and the suite was very nice, spacious, clean and quiet. The location is absolutly perfect for getting around. The only negative was we were very disappointed with the service we got from two male members of the bar staff. We were visiting with our two children aged 7 and 14 and we had spent a day doing a lot of walking, in the evening they were very tired and we allowed them to stay upstairs watching TV whilst we decided to go down and eat in the restaurant. We asked the barmen if we could have two cheese sandwiches sent to the room for the boys. They said this could not be done as it wasn't on the menu, we persuaded them to go and ask the chef but apparently the chef said that although he had both cheese and bread there was no way he was going to do this. When we explained that the boys were upstairs watching TV after a long day and just wanted something quick and easy one of the two barmen commented that perhaps the solution would be to turn off the TV! In fact both of these barmen had a friend at the bar and were more interested in discussing "adult" web sites with each other thank attending to their guests. Yes it was a quiet night and the restaurant was empty and we were the only two at the bar, however this is no excuse. Needless to say we declined to eat at the restaurant and went down to Subway to get a sandwich for us all. We really feel this let them down a lot and was not the sort of service that appears to get them such a good rating on trip advisors web site and so accounts for them not getting 5 stars from us. We would like to say that the young girl who works the restaurant floor and the lady who works on the bar were very nice, chatty and helpful and perhaps the two gentlemen might take a lesson in good manners and a helpful attitude from them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard hotel for two nights (June 5th to 7th). Cannot complain. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, spacious enough for two adults with huge luggages. Wasn't much of a view but that is to be expected. The bathrooms were bright and spacious - very cheerful - though ours only had a shower (so be sure to ask for one with a bath if you need one). Continental breakfast served was more then adequate and in a nice and pleasant restaurant in the hotel. Again, very bright and cheery. The staff were superfriendly and location is great. The option of renting DVDs from the front desk was a nice touch Only drawback would be the limited room service. So we found ourselves in a small fix when we ended up hungry at 2 am as a result of terrible jet lag. Nevertheless, the hotel is surounded by nice restaurants so if you're eating at normal times, there is little need for room service. Having stayed in many larger chain hotels, the Orchard Hotel was a really pleasant surprise. I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Terranova65
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel was absolutely fabulous. I choose to stay there based on the reviews I read on this site, not to mention the awesome rate I received. Everything I read was right on, down to the very professional and courteous staff. I was traveling alone and felt safe in their care. The location is prime. The hotel is definitely within walking distance or a quick cable car ride to the best sites in San Francisco. The rooms were immaculate and the Aveda products were a plus, not to mention their complementary robes which are to die for. I think you can purchase them also. This trip was business but the next is pleasure with my kids. I will not hesitate to stay at The Orchard again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a vacation in San Francisco. We stayed 4 nights at The Orchard. We really enjoyed our stay. We requested an upper floor when we made the reservation, and were given a room on the 8th floor (10 floors total). We booked directly from their website and got a very good deal. Our room was quiet and clean. We loved the bed and slept so well. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and went out of their way to make sure we were happy. We ate the free breakfast 3 of the 4 mornings. It was good. We had fresh fruit, yogurt, breads & muffins, hard-boiled eggs, and juice. They also offered cereal, sliced ham and cheese, and coffee & tea. It was plenty to start us out for the day. We stopped by to look at the gym when we arrived... It is very small. Turns out we did so much walking up and down the hills in the city that we didn't end up using the gym. If you like to workout while away on vacation or on business, be aware that their gym is tiny. It is essentially 4 pieces of equipment (2 bikes, a treadmill, and a stairmaster) in one of the hotel rooms. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is a great deal for the money. And it's in a great location near the cable car line and Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lacunar
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is an excellent choice for someone looking for an above average hotel at a reasonable rate. The location is superb. Located in Union Square, you are within walking distance of the financial district, quality shopping areas, Chinatown, and Little Italy. The Cable Cars stop half a block from the front door of the hotel, providing quick and easy access to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel rooms are of an average size but are tastefully decorated. The showers are powerful, and it only takes a few seconds for the water to become hot after turning-on the faucets. The breakfast included in the room price is above average, featuring coffee cakes, fruit, toast, hard boiled eggs, ham, cheese, and a selection of juices/coffee/tea. My only complaint with this hotel was the poor quality of the pillows. Other than that, I was very pleased with this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ratings”
Reviews.Author: CK1668
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard on May 6th, 7th, and 12th for three nights. We couldn't enjoy more. Everyone at the front desk, especially Tammy, were extremely helpful. Check-in & check-out were a breeze. We loved the bed sheets, comforter, & pillows. They are Frette linens, top quality European linens, super comfy & soft so we were able to sleep very well at night. There were a variety of TV stations to choose from, including my favorite Satellite channels: Food network, In Style, and Bravo TV. Also complimentary were the wireless, high speed internet. You couldn't find more in a hotel under $200 around Union Square. We thought this was a steal! We booked the park & stay pkg so our parking was only $18/day (a bargain in Union Square), with unlimited in-&-out priviledges. It was nice since we just notify the front desk that we needed the car, and the car will be available to us in 15 min. Very convenient indeed.
