Reviews.Content: This place is great! Location is supurb, just a few blocks from Union Square. Mind you they are a few UPHILL blocks but they're blocks toward a better neighborhood as well. Staff was so helpful and friendly. We ordered a cab for 4 am the night before we left and it was there as promised! Room service was great as well, which is rare. The free breakfast is amazing, way more selection than the usual "continental" breakfast served in US hotels. Rooms are very attractive as well, also the hotel is nice and quiet. Only complaint I might have is that the beds are a bit HARD but they were probably good for one's back! Also we were in an "accessible" room with a very strangely-configured bedroom. The price is right for this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a night at The Orchard, to have a night in San Francisco. I wouldn't say there was anything outstanding about The Orchard, but everything was very good. The room was large by San Francisco standards, clean, well-lit, but dark at night, with a huge king bed and a desk with two chairs (an important issue to my wife). The bathroom was comfortable but not oversize, with a bathtub long enough to stretch out in (at least for someone not too tall). The decor was pleasant, though not strongly of any style. We didn't have any noise problems on our Sunday night/Monday morning--we were on the Bush Street side. Since the play we saw was two blocks away, no complaints about the location. It's very close to the Union Square shopping district and the Financial District, as well as Chinatown. The hotel is well up a hill. It's in a neighborhood that mixes hotels and apartment buildings rather than in the core of the downtown--we find these neighborhoods generally more pleasant. I thought the breakfast was well above average--it included fruit, meat, cheese, all sorts of cold food. I'd rather have good quality cold food than steam table hot food. I also appreciated the way they asked if we wanted a minibar key, that allowed us to say no and not have to worry about it. I'd certainly reccomend this hotel to people coming to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Thats all true...But”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at the Orchard 6 16-19 and all the comments made below are absolutely true. Its a very nice little hotel, helpful staff, free DVDs, all that. HOWEVER. I can't believe noone is talking about THE NEIGHBORHOOD ITS IN!!! I am a city girl, and not wet behind the ears by any means...but for me, junkies shooting up in an alley full of garbage and used condoms on the sidewalk are a bit much!! Pardon my candor but these are things personally viewed by me at 8, 9 o'clock in the morning on my daily walk to Starbucks. It can't be ignored. If you are planning on staying here, you need to be aware that this is what it is. 2 Blocks South is Union Sq and that's fine...but the rest is just ugly and frankly, there's enough ugliness in my life. I don't need to pay to see it when I am on vacation. I couldn't recommend it to my family or friends, there are just too many other places.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for your stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel strictly on looks and location for a business trip. I typically stay at another hotel but due late booking, I was not able to. For someone that doesnâ€™t like change, I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were spacious and clean. The bed was really comfortable and the idea of not having to pay for movies I loved. They have around 200 + movies for your viewing pleasure and a DVD player in your room. So on the one day that it rained I just checked out a movie. Made for a great business trip, plus the location is quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Twentysomething
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and like many others, I'm unable to fault it. Paying more to stay at the Westin or a similar hotel is simply not worth it. Also, I loved the breakfast for its focus on healthfulness -plenty of fresh fruit, yogurt and sensibly sized pastries. I ate enough elsewhere on vacation to be relieved they weren't tempting me with pancakes and waffles!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tennchick
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Francisco and stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 4 nights. The staff was very helpful, friendly. Rooms had plenty of space. Doesn't matter if the room is in front or on the back you still hear the garbage trucks at 4 a.m. Just roll over and go back to sleep! The location is perfect to catch the cable car. If and when we return to the city by the bay we will stay at the Orchard!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for san francisco”
Reviews.Author: rb157
Reviews.Content: I could not fault the hotel, but the location really sold it. At the corner of the street the cable car can be picked up on both lines, china town and union square are both easily walkable, and getting down to fishermans wharf was an easy walk through china town and the italian quarter or a little more strenuous over the hill of powell street. The staff of the hotel were always courteous, I had no complaints about the service and the basic breakfast was included in the price (which certainly makes a change). The room had everything we needed and was well insulated from the noise of the city although we were on the 8th floor at the back of the hotel. Another review has complained of the trash being emptied in the alley behind the hotel. This is a minor problem and the time of this occuring is fairly irregular, but this would not stop me staing at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2adventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is clean, quiet, with a friendly staff. The room was nothing special, but was fine. The only complaint I have is that the carpet in our room really needed to be cleaned, and the furnishings were a bit worn around the edges. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The location was within easy walking distance of Union Square and China Town. Overall our stay was pleasant if not extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: rgilbert
Reviews.Content: As a result of reviews here on trip advisor we booked the Orchard Hotel for 4 nights this may. This hotel is situated in a really great location. The Orchard is close enough to Union Square and China Town but not too close. The Tram Line is just outside the hotel. The Bed was so comfortable and the room was really nicely decorated with a good sized bathroom. I note some people have commented that the price was not too good but compared to London prices The Orchard is a real Gem. The only downside is the breakfast which is not that great but adequate. If you decide to stay at the Orchard the pizza place opposite the hotel serves nice pizza. Me and my husband really enjoyed a pizza pesto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at the Orchard Hotel in San Francisco and highly recommend it to anyone who values safety, cleanliness, comfort and location in a hotel stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the laptop available in the lobby is a nice touch. Rooms aren't huge, but spacious enough for two not to be bumping into each other and tripping over luggage. Bathrooms are large and the water pressure in the shower is really good (you can actually rinse the shampoo out of your hair!) Clientele isn't pretentious and atmosphere is relaxed luxury. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: MiguelJ
Reviews.Content: Loved the location.. Rooms, staff, breakfast, all were first-rate. I did notice, however, the Grant Hotel, just down the block at half the price. It looked perectly nice, but the reviews say it's a little less spiffy than the Orchard. Might try it next. But no fault to find with the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Set up for disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MeMeNMe2
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews on tripadvisor before making my decision on where to stay while I was in SF. I was floored about what great reviews the Orchard Hotel got over and over again. Maybe it made me expect more from them. We had problems from the moment we got there. Our room was not ready when it was promised, and they messed up our very specific reservations. (about what floor we wanted to be on, and that we wanted rooms on seperate floors.) Once we were in our rooms things were fine...until one day I stayed in ill, and left the do not disturb sign on the door. So instead of knocking on the door, housekeeping called me! What do they think do not disturb means?!? Breakfast was fine, nothing exciting. The room and bed were great. The final problem I had with this hotel was when I received a note from them telling me they were charging $250 me for smoking in my room. This was a complete shock to me...since I do not smoke! What a joke. I had to fight with them for over a week to have the fee reversed. Some parts were great, some were okay, and some were just downright awful. Would I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Orchard at the start of our California holiday - and what a great choice we made. Bedrooms and bathrooms are large and well furnished. We were on the 7th floor at the front and heard no traffic noise (and my wife is a very light sleeper), and yet it is only a 2 minute walk from Union Square or Chinatown. Great safe central location only 20 yards from a cable car stop. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the free continental breakfast was good. And we got it for a great rate. What more could you ask for? If you want a large, impersonal (don't recognise you after a week) cookie cutter hotel that has a large smart well furnished reception area and small badly furnished bedrooms (unless you pay top dollars) then don't go for the Orchard. For the rest of you the Orchard will be great.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco treat!”
Reviews.Author: caribtraveler7
Reviews.Content: Great service. Solid location. Decent price. In downtown San Francisco? Sounds like a myth. but it ain't. My wife and I plan to stay there again when we visit. We were in town for the Bay to Breakers race. Here were the hits and misses during our stay: HITS --Rooms were spacious. No problem with tripping over luggage. --They offer a decent selection of DVDs -- for FREE! If the movie's bad, at least you didn't pay for it. --The free breakfast was outstanding. It's not your typical cheap Holiday Inn variety buffet. Make sure you ask for warm croissants. MISSES --The walk from the Powell subway stop was a challenge. It's six blocks away, which isn't too bad if it weren't going uphill. Once you cross Sutter and head upward, prepare to work your legs. Hail a cab if you're not up for a workout. Hint: if you wanna save cash, take the subway to Powell and cab it to the hotel. --Feathers in pillows were a bit worn down. Next time, i'll bring my own.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at The Orchard last week and had a great time. I was not in the room much as i was out and about in the city but i was very impressed with the facilities. The bed was comfortable, bathroom spacious, minibar was plentiful, and plenty of channels on the TV. After reading so many good reviews for this place i was a little apprehensive as it seemed to good to be true but the hotel lived up to its status on trip advisor and i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Started our two week tour of California at the Orchard: what an superb choice.”
Reviews.Author: henryhale
Reviews.Content: Always uncertain of how an hotel will turn out after all the research we can only say that we were delighted with the Orchard. Great position, knowledgeable and helpful staff, clean and spacious bedroom. Minor point; bar closed promptly at 11 p.m. and we do like a 'night cap' drink in a hotel before bed. This was excellent value all round; our first trip to San Francisco and how we want to return to see more and chill out at the Orchard. Keep up the excellent standards seen by us in all areas!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: YTSnout
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Orchard Hotel. It was quiet and we had a large room on the top floor - exactly as requested. The staff were friendly and helpful. The Orchard has an excellent location on a short walk from the shops etc (up a steep hill, but not a problem). Really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: SLB38
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of April, beginning of May. The rooms were excellent, probably the best we stayed in during our twoo week trip. Our room was at the back of the hotel which I was alittle worried about because of the noise mentioned by some of the other reviews, but I have to say that we were not disturbed at anytime during our stay. Also have to say something about the brakfast, was a pleasant suprise to get a good quality European style breakfast with lots of healthy stuff - fruit and croissants etc. No pancakes, waffles or maple syrup in sight! The only negative to this place was the valet paking, now I know its common practice to charge for this service, but it did add a lot to our hotle bill so be careful if you are staying for more than a couple of days. All in all a great place to stay, good rooms, great location, pity about the parking charges.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: CAStein
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at the Orchard Hotel. Still a very nice hotel with friendly professional staff. My third floor room was relatively spacious with attractive hardwood furniture. The marble, well-lit, shower-only bath was spacious as well. The room and public areas were all very clean and well-maintained. I didn't spend a lot of time exploring the hotel facilities, as I was out most of the time enjoying the city. The "just off Union Square" location is definitely a plus. However walking the wrong way puts one a rather dicey seeming area.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard - Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to San Francisco, we chose the Orchard Hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews - it certainly lived up to our expectations. The hotel is close to Union Square and cable cars stop on the street corner, which go to Fisherman's Wharf and other tourist sites. The hotel is exceptionally well maintained. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated, very clean, with a big bed and a large bathroom with a glass shower cubicle. The hotel also offers a delicious complimentary breakfast which consists of fruit juice, tea/coffee, fresh fruit, cereal and assorted pastries. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent hotel, great value, great location, and A1 Service...”
Reviews.Author: raulmiranda
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 3 nights and we were very happy. The location of the hotel is excellent. The cable car is just steps away. The hotel is small, what makes it feel like home. The rooms are very clean and odor free. The bathtub is so clean you can actually eat on it. The hotel uses Aveda products which is a nice touch. The breakfast is included, even though they do not serve hot breakfast which is a minus. The service is impacable. The hotel has a huge selection of the latest DVD movies that you just pick up at the lobby FREE of charge. This is a very unique concept. This touch made all the difference. As you know, movie rental in the top hotels can run up to $20 per movie. Our son was so happy since he saw about 10 movies in our three day stay, not counting the ones my wife and I saw. Since the hotel doesn't have a business center, they have a laptop available right at the reception counter, for guest to surf the web and emails FREE of charge. Nate, one of the receptionist is just fantastic. He gave us tips of what to do in town as well as were to eat. If you're looking for a great Mexican Restaurant, you have to visit Colibri, located just 5 blocks down from the hotel. Bottomline this hotel should get at least 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Amenities, Wonderful Value”
Reviews.Author: NOLAFrank
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at The Orchard for four nights during the week of April 22nd. We had an 8th floor king room overlooking Bush Street and couldn't have been happier w/ our selection. Everyone at the hotel from the doormen to the front desk personnel, to housekeeping was ready, willing, and able to help. When we needed help deciphering the Muni routes, if we needed dinner reservations, whatever we asked for (or they anticipated) was provided w/ the utmost courtesy and professionalism. The room itself was extremely clean, the amenities exactly as described on their web site, and the bed was comfortable (I would've preferred a pillowtop type mattress instead of the firm one, but that's a nit-picky observation). I normally stay at Marriott properties when I travel on business, but for pleasure--and because I was paying out of my pocket--this hotel MORE than met expectations. We booked the package from The Orchard's web site that included parking and when you consider that high-speed internet service is also included at no charge, the price was really a deal. Since Powell Street runs by the hotel a couple of doors down, getting to the city's main attractions was easy. Union Square is an easy 2-block walk (or ride) downhill and Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square can also be reached without changing lines. As an aside, we purchased 3-day muni passes for $15/each that allowed unlimited rides on cable cars and buses throughout the city. We rode all over the city--from Presidio Heights to The Embarcadero and from SoMa to the Haight to Golden Gate Park. With very few exceptions (my wife had her purse pickpocketed, but that's another story), we found the city transportation excellent and accessible. We also took the BART over to Berkeley one day and that too was a simple/pleasant experience. We'd absolutely positively stay at The Orchard again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Quiet Place”
Reviews.Author: Lv2Travel87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard for an extended weekend in Feb. and loved it. Had read all of the reviews and decided to try the Orchard. Location was great. Staying in a room that faced the street, we could see the Cable Cars. Nice big bathrooms. Was glad for the use of hotel umbrellas as it rained a couple times. Front desk could have been more helpful with restaurant recommendations. Within walking distance of so many things. Great breakfast and dessert place on the corner of Bush & Powell. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Frequent travler. This hotel is a very good value. Central location. A place i would only tell my friends about. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: brownbutch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late April 05 after reading Tripadvisor reviews. Very pleased with quality of hotel, friendliness of staff, location, price of rooms etc.. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel special”
Reviews.Author: susan63
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends and I stayed at the Orchard in early April 2005. One had a room to herself and I shared with the other. The location is excellent for enjoying downtown SF. The rooms were a tad small, but normal for SF. The amenities, such as the linens and toiletries, were excellent. The staff is what really makes this hotel special. Every day, we called the concierge to ask for a restaurant recommendation. This, he gave - and he offered to make a reservation for us and get us our cab. There is no doubt he pulled a few strings to get our reservations on such sort notice. His recommendations were wonderful. The doorman/valet was very courteous, smiling and always helpful. They really made us feel more than welcome; we felt very special. The only reasons I did not give this hotel 5 out of 5 are: the breakfast (included) was adequate, but could use more variety, and the room-to-room noise was a bit too much in one of our rooms. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Brookline30something
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for a wedding from April 8-10, 2005. I selected this place after reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor and am happy to confirm that the reviews are accurate! The doorman was very courteous and helpful, the place was spotless, and the bed was heavenly. The price was perfect. Would definitely stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to SF many times and stayed in all the standard "tourist" hotels. The Orchard is a real find and I will be back! Since I had a 1 night Biz trip, I booked at Suite at the Orchard - a fairly large 2 room suite with a gigantic bathroom, 2 TV's, Bar, living room etcc.. For $250, I felt this was a steal!! I even bought that bathrobe at checkout. Staff and service was excellent and the Free Breakfast in the morning was well above average. Location, room decor and the low noise (I was on the 10th floor) were all excellent. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard Was a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: aesparza7
Reviews.Content: After reading the many raving reviews on the Orchard, my boyfriend and I decided to book a room there for a few nights (April 15-17) following a business trip in South San Francisco. I hate to say, but I found myself let down by the Orchard. True enough, the amenities listed on the site and here in reviews are present in every room and great â€“ including the DVD library (as first-timers to SF, we really didnâ€™t spend enough time in the room to watch movies), the comfy bed, a nice pair of robes hanging in the closet, and a charming European-style breakfast included with the room. Still, I checked in expecting much more from the Orchard by way of service. Front desk staff was generally cold. The doorman (who, by the way, never once opened the door for us) seemed indifferent most of the time. Upon our arrival, someone was parked in the unloading zone, so my boyfriend parked a few spaces ahead, whereby the doorman advised us that it was a truck loading zone. When we proceeded to unload our bags and bring them to the room, he then called towing and notified them that our car was parked there! Aside from the amenities listed above, the high points of this place are the location (a mere two blocks from Union Square and a brief journey to Lombard St if youâ€™re brave) and the hotel restaurant/bar the Vignette was quite good and the staff was wonderful. Next time, however, I think weâ€™ll find ourselves staying somewhere a bit nicer, or perhaps weâ€™ll go back to South San Francisco to stay at the wonderfully charming Inn at Oyster Pointâ€¦now THAT was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimandpaco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and would recommend this hotel for future stays. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room I had (2 twins) was good sized and very clean. The beds are platform and quite firm but I found it very comfortable, there is a nice touch of a DVD player with nice stereo speakers and subwoofer in the room for watching movies. They have a small library of DVD's that you can choose from if you don't have your own. The rate I had included a free continental breakfast which was basic but good, I did have a lite dinner one evening in the restaurant and would suggest that it's ok but there is much better food close by. Nice to have the bar for an evening drink before going out or when returning from dinner. The only negative I would mention is that my room happened to be on the ally that runs next to the hotel, not an appealing view which wasn't a big deal but on Monday morning the trash containers in the alley were picked up at 5:00 AM and it was loud enough to wake me. Other than that the room was very quiet. I did self-parking two blocks down the street in the Stockton garage which was very reasonable for rates and easy to walk to and from. The hotel is just above Union Square off Powell so it's a super location to walk to downtown or grab the cable car for a trip over to the wharf. I've stayed in quite a few different hotels in the city and for the money this one would be very hard to beat. Very much recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I discovered The Orchard!”
Reviews.Author: John_in_UK
Reviews.Content: Thanks to this site I discovered this gem of a hotel - which seems to be missing from many guidebooks. Stayed 5 nights from March 29th and had a wonderful time. The location is perfect (we spent 1 night at the Argonaut Hotel on Fisherman's Wharf and although that hotel was also v. good, I much prefer the location of this one). The room & bathroom are generously sized with comfortable beds and all of the staff were courteous. The complimentary continental style breakfast was a perfect start to the day and cooked items were available on request for an additional charge. The public areas of the hotel are fairly small - a small reception lobby and a restaurant/bar area with limited seating but this hardly matters in a boutique hotel of this size. The only negative I could muster was noise (usually around 2am) of garbage collection from the alley behind the hotel - even on the 7th floor this was enough to disturb sleep! Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotels do not have to be chains”
Reviews.Author: jhatman1
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Orchard Hotel. The hotel is in a great location of San Francisco. Easy walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown. This is a small, non-chain hotel. It is relatively new and very clean. The hotel staff were very helpgful and friendly. They could not do enough for you. The room was a good size with a nice bathroom and plenty of closet space. I did not pay attention to other trip advisor reviews and I got a room on a low floor that overlooked a half a dozen garbage dumpsters. The noise did wake me up, but besides that the hotel was very quiet. I would suggest a room on a higher floor and on the street side of hotel. The morning buffet was included and was adequate. I travel a lot and stay mostly at chain hotels. This hotel exceeded my expectations and I am very thankful for the reviews on trip advisor. I would have stayed at a chain hotel if not for trip advisor. I would have paid more at a chain and got less. I would definitely stay at the Orchard Hotel again on next trip to San Fran and recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location ... loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn S
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and cannot fault it. Modern hotel with larger rooms than normal. Sony TV with DVD player (free DVD's available) mini-bar in room which we emptied and put our own stuff in. We requested a nice view so had a room at the front on the 7th floor which was great. Alleyway at back of hotel, so views would not be so great. Located on corner of Powell St tram and 2 blocks from Union Square - fab! Lovely Aveda toiletries and great bathroom. Everything clean and as new. Great comfortable bed with crisp white linen duvet. If you want to use the tram go down to the stop before Union Sq otherwise it's full. Personally, it's ok for tourists but would recommend taxis. Trams were quite expensive $3 one way or $15 for 3 days. Very very busy and not comfortable. Free high-speed internet in room. Complimentary breakfast. Parking expensive everywhere in San Fran. The Orchard charge $34 for 24 hour valet parking. We didn't use the car at all. Very friendly staff. You must stay here for a perfect stay in this fab city. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: escaleraway
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic! Everything was clean. The bed was uncomfortable to me and my mom. The breakfast was so-so! I liked the White Swan's breakfast better. I didn't like how you couldn't bring your food back to the room, if you weren't totally prepared to eat in public either. This hotel had the wing-dings; it just didn't float my boat. Sorry! I didn't like how the fridge was packed with honor bar crap. I stayed on a floor with noisy people too. Next time it's the White Swann for me!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: traveller425b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a weekend sightseeing in San Francisco. We were completely amazed by the excellent value. I can't add anything new to the reviews already on tripadvisor. We chose the hotel based on reviews here and are so glad that we did. I can't find a single fault with this hotel. Beautiful clean rooms, comfortable beds, free high speed internet, fantastic location, friendly staff, reasonable price, cool bar, delicious breakfast included- perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MSP995
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco once or twice a month on business, and spent about 60 nights at the Orchard last year. I have also taken my wife on trips, and recently spent a week at the Orchard with my wife and two young daughters. They have a couple of adjoining rooms which worked well for my family (two bathrooms were a plus...) and I have stayed in a suite that has a sitting room with a pull-out sofa that would work well for small kids. The free breakfast is light but good, and they have a in-house independent restaurants which has an ambitious menu, so room service food is good, though pricey. The beds have fabulous sheets and thick duvets...really comfy. Cool stuff for vacationers: it's right on the Powell Street cable car line, two blocks from Union Square, and two blocks from the Chinatown gate. You can check out an umbrella, there's free high-speed internet, and a nice library of free DVDs (and great speaker systems attached to the TVs). They have an arrangement with a car service which virtually the same price as a taxi (about $45 with tip from the SF airport) and if shared by a group is as cheap as the SuperShuttle (which is $15 a person to the airport). Finally, the staff is wonderful. From the desk staff to the doormen, they are friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. Many have been with the hotel for some time. I travel frequently, but the Orchard is truly home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmgatlanta
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this hotel. Great location, lovely rooms with European flair, very friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: swig4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard this month for 6 nights. We cannot say enough about it! The staff from the housekeepers to bell staff to front desk were helpful and friendly, and went out of their way to help us. Our teens LOVED the free DVD library and surround sound system. The rooms were great, immaculate, good sized and fabulously comfortable beds. The location was absolutely perfect for sightseeing in San Francisco. We actually walked to most of the neighborhoods, but public transportation to the further ones, such as Haight Ashbury and the Mission District, was easy to use and very accessible. It rained every day we were there, but we had such a nice place to come back to after our adventures, it didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Believe It, It's True. The Orchard Is Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: smilerG
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Orchard from the 17-25th March 2005. We picked the Orchard following the reviews on this website. Our local travel agent didn't list the hotel, so we booked direct. From the first moment we walked in I was confident we had made the right choice. Many people on this site have already said many wonderful things about the hotel. All I can say is believe every good word you read, It's all true. I am struggling to find a fault to mention. The staff are all wonderful and always had time to help with all manner of stupid question I was asking! We chose a King Suite, which for the money, was an absolute bargain (Â£150 per night). The room was huge, we could have slept a family of four and still had room to spare. The room was extremely clean and everything always worked. The housekeeping was extremely efficient and we always returned to find the room in perfect condition. My wife and I are normal people who wanted a nice hotel to spend our holiday. By using Trip Advisor we have found a gem of a hotel which our travel agent doesn't even list. More fool them, this is a wonderful hotel. If you want to stay in SF, don't go anywhere else. Believe what you read. It's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This San Francisco gem will not stay secret for long - book early!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in San Francisco in December 2004. We carried out a lot of research on the best place to stay. Our efforts were worthwhile; having scoured the reviews, The Orchard was a diamond discovery. The only problem will be getting a booking here in future. This boutique hotel, a stones throw from Union Square is excellent. We walked to Fishermans Wharf and took the cable car back - very well located and the restaurant is very good. We ate away from the hotel restaurant one day and wished we hadn't! Book early - this place is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and just like the photo!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orchard for three nights in March 05 and the room was just like the photo on their website - big, clean and very comfortable. This is a great hotel and a great location, one block from Union Square and all the shops and within a block of the hotel is: the cable car to Fishermans Wharf (get a three day pass for $15.00, its cheaper than individual tickets); Alamo car rental; laundry services; and a great pizza place across the street (Uncle Vito's) - what more could you ask for? Would recommend and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard is FABulous”
Reviews.Author: PonyOnWheels
Reviews.Content: After trolling through endless sites, I finally visited Trip Advisor where I saw that the Orchard Hotel in San Francisco had received excellent ratings from past visitors. We booked three nights at $162/night AAA rate and we did not regret it. Some things we liked: very nicely decorated room (no garish colors for once), free AVEDA products, free use of lobby computer for email, DVD player in room, free DVD library, free breakfast buffet, nice location close enough to Union Square for convenience but far enough away to be more quiet. Great place. We'd definitely stay there next time we're in SF.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard was great!”
Reviews.Author: TerVisalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Orchard in Feb. 2005 and really enjoyed it. Although it rained off and on while we were there, we had fun anyway. The staff were friendly and the doorman always helpful. Upon arrival we asked if the room was on the street side, originally it was, and it was on the second floor. However they gladly moved us to to a quiet room on the seventh floor. The desk clerk told us that when rooms are booked on the internet they are not always the best rooms available, and that it never hurts to ask. Our room was large and the bathroom huge compared to most hotel rooms. They had free movie rentals, and a decent continental breakfast. We walked two blocks to China town and two blocks to Union square. Parking was $35 a night, but that is the going rate at most places we checked. We will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely loved our stay at the Orchard Hotel. It is tastefully decorated and very comfortable throughout. The use of high quality materials made us feel like we were in a much more expensive hotel. Where other hotels use "hotel grade" furniture and decorations, the Orchard uses quality items that you would want to have in your own home. Our room with a good size, had a large bathroom and a well stocked bar. We also loved the complementary breakfast in the morning. There was good coffee, a choice of juice, fresh fruit salad, cereal, yogurt, scones, and other bakery items. It was the best free breakfast I've had a hotel. The doorman was very helpful and friendly, as were the people front desk. There is also a complimentary DVD movie library with plenty of selections. And the movie was great on the Sony home theatre system and Trinitron TV in our room. I think the only down side to our stay was that our room had a view of an alley, but that wasn't enough to change our opinion of the Orchard. I am definitely staying there the next time I go to San Francisco and I have recommended it to many others.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: lstein
Reviews.Content: Good value for the price. Rooms were clean, big comfortable bed and central location in san francisco. Only gripe is the hotel advertised that it had a gym. In fact the gym was a tiny room with a broken exercise cycle and one treadmill. If exercise is part of your journey might want to look elsewhere. Otherwise a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Touches”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard with our 2 sons during a 2 night stay in San Francisco last June 2004. The hotel was very accomodating and had many extra touches that we appreciated. I consider us both VERY picky when it comes to customer service, quality, and cleanliness of hotels and we were pleasantly surprised during our stay here! We typically stay at the larger chains and was a little nervous about this boutique style hotel but we went with high praises that WE read about the hotel. Now we TRY to find the small boutique hotels with the extra touches and service everywhere we go. We had the kiddos with us so they set up a crib with extra blankets and pillows and the room had plenty of floor space for the crib. Our 2 year old got a little sick so we all cuddled in the BIG COMFY king bed for a day while he recovered. Guess we picked a GREAT place to have to be indoors. The conceirge was great telling us all the best places to go. You can hop right on the cable car outside the hotel and ride down to the shopping district. No strollers on the cable car though. They had a DVD player so we could play the kid movies or rent some for us from the front desk. GREAT PLACE to stay! Would highly recommend it and their sister hotels down the coast. Had we known about them at the time we would have stayed at more along the drive down to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotvl
Reviews.Content: What a great stay!! The hotel was clean, friendly and in the perfect location. The staff was very helpful and always ready to help. We traveled with our 2 children, 3 & 9, and the staff made them feel like kings!! We had a 1 bedroom king suite, and it was spacious so we could put the children to bed and enjoy quiet time. The only downside was the pullout sofa, it needs a better mattress, we put it on the floor. A European style breakfast was included and very good, but if you grew tired of it there were many restaurants within steps of the front door to satisfy you. The Orchard Hotel was a fantastic hotel in the perfect location to step on a cable car, get to work, sight see or go out on the town. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with this hotel that we will go back to.”
Reviews.Author: everlewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a King bed room at the Orchard Feb. 17 - 21st and had a great time. We walked up Powell to the Orchard from the Powell St. BART station - a little long, but doable if you have rolling luggage that is not too heavy. Greeted by Cornell at the door - very friendly and helpful throughout our stay - all the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was great, very comfortable including the bed, which had a nice warm comforter. The pillows on the bed were great also. Not sure what was in them, maybe rice hull? I think I liked them better than my pillow at home. The heating/AC in the room worked great - easy to adjust and remember, in SF you can need AC in Feb. and heat in August. The location was great - two blocks up Nob Hill from Union Square and just steps from the Powell St. cable cars, two blocks up Powell to the California St. cable car - we used both during our stay. Two and a half blocks down to the China Town gate. The room had an iron and an ironing board, and a safe for valuables. We used the free high speed internet with no problem - borrowed an ethernet cable from the desk. If you need a robe, the room had two coton terry cloth robes. The bathroom had nice Aveda toiletries. We used the free buffet breakfast in the restaurant every morning - nice selection of a couple of cold cereals, fresh fruit and yogurt, biscuits, croissants, bread, jam, cream cheese,cold cuts, juice - plenty for our eating habits. There were always umbrellas available to borrow from the desk. We watched a movie on the DVD player in the room - I had brought music CD's that I had compiled and burned at home - it wouldn't play them though. It played purchased CD's just fine. We were on the sixth floor over the street, so we sometimes heard traffic and also garbage trucks emptying dumpsters early on a couple of mornings. You might get a quieter room higher up or on the alley (back) side of the hotel. Otherwise, I think the only way to avoid this in San Franscisco is to stay high up in a tower such as at the Hilton, St. Francis, Nikko, or Mark Hopkins, or of course, at the Fairmont. For our part, after six or seven visits to SF, my wife and I agree that we will go back to the Orchard - we think it's the best in this price range. I am attaching a photo that I took of the room. I think it compares well with the hotel's own photos on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews: This hotel is that good!”
Reviews.Author: WickedWahine
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I enjoyed a wonderful night at the Orchard on 2/19/2005. We live in the Bay Area but like to stay over in the City when there for special occasions. This particular weekend was the Chinese New Year Parade and Festival and The Orchard Hotel puts you in the heart of it all. Where to start? We arrived at 1:00 p.m. on Saturday afternoon and expected only to park our car and return later to check-in. We were greeted warmly by the doorman (and somewhat of a legend) James the second we pulled up to the curb. Imagine our surprise when we walked into the lobby and were told a room was not only ready for us - that we were being upgraded at no charge to a King Suite!!! Considering the already-great AAA rate of $144 a night we received, this was a wonderful surprise. Check-in took about three minutes total and we excitedly headed upstairs. We were put in Room #601, a lovely suite with great bay window views of Bush & Powell Streets and all the way down to Kearny Street. You could even see the Grant Street gate leading into Chinatown. It was on the sixth floor right next to the elevator. We were concerned by this for all of about one minute, as we discovered immediately that you couldn't hear a THING outside the room once the door was closed - not even the icemaker next door! Street noise was barely audible as well. If the wonderful sound of clanging bells of cable cars aggravates you, I don't suggest staying elsewhere - I suggest not staying in San Francisco at all! It's an endearing feature of this great city! The room was absolutely spotless. Floors, carpeting, furniture and walls were all spic and span. The bathroom was scrubbed clean and everything smelled very fresh. It had both a tub and a large shower and was well-stocked with big fluffy towels and Aveda bath products, which I really enjoyed using up. The furniture was all lovely and in great shape and the bed super comfortable. I do recommend watching your shins on the corners of the bed, as has been noted here before - since the beds are on a platform there are sharp corners at shin-height just waiting to make contact with your legs if you aren't careful. The duvet was soooo thick and comfortable, and there were extra pillows in the closet along with two great big cozy robes. The minibar and snack drawer were packed with a great assortment of drinks and snacks. The televisions in both rooms were large Sonys with great sound. We honestly could not find ONE thing to speak critically of, and as often as we travel we usually do find something not to our liking wherever we go - but The Orchard successfully stumped us and left us both feeling very pampered and happy during our far-too-short stay. The entire staff was polite and friendly and James had great recommendations for places to dine out. Cornell brought our car around within a few minutes upon check-out on Sunday afternoon and even offered to pack the trunk for us. My one regret is not remembering the name of the front desk clerk who checked us in on Saturday - she was polite and efficient all at once and I feel bad I cannot name her by name here. We both enjoyed The Orchard Hotel so much that we are already looking for excuses to stay over in early March when friends from London come to visit. They had a reservation at another Union Square hotel but will be canceling it in favor of staying at the Orchard now, thanks to the wonderful service we received from this first-class establishment. The Orchard Hotel is a world-class hotel disguised as a smaller boutique property. Take my word as well as the hundreds of other satisfied guests here. Book your stay here and you won't regret it. Michelle and Eric

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Alverson1
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful vacation we had at the Orchard Hotel. We loved having a non-smoking environment. Everyone at the hotel was exceptionally helpful and nice. It was polished service and I can't say enough about the doormen James and Cornell. James met us when we arrived and we looked forward to seeing him each day with suggestions and directions. He is a plus for any hotel. Cornell helped us each evening with ideas and even helped us with our DVD player. Food was great and our rooms were wonderful. I would stay there again and would suggest this to anyone planning on visiting San Francisco. The location is a plus, with cablecars stopping at our hotel, walking distance to Chinatown, Union Square department stores, and many restaurants. Orchard Hotel has my vote...

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back and can't say enough wonderful things about the Orchard Hotel. I will definitely return there. The location is good and the price was right ($150 per night AAA rate). The hotel is beautiful and new, built in 2000. Rooms are very nicely appointed and very quiet. Continental breakfast comes with the room and internet access on a laptop attached to the front desk is free. Newpapers including SF Chronical, Wallstreet Journal and Financial News are free (not just USA today). DVDs can be checked out at the desk at no charge. James, the doorman/concierge was wonderful. He offered to have the hotel towncar take me to pick up my rental car when I left. My companion, who joined me in Sonoma the next day, was taken to the Sonoma Airporter pickup stop by the towncar as well. We did eat in the restaurant one night and really enjoyed it. I had a perfectly prepared filet with vegetables and my companion had a pork dish, which he said was perfect. We had drinks at the bar on other nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - great service, location, room, restaurant, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: boatmusdir
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights this February (2005) - the hotel is in a great location, with very helpful staff, excellent breakfast, fine dining in the restaurant, and spacious quiet spotless rooms. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience...”
Reviews.Author: rayamac
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 8 day stay at the Orchard and cannot say enough about the attentive staff, wonderful service, roomy and clean accomodations!!! There was not one thing we could find fault with and will certainly stay at The Orchard on any subsequent San Francisco trips. Our thanks to all of the staff for their part in a magical vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Orchard Hotel! The staff was extraordinary! The room was fantastic. . great linens and very clean! The nightly turndown service was such a nice treat! And the continental breakfast just hit the spot! Thank you thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked The Orchard Hotel for a business trip I had the week of 1/17/05. I ended up staying for an extra night to explore SF and wine country with my boyfriend. I did a lot of research before my trip and could've picked ANY hotel in the city but decided to go with this elegant and charming boutique hotel. Let me tell you, it is the BEST in SF from what I heard and seen. The rooms are spacious, clean, well-decorated, and most importantly COMFORTABLE. The bathroom is clean. I didn't have a separate shower and tub like others who have reviewed this hotel but I didn't mind this at all. Free internet access and movies made my stay so much better. You definitely get value for your money at the Orchard. It is in a really great location. Can't be beat. We rented a car about three blocks away to go to Napa and Sonoma. Highly recommend it!!! It was totally worth it. My boyfriend and I fell in love with SF and the wine country!! Wouldn't stay anywhere else but the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard more than lived up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: errant
Reviews.Content: Thanks to recommendations on Trip Advisor, we stayed at the Orchard in a suite this past week for two nights. It was wonderful and exceeded our expectations. At first I was a little hesitant because the suite (room 801) was right beside the elevator. This wasn't a problem, however, and we didn't hear any noise from it at all. The bathroom was huge and was stocked with Aveda products. The shower was separate from the bathtub and was very spacious. The room was nicely decorated and the king size bed was extremely comfortable. One quibble about hotels in general --- use fitted sheets! I HATE it when the bottom sheets slips off, exposing you to the bare mattress. Ugh. This happens at the Westin too. Internet connectivity/DSL was free. The hotel also had complimentary DVDs -- from suspense to comedy, kids' fare to drama -- and very current titles. The suite also came with a CD player -- you have to bring your own music -- and two TVs. The mini bar was amply stocked as was a drawer filled with necessities you could buy. We paid $259 USD for the suite and it's well worth every penny when you're travelling with a child. The average room cost, I believe, is about $159 USD. In terms of location, it was perfect. The hotel was on the corner of Bush and Powell, minutes from Union Square, Chinatown and right on the cable car line. Breakfast was included -- European style. The concierges and the front desk staff were wonderful and went out of their way to help us out. This is definitely our home away from home in San Francisco. We loved it! One last thing -- we found a great little Italian restaurant on lower Columbus Avenue (15 Columbus) called La Gondola. The phone number is ---------. The food was delicious. Also, if you're in the mood for some quick Mexican, there's a little hole in the wall restaurant -- only four tables -- just up the street from the Orchard on the same side of Bush. The food was fab. Leslie

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bkeith2
Reviews.Content: I took the comments on here and booked 2 nights at this hotel. My wife and I were totally happy with this hotel. Great room, very clean, quiet, really nice food, came with a light breakfast, free DVD movies, free calling card usuage, free internet. Plus, the fact that it is a newer hotel and you just walk outside to catch the cable car. We arrived early in the day all wet from the rain and they had no problem giving us our room before the 3pm check-in. When we return to San Francisco we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: justnotgraspingit
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at this great little hotel between the 9-14 december, our room was on the 9th floor and the room was always spotless the staff were always polite and friendly and were always willing to help We would recomend this hotel without hesitation as an ideal base for those people who like to be near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of the rave reviews on this site. I am pleased to say that this hotel lived up to the great reviews it received. Not only were the rooms large, very nicely decorated & renovated w/ very nice bathrooms - but the staff was exceptional across the board. Highly recommend staying here & will do so myself next time I have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Quirks of a small chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: fcfrag
Reviews.Content: The good news is that the Orchard is not a Hyatt. The bad news is that the Orchard is not a Hyatt. Let me point out that I enjoyed my stay at the Orchard (12/4/04-12/6/04) and plan to stay there again. But I will do so fully aware of the hotel's quirks. The hotel has the intimate feel of a boutique hotel without the tiny claustrophobic European-style rooms so commonly found in such hotels. And I enjoyed the many features one would not likely find at a deluxe chain such as a Hyatt or an Intercontinental. For example, the staff was exceptionally friendly (though not particularly professional, see below), and the continental breakfast was a bonus (with one caveat). I also enjoyed the large TV, full array of cable channels, and full in-room stereo (including subwoofer) that one would not likely find at a large chain. But we also had a few minor negative experiences that I would not expect at a deluxe chain. On checking in my wife and I were given a room with two small full sized beds instead of the king bed I reserved and paid for last August. The first desk clerk indicated that it was all she had even though the hotel was not full. Only upon moving up the food chain and discussing the situation with a more senior clerk/manager was an appropriate room found, albeit one next to the elevator and absent a bathtub (shower only). While the bed was comfortable, the two tiny pillows were inadequate and the sharp bed frame corners mentioned by other reviewers were found repeatedly by my wife. I was most disturbed by the lack of adequate soundproofing in the windows. From our room at the back of the hotel every early-morning-dumpster-emptying in the alley we faced reverberated thoughout the room. There was no need for this as proper windows would have alleviated the problem. Further regarding the service, on our second morning the restaurant server attempted to seat us at the first table just inside the doorway. We were reluctantly allowed to sit at a table farther back in the less than half-full room. This annoyance may be the reason our server never returned with the only thing we ordered from her (juice). And the one cup of coffee we were served at seating must have been our entire ration as well. Curiously, the only time our server did return was with a check for $0.00 with a line for a tip on it. Finally, on our second night most of the towels disappeared from our bathroom. Even though we had hung up our towels for reuse (California water shortage), all but two of our towels were taken and not replaced. Upon questioning the desk clerk on checkout we were told that there was a towel shortage that day. Very strange. The bottom line is that I liked The Orchard and I'll stay there again. On balance I liked it better that the larger SF hotels I've tried. I just won't expect it to be as professionally packaged and I won't be surprised by a few minor inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in May 04. The rooms are excellent. Having stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels across the country I would have to say the rooms up to par and equiped with the best furnishings. (Sony CD stereo, Sony TV, Down comforter/pillows etc). The rooms are very clean and up to date. We had a suite so the room was very large. The staff is very nice and helpful. The only thing that can be a bit of a pain is finding parking while trying to check in. (The holel is located on a busy road and they have limited spots for people waiting to checking) The valet service was excellent and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in December 2004. I booked Orchard based on reviews here and glad I did. It's been very good experience. Very nice room. Comfortable bed. Sony TV and DVD in the room. Nice, big bathroom. Aveda shampoo, etc. Good service (check in, check out, shuttle arrangements, room cleaning). It's all just too good for $150 a night in SF... The only thing that was not perfect is furniture was chipped in places if you look really close. But it's a nice furniture, and I understand they can't replace it every time it scratched...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being highly critical of hotels in general, I chose the Orchard Hotel based on the reviews I read here. From the start the Orchard never ceased to amaze me with their great service. Be it a "Welcome back to the hotel, Sir" (whenever I came back from a day out) or the fantastic rooms. For the price I paid, I got far more than I expected. Free DVD's for the in-room DVD player, being able to play my own CD's and extensive TV channels. Many people may say it's only a place to sleep; but hey I personally enjoy comfort when I have been out roaming the city all day long. Should it be raining or I don't feel like going out on the streets when the weather is less than perfect, I found my hotel room to be an oasis. There are also laptops for rent at the frontdesk ($20 per hour), which may seem steep, but there are no internet cafes or facilities in the immediate vicinity that I could find, so I gladly paid it. The rooms are large, well equiped and clearly well maintained - no nasty surprises waiting for you. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would gladly stay there again when I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: saturn0022
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard Hotel from 10/30/04 through 11/02/04 for my 40th birthday. For me, the hotel is in a perfect location. Right next to the Powell/Market cable line which brings you to Fisherman's Wharf (the only reason to take it down there really is to go to Alcatraz). But, Market Street is well within walking distance (just 5 blocks away) and from there you can catch a bus or subway to anywhere in the city. So, location is excellent. As far as the homeless than some mention, yes, you will see a few from time to time, however, I was never once approached by any of them. Listen, this is San Francisco, and, sadly, homelessness is part of the scene no matter where you go in the City. If you go into Haight/Ashbury you'll really see what homelessness is all about - and I loved the Haight/Ashbury area. They are people like everyone else. They don't bother you. Enough about that. Union Square is literally just two blocks away. The Sunday morning I was there they had an art festival/exhibit. It was great. Lots of local artists. There are also a vast variety of restaurants/bars in very close proximity to The Orchard. OK. The hotel itself was great. Very courteous front desk staff and doormen. I had a room on the 8th floor overlooking the corner of Powell and Bush Streets. What more could you ask for? I could watch the cable cars run through the intersection every few minutes. Ask for a higher floor on Bush Street and you won't be disappointed (no street-level noise and great views). I thought the bed was very comfortable, but you know, everybody has their own opinion on what a comfortable bed is based on firmness. I will warn you, however, be prepared to ask for at least 2 additional pillows. They provide 4 pillows (for a king size) and they are tiny and flat. That is really my biggest complaint, but not really a complaint since they promptly provided me with the additional pillows, which ended up being enough for me to sleep comfortably. An additional note about the bed. The matresses lie upon a wood frame. Because of the configuration of the room, I banged my shin on the corner of the wood frame (nearest the desk) at least 5 times. (I wouldn't have been a good subject for Pavlov - LOL). My right shin was black and blue, but I finally started being careful on the second day and didn't do anymore damage! The room was very clean. The bathroom in perfect working order and very clean. And free high speed internet access (just ask the front desk for an ethernet cable if you don't bring one with you... they are free of charge as long as you return them when you leave)... what more could you ask for? This was my first trip to SF in 20 years. I will be going back in a couple of months and I will be staying at The Orchard again. If you are looking for turn-down service, kiss-your-*** service, mints on your pillow and stuff like that go to the Ritz. But, if you want a reasonably priced hotel with great service and clean, well-equiped rooms with good views in a great part of the City, stay at the Orchard. That's my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: BobBerg
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in over twenty San Francisco hotels the past 20-25 years - from the super expensive to the moderate class. Without doubt, this is the best hotel in town - regardless of price. We have already booked a repeat stay in 2005 and The Orchard will be our Hotel of Choice in San Francisco from now on - great location, great staff, superb furnishings, room size and location. What more could one ask for ? Cheers ~ The Bergs Cheshire, CT

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay great in house restaraunt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about hotel and staff was just great. We especially liked the down sheet comforter on the bed. The hotel restaraunt has recently changed ownership the new name is Vignette and the food is quite exceptional and reasonably priced. We highly reccomend both the hotel and restaraunt when you go to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD DO IT AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The orchard met all my expectations. My friend and I stayed there at the end of May 2004 and would choose this hotel again. We are not hotel people and usually dread hotel stays...but this one was well money spent. The lobby is decieving because there really isn't one. However, our room more than made up for it. We had a room on the 10th floor corner...it was spacious and the bathroom was even more spacious. Loved the aveda products in the bathroom-that was a nice extra. The bed turn down service was also an add'l benefit. They even offer a selection of DVD movies (relatively new) to watch in your room if you come home a bit early on evening. its close to the shopping, but a hike to everything else (warf, golden gate bridge, park). We are big walkers so it was okay for us. Overall, the orchard hotel is a great comfortable place to stay even for us non-hotel people.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.....”
Reviews.Author: Oceanlvr97
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week in SF and stayed at the Orchard Hotel on Powell/Bush. Great place to stay. Close to public transportation. A quiet hotel with a nice room and HUGE bathroom. They also have CD/DVD players in the rooms and access to "borrow" from their DVD collection (free). I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a girl's weekend and was very pleased with both the staff and the accomodations. The hotel is just far enough from Union Square to be quiet, but absolutely close enough to be near all the shopping and restaurants. The rooms were well decorated and the furnishings comfortable. It was very clean and the bathroom was pretty good size. We really appreciated the free DVD library as well. As for the staff, check in/out was quick and painless. In addition, the doorman was great! Very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was more than adequate and I was surprised at the quality of breads and pastries that they provided. I would most certainly stay at this hotel again and for the price, I would consider it to be one of the best bargains in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Hotel: stay near the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: GQtraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Orchard in November. The hotel is one block from Union Square, close enough to the action (shopping, restaurants, theaters), yet far enough away to be very quiet at night. Double-paned windows keep the noise out. However, there is garbage pick-up in the morning that might disturb a light sleeper. Front desk and bell staff, both at check-in and check out, are very friendly and helpful. We were allowed a late check out so we could shop in the morning prior to our departure. Complimentary continental breakfast was reduced from our previous stay, yet still sufficient for our needs: juices, muffins, fruit, coffee. Breakfast served in hotel restaurant, Vignette. Restaurant was very quiet at night, despite the fact that the hotel was filled to capacity. Complimentary DVD rental also a plus. Rooms, bathrooms are clean; nightly turndown service available. We had just two pillows for as king bed. Ask for extra pillows. Be sure to get a room away from the elevator and stair case. Valet parking. Need to give 15-20 minute notice to have car available for pick up. Plan accordingly. Good value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely long weekend at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Grek
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at the Orchard Nov 13-17. The room was spacious and quiet, the bathroom spotless, and the location fabulous. We made use of a lot of the 'extras'--complimentary dvds (great), car service (great), complimentary breakfast (eh. .. .). Our flight schedule meant we needed to check in early and check out late, both of which were graciously accommodated. A couple things to note--bring a laptop, as in-room dsl is free; beds are hard but not uncomfortable (ask for extra pillows). Linens are mostly very good, but not consistently so there was invariably one scratchy pillowcase or a rough sheet in with the lovely Frette bedding. Staff was competent. This is a bit petty, but I had mentioned when I made the reservation that we would be celebrating our 10th anniversary, so I was a little disappointed that there wasn't so much as a 'congratulations, thanks for staying with us' card in our room. But, for this price, I'm not complaining about the details. All in all the Orchard is a great hotel. We got a $119 rate as quoted on quikbook (we booked it through the hotel itself, not the website). Not as luxe as some, not as trendy as some, but for that price, the location and ameneties can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about The Orchard Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: TripBlazer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orchard Hotel largely because nearly every review on TripAdvisor was 5-star. What's the big deal? Yes, the rooms were decent, but no better than many other hotels I've seen. In fact, the first room they put me in was on the 3rd floor with a wonderful view of a building wall across the street and dumpsters on the street. (Of course, in SF it's hard to tell whether you're looking at garbage bins or just the normal street trash; this is one of the dirtiest cities this side of New Orleans.) Getting back to the hotel itself, I arrived around 7:00 pm -- not particularly late -- and was greeted by the doorman. Checked in and asked about a restaurant recommendation, and was told I could call the "concierge" when I got to my room. I did, but all buttons on the phone lead to the front desk, no matter which department you think you're calling. The front desk person said the "concierge" was on a break and would call me back in 5 minutes. I did get a call back in 5 minutes, but the "concierge" sounded suspiciously like the doorman who had carried my bag into the hotel. When I asked for a recommendation of a Thai restaurant, he said "Oh, you want Asian food?" No, Thai food. He couldn't think of a Thai restaurant in the area. So I gave him the list I'd printed out from the Internet. He wasn't familiar with any of them. I ended up finding a nice Thai place just three blocks away that this "concierge/doorman" apparently had never noticed. As for cleanliness, I used the tag to indicate that I wanted them to change the bed linens, but it was clear that they had not done so when I returned. In fact, when I checked the bathroom, they hadn't cleaned the toilet, either. So I can't give the maid service high marks, either. Decent hotel, quiet, good location, but I certainly did not feel pampered or feel that they had their act together on guest services. I'd like a concierge who is more familiar with the restaurants in the area than I am, and a maid service that actually cleans my room thoroughly. Oh, one more thing: The "exercise room" is just a 2nd-floor hotel room -- just like any other room in the hotel -- with 3 pieces of equipment and a water cooler. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had an absolutely awesome time staying here. Our room felt deluxe, even though the hotel is boutique. We appreciated the DVD collection, the excellent door service, and the breakfast was a pleasure. Be sure to check out the Farralon restaurant a block or so away--you will be BLOWN away. It was the dinner of a lifetime. Awesome trip. Be aware hotel is near Union Square, lots of homeless people asking for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BESnow
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Orchard Hotel 10/16/04-10/19/04. This was probably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The entire staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The room was of adequate size, exceptionally clean and nicely decorated. The breakfast buffet was very nice. The location was ideal and in a very safe area. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to others. Brian Snow

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was ideal with easy access to the Trolley. The staff was extremely accommodating. The concierge recommended a wonderful restaurant and made our dinner reservations before our arrival. The room was very comfortable and clean. Lots of extras including surround sound. Bring your favorite CD's! My one and only suggestion: Adding Downey to the towels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berta1010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Orchard from October 8th to the 15th and what a pleasant experience it was ! From the moment we arrived we were made to feel at home by James the concierge who should soon become a San Francisco Landmark. The rest of the staff is also very friendly and polite. The Hotel is extremely well kept; this may have to do with the fact that the owner keeps a close eye on the place at all times. Yes! the elderly Chinese lady you see every morning in the restaurant is indeed the owner of the place. I forgot her name but you will not miss her, she is always there. I am only sorry that I found out about her on our last day there, I would have loved to compliment her in person. The rooms are immaculately clean and nicely decorated. Bathroom, although not huge, was bigger than some hotel rooms I have stayed in in NYC. Bed was very comfortable also. Breakfast is included in the price and though not hearty it is fine for an early morning start. Who needs a huge breakfast when you have so much to do and see anyway? All in all great EXPERIENCE !! My only regret is that I did not get as good a deal price wise as others who have written; the average seems to be $150.00; we paid $180.00 which I still find reasonable for the accomodations though. The location "two blocks away from everything" like James says more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value in SF”
Reviews.Author: tm6510
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel from Nov 2 - Nov 4, 2004. I was in SF for business and wanted to find a hotel near the BART, but also for less than $200. I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and they were accurate. The place was clean, good service, very nice rooms, and overall met my expectations. The breakfast was ok. Just fruit, a cereal and some pasrties. But hey, for free, it was definitely worth it :) I also thought it was nice to have DVD players in all the rooms and the ability to borrow DVDs for free from the front desk. The walk from the Powell Bart station was a bit of an uphill climb (you have to walk about 6 blocks, the last two blocks being a bit steep (that is the only reason I do not give this hotel a 5/5, since access to the BART was necessary for this trip. The other reason I gave the hotel a 4/5, is that they do not use two sheets on the bed. They have a botton sheet, but then provide a feather comforter, but no top sheet, b/t you and the comforter. It as soft and fine, but a bit strange. Overall, if you need to stay in a hotel near downtown (Market Street), need access to the BART, Union Square, and want to pay less than $200, THIS IS THE WAY TO GO.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Excellent price/Benefit ratio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Orchard during our 30 days trip to california. This was one of the best hotels we've stayed. Great location, great decoration, great rooms and bathroom, great service and very honest price. We stayed from september 4 to 9. Continental breakfast was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: nallen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard during the fall of 2003 for a long weekend. We were a little wary about hotels because since I live in New York I understand how hard it can be to find a decent hotel even after you spend the nearly 200 per nite (ahem.. Crowne Plaza..ahem). We chose the Orchard because it was so high up on tripadvsisors list and it was so affordable- actually it was #1 then. When we got there we could hardly believed that we'd paid so little for so much. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated and it doesn't look generic or like a hospital a.k.a where youre afraid to touch the walls. The staff helped us with any questions we had. We rented movies from the front desk for free. And since I got sick during our stay it was really nice to have all of the comforts of home. The cleaning staff came in twice a day. The bell men were extremely nice. The hotel is located about 5 mins away from the huge cluster of other hotels and about 5 footsteps away from the trolley stop. I rave about it and I want there to be an Orchard in every city. I think its the best hotel I've been to- and I've been to many. And the price isnt bad either!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard is a peach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the smaller, botique hotel! Only complaint...our room at the back of the hotel was noisy. We were awaken by trash trucks at 2, 5, and 6 in the morning. Can't beat the free breakfast and the location. The doormen were great! Restaurant at night was slow and dessert not too good, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: sconmi
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay Oct. 8-10. Rooms well decorated, very nice and quiet (facing Bush St.). Doorman was excellent with advice and hailing cabs. Only complaints: slow breakfast service, no on-site hot tub and exercise equipment. Would definitely stay there again. Found the best rate during a busy convention weekend on the SF visitors website using my Visa card. The hotel's and other internet booking sites were all pricier.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and location”
Reviews.Author: concrdtvl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely wonderful, from the doorman to the front desk and restaurant. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to San Francisco, LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. We just wish we had stayed longer. Breakfast was great, and everyone wanted to help you get around and do whatever they could for your visit to San Francisco. If you get on the cable car do it early in the morning 9:00am and you will get on late in the afternoon is tough.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: fins823
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a virtually flawless stay at the Orchard. As mentioned previously, James, the doorman/concierge is awesome!! He gave us free 3-day transportation passes that another guest had left behind and helped us with many requests. Very nice rooms, liked the sleep CD, clean bathrooms. Front desk staff very nice and the CD collection was good. Like others have said, the breakfast that is included is good for a few days, but had we stayed there longer, we would have ventured elsewhere for something more hearty. They did have more hearty things available for an extra cost, but eggs, potatoes and bacon were about $11! Stuck with the free breakfast items. I agree that the waitstaff was a bit slow, since it took forever to get orange juice refills, but it wasn't that big of a problem. Overall, I would definitely recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this place! No Strikers!”
Reviews.Author: candace59
Reviews.Content: I am one of those crazy people who sits up for hours in the middle of the night reading reviews on this site. I want to know everything before I travel and find personal recommendations much more believable than a travel agent who has never actually been to the place they are sending you. Anyway, I chose The Orchard Hotel over all the other more prestigious places known to San Francisco and WOW were we happy we did! We stayed October 3-7 and when we arrived found out there was a Hotel strike going on all over the city. Workers were banging pots and pans 24 hours a day in front of 17 hotels but not at the Orchard! Even the best of hotels were striking. Although we did feel bad for the strikers we were happy to find out that the Orchard is not Union! We had peace and quiet in the night and happy employees there.
