It is such a wonderful location- and in the center of everthing but quiet. Can't beat the price at 149.00 a night with a great breakfast included and wonderful service! Beautiful clean room and big bathroom. King bed was hard though- I'm used to soft. Free internet access in your room. One suggestion though- we rented a car and never used it- parking down at pier 9 is only $14.00 a day- we paid 30.00/day plus tips so if you want to save its worth it. Don't go to Sausilito- it's boring there. Don't eat at Sears Breakfast restaurant- serious rip-off and worst breakfast ever! Get tickets to Beach Blanket Babylon show on-line cause its sold out weeks in advance, and don't forget to eat dungeness crabs at wharf! Can't wait to go back with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable mattress, good sleep”
Reviews.Author: christine888
Reviews.Content: We live in the Bay Area and decided at the last minute to have a one-night getaway in the City for our anniversary. We chose to try Orchard because of the good reviews we've read and affordable room rate. Overall, we had a good stay. To start out, the hotel has pre-assigned our room and left a red wine bottle and 4-piece box of chocolate on the top of the bar counter which was a thougthful touch. Though it didn't feel personalized like some top hotels with your names in a card signed and welcomed by the manager, which was all right. Didn't experience the turn-down service as listed in the inclusives. Pros: Like the other previous tripadvisor reviewers have mentioned: Sometimes you could get very affordable rates, good location in walking distance minutes to the foot of Chinatown and Union Square and other downtown areas, but the location is less noisy than those areas. The famed Masa's restaurant is across the street. Many inclusives like free internet access, DVD player with free DVD rental at the front desk. It really felt like home because we found out the in-room Sony TV is similar to ours at home and used the same remote control; lots of TV channels including free HBO. The room & bathroom are of medium comfortable sizes, not small like other city hotels. The hotel claims all rooms are of the same sizes. The booking agent was friendly and helpful, so were the front desk staffs and bellmen. And the mattress was one of the most comfortable ones we've ever experienced in hotel beds. It sit on a solid wood plateform bed frame. We had a good rest. Cons: We used tripadvisor hoping to find a good rate and it was all sold out and also checked the hotel's own website which listed very desirable valuable packages. But I couldn't book on line so I called the hotel directly only to be told that those packages weren't available because it was a conference week and few rooms were left -- Demand and supply. I'd recommend the hotel to get the Specials page off if that's the case. Thin door: You could hear the noises from the hallway. Thin-walled restrooms: You could hear next door's turning on/off the facet. Parking fee is $30 plus tax that runs up to $34.00. Those are minor details and shouldn't affect one's pleasant stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming experience”
Reviews.Author: svicious22
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat underwhelmed by my recent experience at this hotel and can only grudgingly give this hotel three stars. The location is good and the (very average sized) rooms are nicely decorated and reasonably quiet considering the traffic outside. The staff, however, proved to be a mixed bag ranging from professional and courteous to mildly unpolished to downright cold and unaccomodating. You could certainly do much worse, but my experience there did not live up to the rave reviews this place has received by many Tripadvisor users in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel for four nights (August 26 - 30, 2004). This was the second time we have stayed in this hotel and it was a great experience both times. The hotel rooms are spacious and well appointed with quality furnishings and attention to detail. The location is great .. next to the Cable Car and within a couple of blocks of Union Square. We originally found the Orchard Hotel through Trip Advisor .. and we were certainly not disappointed. We have recommended this hotel to our friends and will definately stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Katinaboo
Reviews.Content: After reading all the fantastic reviews, my boyfriend and I chose the Orchard Hotel to stay at during a recent trip to San Francisco. We weren't disappointed, in fact we were quite gobsmacked! For the money we paid (a special deal on the hotel's website, $160 with continental breakfast included and 3rd night half price) the standard was amazing. Georgeous, enormous room, massive bathroom with lovely Aveda toiletries and very tasteful decoration. The bed was deliciously comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They even have a DVD library where you can borrow from a wide selection for free! Believe me, you couldn't get a shoebox of a room in London for that kind of money! Top top it all, the location is fantastic - 2 minutes from Union Square and right by a tram stop that will take you to all the sights. Just a few food related recommendations! For late night hunger pangs and a truly kitsch dining experience try Laurie's Diner, just down the street toward union square, which has a pink cadillac in the middle of it and boufanted waitresses! or the great pizza place accross the street (can't remember what it's called). The Orchard is a great place and i'd highly recommend it for any SF visits. Top marks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Orchard!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard last week and loved it!!! We arrived at 11:00 am fully expecting to store our luggage and come back later, but they had a room ready for us. :) And what a nice room it was - huge, spotless, and comfortable. We loved the bathroom, the robes, dvd player, aveda products, relaxation dvd, turn down service, lighting, decor, and continental breakfast. Plus, the location is ideal. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, and to SBC Park. The staff was great too. They always greeted you when you returned to the hotel, and went out of their way to get you anything you needed. My husband goes to San Francisco a lot for business and he usually stays at the Hyatt or the Westin, but he already booked another stay at the Orchard for next week. Great boutique hotel!! P.S. Uncle Vito's restaurant (kitty corner to the Orchard) is authentic Italian and very reasonable.:)

Reviews.Title: “Orchard excellent, Roxanne Resturant stay away !”
Reviews.Author: 3_Cliffs_uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just superb. Excellent location and very helpfull staff. Do NOT go to the resturant just up from the Orchard called Roxanne. It's a complete rip off, the staff are rude and the food was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl
Reviews.Content: Best location and reasonable rates! Situated between Nob Hill and Union Square, and very close to main bus and trolley lines. Within walking distance of Chinatown and North Beach. We preferred to be away from the hubbub of Fisherman's Wharf, yet still accessible via trolley. We booked online, stayed for 4 nights, and cont'l bkfst was included. Rooms were very clean, service was good and the staff was very helpful. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Big Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Courteous and efficient hotel staff, beautiful rooms with upgraded ammenities, a super-cool restaurant/bar and a first class complementary continental breakfast. The room rates are extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel from 26 Aug to 4 Sept 04. The hotel is in an excellent location, with the cable car stop 10 yards away on the corner or Bush and Powell. Also 3 blocks away from Market and 5th which is where all the trains and buses leave from. Our room was King sized and very large, clean and well equipted. The staff are very friendly and James on the door was a great character. We extended our stay and was lucky that the room was still free, towards the end of our trip the hotel was fully booked. So book in advance as they are getting popular. The breakfast buffet was continential and there was plenty of fresh fruit and pastries. We got up early so we had our pick of the food selection. Highly recommended, we will be happy to recommend and return on our next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in most every way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day stay at the Orchard and found it to be the perfect hotel for our needs, which didn't include a lot of the ameneties larger hotes might have to offer, but did include what we needed most including; a helpful friendly staff, a great location close enough to walk to most everything we wanted including Chinatown, Union Square, Northbeach, and if you didn't mind walking, Fisherman's Wharf was only a couple of steep hills away. Also, Steven the manager (owner?) was very friendly and accomodating to all the guest. The breakfast buffet was another great thing, and best of all the rooms had great beds and were very well insulated from outside noise which was much appreciated after a lot of long tiring days. One tip I would offer is if you can, get a room facing Bush St. which is a little quieter than those on the other side of the hotel (but Steven assured us he was working with the city to correct the noise problem on the "back side" of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “OrchardDelight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I frequently visit my corporate office in SF and have stayed at many hotels in the heart of SF. In August, I made my first stay at The Orchard and now will always attempt to stay there on future trips. The hotel is beautiful. The staff are very professional, hospitable, and friendly. The rooms are very modern and comfortable. Not to mention that the hotel is near Union Square, and close to many restaurants, which is helpful for the business traveler. I couldnâ€™t have been more pleased with my 6-night stay in SF. I canâ€™t wait for my next trip, and my stay at The Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in S.F.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orchard Hotel the end of August. A real hidden jewel! Friendly staff, great room decor & immaculate; would definitely stay again & recommend it. Also, in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “No rotten apples here!”
Reviews.Author: obsessiveplanner
Reviews.Content: Entirely concur with prior positive comments. Wonderful staff, comfortable and immaculate room with great bed and comforters, liked the dvd loan extra, yummy breakfast, perfect location. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Orchard Hotel in late August. I booked the hotel in part based on the reviews on tripadvisor and in part because of the very reasonable rate for San Francisco. The hotel is lovely. If you are into the boutique hotel experience the Orchard will not disappoint. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful. The doormen and front desk staff particularly stood out. The room was clean and well appointed. If there is anything to fuss about the shower heads are a bit too low for tall people and there aren't any comfortable chairs to sit on in the room. But, frankly who wants to stay in the room when you're in San Francisco? Too much to do and too much to see. The bed was very comfortable and I enjoyed the duvet cover rather than wrestling with a sheet. The bathroom was very large and well lit. Not much for a view from our room, but you just can't quibble about a small thing like that. The hotel is in a great location. Many great places to eat in a several block radius. The room rate included a continental style breakfast in the morning. Was fine for a couple days, then we wanted some variety. The Orchard is very deserving of the accolades it has received on this site. If you want a personal touch the Orchard is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Option in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Sunlounger63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights from 24th August after reading Tripadvisor reports and were delighted with our experience. A great location, just three minutes walk from either China Town or Union Square and thirty yards from, but not on, the cable car route which travels directly to Fisherman's Wharf. Owner Mrs Wong's General Manager, Stefan, heads a very friendly and efficient team whose quality impresses from concierge and front desk personel through to housekeeping. The 250 square ft. rooms are larger and as well appointed as many 5 star properties and the hotel's town car is available to guests at regular taxi rates. With the hotel's 'special seasonal offer' averaging $137.50 per night for two people including breakfast it's not hard to see how, for us, this 'boutique' experience was the perfect counterbalance to a few days of energetic exploration in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard for a week and it was the best hotel we have ever stayed at. The room was spotless and we really enjoyed using the DVD player. I liked the CD left in the room, which played soothing music, to help me sleep. The best part of this hotel was the staff!!! It was a delight to have such personal and friendly service throughout our stay. I must single out JAMES-you are the best!!! He helped us with all of our questions, found walking tours for us, and was just an overall wonderful man!!! We will always stay here when we are visiting SF.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Price Quality”
Reviews.Author: BRC333
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently enjoyed 5 nights at the Orchard Hotel after reading the great reviews on tripadvisor.com. The price/quality of this boutique hotel is incredible. We would be happy if we could find a hotel like this in every city we travel to. The hotel is only 4 years old and centrally located in Nob Hill. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Go for a higher floor room facing Bush Street. It was great having dinner in North Beach, picking up a bottle of wine on the way back and then relaxing in the room watching one of the many DVDs the hotel makes available to its guests. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in San Francisco and chose the Orchard Hotel. We are defintiely glad we did. What a great location, the service was like none other. Everyone we came in contact with was friendly and helpful. Special kudos to Cornell at the door and Don behind the front desk. Rooms were spacious, Aveda products in the baths, very nice. The only small negative for us was the beds were harder than we prefer. For some this is a plus! You can't go wrong here! As a final note, Phils limo service was fun and went beyond the call of duty to help us have a blast in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: LaNonna
Reviews.Content: Just returned, 8/21/04, from a week at The Orchard. The room was lovely and spotless. The staff at every level was warm, helpful and professional. Great location. One of our best hotel experiences ever.

Reviews.Title: “A JEM!!!”
Reviews.Author: Belle6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel from July 26 to July 30. Everything about this small hotel is wonderful. It is only 2 years old. The rooms are spacious and immaculate, as are the beautiful bathrooms. The beds are so comfortable, and there are NO DIRTY BEDSPREADS on the beds! They have duvets on the beds that are washed after each guest departs. The hotel staff was so helpful and friendly. The price was incredible at $149 a night. We will definitely stay here whenever we visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A Rare Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard Hotel from the 5th - 8th of August. I researched San Francisco hotels and found the reviews of the Orchard to be very accurate. My business requires frequent overnight travel and as a result I have become very particular about my accommocations. We found the Orchard Hotel to be located very conveniently to Union Square and the Cable Cars. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was very chic, clean and comfortable. We did not have the opportunity to dine in the restaurant, however the continental breakfast was very ample and delicious. On my next visit to San Francisco, I would consider staying nowhere else but the Orchard. As a matter of fact, I picked up a couple of flyers in the lobby and realized that the owner also has a hotel in Monterey and Napa Valley. Based upon our wonderful experience at the Orchard, we will without a doubt stay at one of their other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed based off the reviews. Loved it and the location. Price was very reasonable and the property is new. Free access to DVDs was a nice plus. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place - Hip, Great Location. Excellent staff and value!”
Reviews.Author: erthompson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend at The Orchard Hotel. We're from the South Bay and just wanted a weekend getaway that was not far from home. We also wanted it to be somewhat affordable. That's hard to find in SF. BUT, we found THE place. The room was gorgeous, spacious and even loaned you free DVD's to watch in your room. Surprisingly the movies were very current. Other pluses, the staff were ALL excellent and friendly. The place was spotlessly clean and the breakfast was generous for being continental. The only downside was the view from our room was nothing special but otherwise it was a perfect hideaway right in the middle of Union Square. I would return any time I visit SF for an evening. The price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the favourable comments on this website - our recent 5 night-stay at the Orchard Hotel was excellent. The door staff are, to a man, outstanding - James, Bob and Cornell could not have been more professional, helpful and down to earth. The rest of the staff were also excellent. I do agree with the recent comments about the breakfast however - it's poorly presented and perhaps the weakest point of the hotel. However, if you look upon the breakfast as a bonus (it is complimentary after all), then these comments are rather harsh. I would be delighted to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value, great service, outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and overall, was very impressed, particularly given the price, which included a very nice breakfast each day. The rooms were stylish, very clean, and we were upgraded to suite, which had a king size bed and a separate living room with a couch with a pull out bed (not bad for $179/night). The location couldn't have been better, but what really set it apart, was the overall service of the staff, outstanding! The doorman/consierge, James, was a real charmer and knew the city inside and out. Book this hotel, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: peteandsue.turner
Reviews.Content: well located two blocks from Union Square. Easy access to shopping and public transport. The hotel was booked because of comments on this website and our suite on the 10th floor was spacious and quiet. The only downside was the 'free' continental breakfast served in the restaurant. Poor in quality and choice and displayed with zero finesse. This certainly put me off dining in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Another positive review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel and found it to be a great value. Friendly staff; clean, spacious rooms and bathrooms; and a wonderful location, within walking distance to so much, and right next to a cable car stop. The free breakfast was nice, but after 2 mornings, I was ready for something heartier. It's great for a lite start, but it is by no means extensive.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spike66
Reviews.Content: I would like to add my praise for the Orchard Hotel. We just returned from 6 nights there and found it to be the most wonderful hotel. The room was large, immaculate, with beautiful furniture. The bathroom was spacious with plenty of counter space. The doormen and desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The location was perfect - 2 blocks from Union Square, Chinatown, Nob Hill, 1 block from bus to North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf. There was an extensive free breakfast in their lovely restaurant. This is the best place to stay in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for three nights, July 10-13. You get a lot of hotel for the $ here; the rooms are nicely furnished and spacious and the staff is great. Plus free breakfast and only two blocks from Union Square. Free DVDs too!

Reviews.Title: “Top marks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of previous reviews and wasn't disappointed. I can't fault anything about this hotel - perfect location; super-friendly staff; large, clean room (with state-of-the-art entertainment system!); and great value at $149 a night. Parking is $30 per day - although I'm told that this is standard for San Francisco. My wife, a travel journalist, says this is one of the best hotels she's ever stayed in anywhere in the world, and I find it hard to disagree. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard is top”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is a fantastic find in San Francisco. We went there after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Rooms are a good size with excellent facilities. The staff are very helpful and friendly. This boutique hotel has a fantastic location, just off Powell Street and a couple of blocks from Union Square. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely 3 night stay at the Orchard which is located in the heart of San Francisco (Union Square). The Hotel is very elegant. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. Aveda products in the bathroom - very nice! Robes & coffee is also provided in the rooms. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, especially the Doormen. The dining area is lovely and their breakfast was delightful. Great Coffee. We will definitely return to the Orchard on our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel was great. We researched the hotels before making reservations and per the reviews read on TripAdvisor we decided upon The Orchard Hotel and was not disappointed. The room was a good size, bathroom was spacious as well, all staff was very friendly. It is located perfectly to be able to reach everything you'd want to get to pretty easily, but not so in the middle of the action that it's too loud. We would suggest this hotel to anyone that is going to San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Beautiful room, great b'fast, good location”
Reviews.Author: tbmumey
Reviews.Content: Really can't add anything to what has been said. Great hotel, very friendly staff, great room & bed, great breakfast, good location, etc. etc. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: cambria
Reviews.Content: Location convenient, rooms comfortable, staff helpful. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JChused
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard in late June and was absolutely delighted with the room and the service. The high speed internet connection was better than our DSL line at home, the bed was wonderfully comfortable, and the breakfast quite good. We were particularly pleased with James' suggestion re. returning to the airport, as we had to leave SF during the gay pride parade. He reserved a car for us, and the driver was able to get us to the airport without any delay. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Orchard for an anniversary trip to San Francisco. Loved every minute of the trip and the stay! The reviews on Tripadvisor led me to book this hotel and it met all our expectations. I got a better rate booking through the hotel instead of Expedia. The room was very comfortable and the amenities are as described. We were on the third floor facing Bush (busy street) and it was very quiet. The continental breakfast was ample and the lobby Web access was very handy. The staff was friendly and helpful...James IS the man! We loved San Francisco and plan to return. When we do, we'll definitely stay at the Orchard! Tips: 1) The MUNI pass is the best way to go to get around the city. You can buy them at the baggage claim information booth at the airport. 2) If you like pizza and pasta, check out Uncle Vito's Pizza kitty corner to the hotel on Bush and Powell.

Reviews.Title: “Other Trip Advisor users were right on the mark!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely stay at this hotel. It is in a very central location, clean, comfortable, nice amenities in room, spacious bathroom, very nice european continental breakfast buffet (juices, fresh fruit, breads, croissants, cold cuts and cheeses) in the hotelâ€™s restaurant. We were there for 3 days in May at a rate of $139, which included breakfast, booked through hotelâ€™s website. I thought this was a good rate, for a new hotel, built from the ground up a few years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: milepig
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great location at a good price. Not "the best hotel I"ve ever stayed in" as one reviewer points out, but very nice. The room itself reminded me of deluxe room in a high-class chain hotel. Staff war friendly, and I certainly appreciated the good breakfast that was included in the price. My room was very quiet, I never heard a sound once my door was closed at night, although the hotel seemed to be full. Wonderful feather bedding, a nice chair, and a good work desk with DSL access included in my room rate. The WIFI never worked for me, but the DSL was fine. A good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are correct - the doormen are friendly; the bathroom is large; the rooms are quite large (compared to other SF hotels); the DVD library is nice and the TV's stereo system is great, and breakfast included helps you start your day. And no-one mentioned the lovely duvets on the beds. However, we were emailed that we'd have a non-adjoining room with a view. Our view was of fire escapes, an alley and pigeon droppings. A higher room was offered but was adjoining. The room was quiet except for the garbage removal one morning. The breakfast includes mostly meats and cheese and as you have to eat by 10 a.m., it was too early for that for me. The bathrobes we never used. It's a good hotel, but a bit pricey for what you ultimately get. Were booked for 10 nights, stayed only 4 and moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently took a cross country trip from Georgia to California and we stayed at the Orchard Hotel May 12-15. This was our first trip to San Francisco and the hotel was just as everyone's reviews said. Not a 5 star, but very nice with lovely furnishings. One note, if you like a top sheet on your bed, ask for it at check in. The beds only come with a cotton down comforter. The housekeeping manager said that most of the people that stayed there didn't use the top sheet, so they quit putting them on the beds. They were extremely accomadating when we asked for the extra sheets and couldn't have been nicer! Even gave us extra pillows. As for the rest of the staff, hats off to James the doorman. He is a gem! Always ready to help you out. The complimentary breakfast is more than we expected, the same every day, but nice with fruit, croissants, hard boiled eggs, etc. I would recommend the Orchard to anyone that just wants a nice place to stay, not too fancy, but certainly a lovely hotel in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: OxfordGirlOxfordUK
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel was simply wonderful, we picked it after all the great reviews on here, we only stayed one night but the staff were so friendly, the breakfast grand and given I am known to be Miss Picky I couldn't find a thing to fault, my husband almost died of the shock. A wonderful find and thanks Tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have had a better experience”
Reviews.Author: VBGuy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Orchard late in the afternoon for a three day stay. We were greeted by a very cheerful and helpful doorman, Cornelius. This was the beginning of our wonderful stay at the Orchard. Our room was exactly as requested and ready for us. It was bright, very clean, nicely decorated and the Avenda shampoo/conditioner products were a nice touch. The Orchard has it all, great location (near Union Square and Chinatown), free DVD, high speed internet access, friendly helpful staff and excellent rooms. I would absolutely stay there again and would highly recommend it. *** A special thanks to Nathan for helping us by providing starch.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a lovely trip from San Francisco and a great experience at the Orchard. We indulge ourselves every spring with a short three night trip and a stay at an upscale hotel is our priority. We chose the Orchard based on tripadvisor's reviewers and for that we thank all of you. The Orchard has a lot going for it: good location, clean and well appointed rooms, but it's biggest asset is the staff. Everyone of them will make eye contact, smile and make the appropriate greeting. Other perks were complimentary breakfast, dvds and a good selection of morning dailies. All these add up to a comfortable and lovely stay at a hotel that I'll definitely return to. They accommodated my request for an early check-in and a room without an adjoining door. Special thanks to Nate, Ava and James. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay at again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the Orchard based on location and online hype. Good location, the rest is hype. Our reservation for 2 double rooms was not kept, instead we were given 1 double and 1 king. Beds are ROCK hard. Rude front desk, had to argue at great length to get room situation corrected for 2nd and 3rd night of our stay. Breakfast was ok, just hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal and toast. (Go instead to Mama's on Washington Sq.) Nothing special...except the exceptionally rude staff during breakfast. On the other hand, the rooms were clean and nicely decortated, but we sure could not get past those AWFUL beds. Will not bother to stay there again. One very bright note...FANTASTIC doormen that always had GREAT suggestions and huge smiles on their faces...especially Cornelius.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: lovesaruba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Orchard Hotel at the end of April. We found the reviews we had read were accurate. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Rooms accomodating comfortable bed and clean. We took advantage a couple of evenings taking out the DVD's and appreciated the newspaper in the mornings. Location was great with plenty of shopping near and close to the cable cars. We took the short walk to China Town and Little Italy. Would definatelly stay here again and recommed it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Grert Location, bad room”
Reviews.Author: ajbike
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at the Orchard while touring Central California and for the most part our experience was quite good. First the good news, the location is perfect, just steps from the cable car line, only a quick block from Union square and all its shopping and restaurants and the neighborhood is very safe for walking. The rooms are a nice size for a city hotel and the bed is really comfortable, unfortunately we were "unlucky" (booked through an internet discount site coincidence?) to get a room on floor two above the bar/restaurant and wouldnt you know there was a wedding reception that was VERY loud till 1 or 2 in the morning, while the staff was very apologetic, no discount was offered. the one saving grace was the sleep cd in each room, we put it in the player and were quickly lulled to sleep, now I was I would of purchased it. I would defenitely stay at the Orchard again but would insist on a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: katylevin
Reviews.Content: We stayed April 26th, and are sad that we only had one night. It is without a doubt, the finest small hotel in SF. I love the personal service, and James is the man. He was such a delight , always there with a smile and a song. We loved everything about this place, and I am very hard to please. I travel all over the world, and wish there were more Orchard hotels out there. Thank you to everyone. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babidoll
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend Easter weekend; Great service (James was the man); nice comfy room and all ameneties. Restaurant and shop in walking distance (a car won't be needed; if so, parking is costly, about $30/day). Will return again

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: jv282
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is WONDERFUL! I stayed there for three nights and enjoyed everything about the hotel: 1. location- about a 5 minute walk to the montgomory BART station, great restaurants are all along Bush street to grab a bite, 3 minute walk to Union Station 2. room- good size, spacious bathroom, Aveda bath products were a plus, extremely comfortable bed, free and fast internet in the room, DVD player with great stereo system 3. service- everyone was so patient and friendly 4. free breakfast- can't be beat for the price of the hotel, quality, and its location. I highly recommend The Orchard Hotel for your next San Francisco stay- whether for business or pleasure. I plan to stay there for all my future SF trips. There's a reason it's #1 on TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard is Top Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orchard with my daughter for 2 weeks. The hotel is brilliant and the staff are all excellent. The location is ideal for access to Union Square and Chinatown and you are seconds away from the Powell Street Cable Car line that takes you to most other places you'll want to visit. Our room was top quality and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: Barrett
Reviews.Content: Great location. Wonderfully intimate. Large bathroom. Terrific food in the restaurant. Friendly, helpful personnel. Comfy bed with down comforter. Even a CD to lull you to sleep. Everyone eager to please. Recieved all my messages, and faxes promtply. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I can't say enough good things about The Orchard. After spending a lot of time researching, we picked San Francisco and The Orchard for the second leg of our honeymoon. From the minute we stepped onto the curb to the minute we stepped off, they delivered as promised. By design or luck we where put in the best suite in the house. The room was great. The bed, sitting room and bathroom gave it an apartment feel. The location to shopping and the trolley line was excellent. Last but not least, the employees where wonderful. They sent us wine and candy as well as set us up with trips and things to do. James is the Superman everyone writes about, however Gabe in the bar, is not to be outdone. On our last night, Gabe even gave us a limo ride around town. Watch out ladies because he's a bit of a ladies man. If you have a chance please tell him the couple from Kansas said "HI".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you that this hotel is absolutely wonderful. The staff and I mean everyone that we had contact with from the front desk to the doorman to the valet parking attendant takes care of you as if you were their best friend. They seem to treat everyone this way. They were always able to answer our questions, help us with what we needed and very handy with directions on where ever we wanted to go. The room we had was very very nice. The beds were very comfortable and the down blankets were soooo warm and cozy. The room service was excellent. We had ordered from the hotel restaurant and the food was great! I cannot say enough good things about the Orchard. We will stay there again when in San Francisco. No question.

Reviews.Title: “90% great!”
Reviews.Author: ohcharten
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the great reviews it has received on this website and others. In brief, we were very happy with the atmosphere, location, service, cleanliness, and amenities. Our only disappointment occured when guests occupied the room next door...because our rooms were adjoining, the noise level through the "adjoining" doors was the worst I've experienced in a hotel (we could literally hear every word spoken by our neighbors). So, I'd definitely recommend asking for a non-adjoining room if you like quiet and privacy! Other than that, loved the place and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service...good room with 5 star amenitites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the friendly service. Good continental breakfast...really convenient in the morning to walk down. I had requested them a top floor and they made sure on my arrival i was given at the 10th floor. Like the Aveda products and huge clean bathroom. Very narrow window to look outside yet it was nice to be able to see the close proximity of the city view. There were clean robes everyday in the room...loved the down comforter...I also like the access of DSL at the reception. Nice to have DVD & CD players to entertain just when i was tired from the long city tours. I would really recommend people to stay here ...because I surely would.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had a wonderful time on our trip March 7-9 at the Orchard & although there were a couple of 'cons' to go along with the many pros of this hotel, we would definitely come back again. We booked through the Orchard's website and paid $149.00 per night (AAA rate) for a king deluxe room and this included valet parking for two nights & free breakfast. I requested a high floor as far from the street as possible with a street view, in case of noise. We received a floor on the 9th floor (there are only 10 floors) with street view and it was nice and quiet. Our car was always brought around within 20 minutes of our calling down for it. The room was clean, large and nicely furnished. The two feather pillows provided were awful and far too small for the king bed so after the first night, I called housekeeping for better pillows and 5 minutes later I was brought three larger (much better) pillows and we slept so much better that night. The surround sound system was sort of a waste since all the speakers were crowded on a shelf together above the TV. The bathroom was large by S.F. standards and the quartz(?) countertops & marble tile inlay in the ceramic tile floor was a nice touch. The blowdryer was fairly worthless to me, however, so consider bringing your own if you want to dry your hair in less than an hour's time. I found the continental breakfast was great although my husband had actually hoped for pasteries which were not on the tables either morning - just mini muffins, bagels and croissants along with the many other things mentioned in other reviews. The staff was friendly, greeting us and smiling each time we headed in or out of the elevators and the absolutely best feature of this hotel would have to be the LOCATION. Just around the corner from the Powell cable car stop and just two blocks up the hill from Union Square. Very convenient. Great stay, good price, wonderful weather.....another satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: yummymummy1
Reviews.Content: Agree with several of the comments posted - this hotel has a really great location.For 5 star I was expecting something a little more swankier to be honest - (this was the start of our honeymoon) - The rooms are very nice, very spacious - but there is something missing that doesn't make this hotel feel 4 star even.as we were leaving we found a pair of mens shoes under the bed - obviously not been cleaned properly!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location but a warning on food”
Reviews.Author: anthonyuk
Reviews.Content: Much of it has been said in these reviews before, but I was really impressed with this hotel. I will definitely stay here whenever I visit San Francisco again. I found the best rates for this hotel on its own website ($129 per night including continental breakfast). The rooms do not look quite like the photos on the website (which seem more "atmospheric" than the actual thing). The doormen were really friendly and helpful though, as has also been mentioned in a number of the reviews. The free DVD library was also great. Although we were in full tourist mode - trying to see everything we could in the 4 days we stayed - it was nice to come back to the room and put on a DVD and watch it at our leisure over a couple of days. Aveda products in the bathroom were a very nice touch. In terms of location, this is excellent. Just near Union Square with all the shops and the cable car stop is literally on the hotel's doorstep. You can easily walk the distance from Powell Street although the last block is quite steep. A couple of warnings, both relating to food. I really enjoyed the breakfast here. It was continental - cereals, fruit, hard boiled eggs, cold cut meats, cute little mini-muffins and bagels and the like - so don't expect the frieds eggs and bacon. I was there for four nights and the breakfasts, although good, did start to get boring as they were exactly the same every morning. I actually heard one guest ask if the breakfast ever changed. The hotel waiter said it did relatively often, at which time the guest retorted that he had stayed there 5 nights so far and not a single thing had changed! A small blemish though. The other thing has nothing to do with this hotel, but more to do with San Francisco generally. In London, I am used to being able to get get dinner whenever I want it. On a couple of occasions, we tried to go out for dinner after 9pm only to have pretty much every good restaurant be closed. It was admittedly during the week, but I was shocked that I could not dine at that time of night. At many of the top restaurants in London, a 10pm sitting is not at all unusual. Thankfully, if you are caught in a similar situation, there is a little Italian pizza/pasta place on the opposite corner to the hotel, that did seem to serve food until after 11pm. It saved us on two occasions!

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Deal...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I planned a long weekend in SF with a day spa. I chose the Orchard Hotel based upon the reviews on this site. It was ok. It was definately nothing impressive and I can't say that it would be fair to mention a 4 star and this place as the same. The doorman was extra helpful/funny. The room was clean and bathroom large. Not much else to report other than the 5.1 stereo. The stereo system sat atop the TV so ALL the speakers were jumbled in the same spot. The setup was a total waste and is just hype. Some nice things can be said though. The price is fair and it's located on the cable line which is VERY convenient. It's cool that they offer free DVD's. Parking is $30 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel. Loved the beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orchard in July 2003 and just loved it. Although the room we had seemed to have tiny little beds - I didn't mind it one bit. The linens and bedding were so comfortable - I didn't even mind being snuggled up with my husband. Beautiful hotel. Great location. Just top notch all the way. I loved it! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric1037
Reviews.Content: I just (2/16) returned from staying at the Orchard Hotel. It was an incredible experience. I selected this hotel after reading several reviews but also because my girlfriend and I travel a lot. We are very hard to please. The staff of the Orchard was excellent. Special mention should go to Nate Rogers (front desk) and Cornell Richmond (doorman/everyman). We requested a suite and were very pleased. The room was perfect, large and ready when we got there. The bathrooms are spacious and obviously well thought out. A earlier review mentioned the long car wait. We experienced the same issue. When we asked what was to the problem. We found out that 50 people were checking out with a three time frame. The hotel also uses a car service. So the speed of car retrieval is not completely under their control. A frequent problem at any SF hotel is street noise We were on the third floor and except for the cable car, noise was not an problem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were three suburbanite couples in San Francisco for a weekend. I booked 3 rooms at the Orchard Hotel through Orbitz at a great rate. All six of us were happy with the hotel--the rooms are tastefully decorated and comfortable. King-size beds have firm mattress, down comforter, and down pillows. The location was wonderful--we walked to China Town, Union Square, shopping at Saks, dinner at Le Central, etc. The doormen were very helpful. Valet parking is $30 extra. We'll make the Orchard our San Francisco base.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique Hotel, Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: kauaijunkee
Reviews.Content: January 17th I took my family on a surprise trip to San Francisco. I found Orchard Hotel on this website and all those wonderful reviews are true. I have stayed at a lot of business class and boutique hotels and this one has it all. I booked the hotel directly the day before since I had seen on their website that they had a King Suite but no availability for that room was showing. They even gave me a $20 discount. The room was large by SF standards, the bed confortable and breakfast tasty. They would not allow me to bring breakfast up to my room for my pajama clad children..but they could deliver it (at a fee which I was not about to pay for a bagel!) Also, you can self park your car one block down on Stockton and save probably close to $20 over valet.

Reviews.Title: “A wise decision.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on Valentine?s Night. We had a great experience. The staff was all nice enough, and our late night request for more pillows was answered with our choice of feather or synthetic fill, and there within minutes. The beds are great!! So many nights I've stayed in hotels with hopelessly unsupportive beds and woke up with a sore back. These beds are extremely comfortable, especially with the down comforter. Very conveniently located near Union Square. We had our car parked on arrival and relied on taxis to get around town. So much more relaxing in the city when you don't have to drive to an unfamiliar address and fight traffic and the consistently unavailable parking. The front door attendant was extremely helpful in getting us a taxi in a very busy area on a very busy night. The rooms are stocked with tons of goodies in the honor bar and at what I thought were reasonable prices. We did enjoy our half bottle of quaffable Champagne for only $20. The only part that left me a little disappointed was the free breakfast. They told us that a free breakfast was included with the room, but it was no big deal, it was just a continental breakfast. When they left out the part about it being continental, I had grand visions of choice omelets and French toast smothered in powder sugar and real maple syrup. No such luck. Oh well. Over all I thought that the accommodations were nice and reasonably priced. The rooms were adequately sized with a huge bathroom. It would be nice to have a spa tub for this price, but the water was hot, the pressure was good and the soaps smelled great, so the shower was enough. The thick terry robes are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newengtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard over the weekend of Feb 6 - 8 and were very impressed with everything. We especially liked the large glass shower. Special touches we noted in the room decor: unique pictures on the walls, and a large framed mirror in the bathroom. The high speed DSL was a plus, as was the DVD player and free movies (but ask early for the movie you want). The European continental breakfast was plentiful and good, even for an Atkins eater. On a cold rainy night, rather than going out we decided to try the restaurant, and discovered that it could easily be a destination restaurant rather than a fall-back. We will recommend this hotel to others, and will definitely stay here when in San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michaelangelo760
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed this hotel very much. First off the location is GREAT! Close to Chinatown, and Union Square, if you want, take a short 10-15 minute cable car ride, which stops right outside the hotel, to North Beach, the Wharf or many of the other neighborhoods in the area. A cab ride to the Wharf runs about $10 with tip, so if it's cold or your in a hurry to get somewhere, hop in a cab and your on your way. The property is close walking distance to Chinatown, Macy's, Neimans, and all the great shopping in Union Square. My wife having forgotten an item found it very fortuante to have such great shops available to complete her outfit for the night, we hustled down to Macy's got what she needed, giggled all the way back up the hill and rewarded ourselves with a Margarita on the walk back to the hotel. Though the neighborhood at first glance seems crusty, it is all part of the quiet and charming part of San Francisco, you become just part of the neighborhood. The hotel is fine, but nothing to shout about, it's all about charm, quick elevators, easy access to the many neighborhoods, the helpful staff, comfortable rooms, simple breakfast, Again, location is what we were looking for, when you're trying to cram as much as you can into 2 1/2 days this is a great choice. If you're looking for a quiet getaway weekend, stay here, if you're used to the Hilton's, Hyatt's etc, you'll hate this place. Two nights, with air from San Diego ran us $500 on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not as awesome as it is reviewed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Jan 30-Feb 1 2004. We stayed at this hotel based on reviews found on this website. Not a 5 star hotel (I think not even a 4 star hotel). Thinks we liked: * Location: Dowtown, close to transportation, tourist places, financial institutions. * Staff: Friendly, helpful, kind, willing to help you. * Bathroom: HUGE!!! Nice tiles. Aveda products * Breakfast: Complimentary and varied. * Portable crib available at no price. Thinks we did not like: * THEY CHARGE LOCAL PHONE CALLS!!! * THEY CHARGE AN ADDITIONAL ENERGY SURCHARGE, WHAT?????? * Small bedroom (King bed) * Awful bed, not enough pillows. * Tight space between bed, nighstand, desk, entry, etc. Conclusion: TIGHT!!! * Mildew found in bathroom. No fan in bathroom. Would I stay there again for $110 a night (discounted price!!!)? I would really think about it. Maybe I would try another one for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road”
Reviews.Author: DCFrequentFlier
Reviews.Content: I selected Orchard based on these reviews. I think the same person wrote all of them. The Orchard is a nice little hotel. Nice. Not luxurious. Definitely not 5 star. I think the reviews made the Orchard sound far better than it really it. The Orchard is a nice hotel for a reasonable price. Nice. Not luxurious. I'll walk you through my stay. It is extremely well located. You are mere blocks from lots of great places. The cable car stops at the corner. BART is just down the street. The exterior is pleasant enough. The lobby is small but it does have a great sculpture in it. The rooms.. well, let's just say they are great for a 3 star hotel. They do not remotely compare to a 5 star hotel. I had a small suite. Small. You open the door and there's a small entryway. Yellow and white striped wallpaper. A rather stained neutral patterned carpet. The living area of my suite was tiny. The furniture was nice but a tad worn for a relatively new hotel. The large TV and DVD/CD player with surround sound were nice touches. There was also a wet bar with the mini bar built in. But did I mention the area was small? The bedroom was larger than the living area but there were a few annoying things. Only a couple of pillows on a not-very-comfortable bed. A nightstand with a lamp on one side. A side table with no lamp on the other. No waste basket. Again, the DVD/CD player was a nice touch. Bathroom. Large.. big bathtub.. separate shower.. lots of space. But I'm picky and the grout was showing a little too much mildew for my taste. I also thought to myselt.. too much wasted space in the bathroom. On the other hand, the Aveda products were great. Overall.. the entire suite was maybe 500 feet? And yes, I could hear the cable cars. Now I give the staff a lot of credit. Everyone was friendly.. helpful.. chatty. When I asked for a banana at breakfast, someone from the kitchen staff went and found me one. Speaking of the breakfast.. coffee awful.. juice great. And for a continental, it has a lot of variety.. including cheeses and cold cuts that make a lovely bagel broiler. Would I stay there again? Probably not. But I also didn't mind when I paid my bill.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard Dec 29-Jan 1st for the first leg of our honeymoon. The staff were outstanding, gave great recommendations for activities and dining, never steered us wrong. The management sent us a bottle of wine on our first night after hearing we were on our honeymoon...a very nice touch. The beds were comfortable, rooms spacious and housekeeping meticulous. The bathrooms were much larger than most downtown hotels. Location was prime, within walking distance to almost everything (just a few blocks from Chinatown). Would definitely stay here again, in fact, would plan a trip just to stay in this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Orchard Hotel 29 December for 2 nights. The staff are second to none and always ready to give a helping hand, especially the doormen. The rooms are very well appointed, probably the best appointed rooms on my whole trip. One nice touch was a proper stainless ice-bucket - not the usual plastic. The minibar and dry goods are superb and not too overpriced. All in all, an excellent stay and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended-No worries”
Reviews.Author: WestVanMan
Reviews.Content: First, the only wrinkle in our stay at the Orchard. We (family of 4 incl. 2 teens) checked into the Orchard around 9PM a coupel of days before Labor Day weekend. It's very conveniently located a block and a half up the hill from Union Square. We had booked our room on the internet and received a email reply confirmation that, at the rate we requested, our family would be accommodated in a standard room. When we checked in, the Orchard's print-out of our reservation only showed two adults for the room, which as it turned out is all a standard room can accommodate. We had no choice but to upgrade to a full one bedroom suite which was all that was left that could accommodate 4 persons. Needless to say, we didn't really budget for another $60 per night for the larger room. That was the bad part. I'm not sure where the fault originated from. Best to confirm internet bookings with a follow up call direct with the hotel. That having been said, the one bedroom suite was marvelous and huge with everything very well appointed (the Orchard gave us a very reasonable break on the rack rate they would normally charge). As I am an architect, and a pretty discerning one at that, I would say the appointments, interior design, materials, furnishings and overall quality are all very well done and that's something I very rarely say. It's not Four Seasons level, but it's very close at less than half the price. This quality is not just limited to the rooms, but includes the Lobby, elevator cab and Dining Room as well. The front desk staff are very friendly and are well groomed. The Dining Room, where we only had the complimentary breakfasts (afterall you're in San Francisco!) is very comfortable and spacious. The food at breakfast, while not outstanding in terms of the menu and degree of preparation required to put it on, was of good quality, fresh and with enough variety to keep anybody happy (although more varieties of fresh fruit for me would have been the icing on the cake). If you rent a car, parking is a killer at $30 per night, but then you're in S. F. which is not car friendly in the downtown area. Assuming our initial reservation problems were not the fault of the hotel, the Orchard rates 5 out of 5 for value, presentation and quality. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPro35
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great staff, breakfast great but it seemed we always arrived just before everything was being replenished. Great Location with a cable car that you can take up and down the hill if the walk is too much. Not sure what the regular rooms are like, but if you can afford a suite, do it, you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, ok location”
Reviews.Author: sandiegonative
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after reading some of the reviews on this site. Good hotel at reasonable price. Location great for shopping but fairly far to financial district which is where we were going (for work). Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Maaaahvelous !! Great room and a great price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from celebrating our 2nd honeymoon in SFO. After searching several websites, I decided to take the advice that was offered on TripAdvisor and booked the Orchard Hotel for 4 nights. I don't regret it a bit! This was an excellent choice. Our stay was nothing short of fantastic. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. I let them know it was our anniversary and they set us up in a lovely room on the 9th floor. The only street noise we heard was from the cable cars but that was expected since the stop was right at the corner of Bush & Powell. This stopped after midnight. The location is very convenient. It is central to all the public transportation. We took the BART from SFO Int'l right to Market and then walked up to Bush. Be aware that the walk up from Market is not for the faint of heart. It is a substantial incline if you are out of shape :-) We crammed in as much sight seeing as possible and the Orchard's location made it easy to get to all of the major attractions and then some. The DVD library was a very pleasant perk. The collection is quite good and we never had a problem borrowing a movie. The continental breakfast was also convenient, especially if you're looking for a quick bite to eat before you hit the road. For a quick change and a full breakfast, try Lori's on Powell (2 locations). I wouldn't recommend Roxanne's (on the corner of Bush and Powell) ... it's overpriced and smells funny. Our rooms were well appointed. If I had one complaint it would be the mattress .... it was a little too hard for our taste. I highly recommend The Orchard Hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: CindyStPaul
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed at the Orchard in early November and found it lived up to all the rave reviews we found on this site. Wonderfully convenient to Union Square; Starbucks two blocks away. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are large by San Francisco standards and very well appointed. Huge glassed in showers a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Was Right!”
Reviews.Author: SLReed
Reviews.Content: I found out about the Orchard from Trip Advisor. I was extremely pleased with my entire experience. Great location near the cable cars, good rates, and wonderfully appointed, comfortable rooms. The staff was very helpful with directions and any other requests. The DVD selection was also great. The only downside is the restaurant, which serves a mundane breakfast, and its rude staff. However, one complaint to the hotel manager and the waiter's attitude was much improved the next day. I highly recommend this hidden jewel.
